title: No effective customer service for fraud!
review:
Up to $600 of my money has been stolen through this app via fraud, and Uber is unable to help. Big company cares very little for my major security concerns.

After my account was hacked, Uber was unable to effectively prevent charge after charge on my card. I tried my best to use the help feature, but the nature of my problem was so complex that the email responses I got from Uber were very unhelpful: they didn’t address all my concerns; their instructions were confusing; I didn’t regain access to my account; and to date 6 more fraudulent charges have been made after I first reported fraud happening!! I asked multiple times to speak to an Uber agent on the phone, and they instead insist I use email to log the issue. Frustrated, I then spent 30 minutes doing my best to put the entire issue into one email (at their request), and I got the same copy-paste responses from their team. They simply aren’t trying.

Fortunately my credit card company reimbursed me for the fraud... but Uber are not stopping the fraud from happening, and Uber is profiting from the illegal use of my account. If anyone is reading this from the Uber team, please contact me - I am still being robbed via your company.

All my future business will now go to Lyft and other alternatives.

title: The switching of charges
review:
Hey everybody, 
 
I use Uber every single day at least three times. Well Uber switched the way they charge you giving you an estimate of 8-12 dollars and more than likely it’ll be the higher cost. They over price their rides. Then canceling rides is a nightmare... they charge you for canceling a ride that may be 10 mins away. Furthermore, their service is garbage and if you write a complaint the customer service is even worst. There are many more complaints that I can make; however, I’ll stop here... as I have great news. Lol I switch to Lyft and they have rides at a quicker and cheaper rate. I also thought previously Lyft sucked because it was an unfair assumption I had made; however, their service is rather prompt, clean and respectful. I can have my headphones in jam out and enjoy the ride. Lastly, I am happy with the ride since their prices are cheaper, most of the time!

title: No customer support line
review:
There is no number, anywhere to call to get support from this company. You have to message through the app if you have any problems, but they are not helpful and it takes forever to even get a response. 

Story: My sister lost her phone in an Uber after leaving a bar and being harassed, assaulted, and followed by two guys. The Uber drive took it upon themselves, were assuming, to have her account deactivated for an issue that she didn’t cause. Even after going to the police they couldn’t help.

Now that she doesn’t have access to her account she can’t get the same customer service. They are taking their sweet time to respond, but if there were a support phone line, all of this could have been resolved. She has been without a phone for days and has resorted to using her insurance to get a new phone for $250 rather than a $15 return from an Uber driver.

title: Uber help is terrible
review: I’ve enjoyed this service enough until recently. My account was hacked and two $95 charges were put on it through Uber Cash which I didn’t even know existed, let alone had ever signed up for. On top of that, I got signed out of the app for the first time in years, so when I went to sign back in, I wasn’t sure of my original login info and either the hacker changed it or I got it wrong. This forced me to create a new account with the same phone number just to be able to access their Help service. I can’t even get a real person to help me and have been going in circles with the same automated help messages for over a week, unable to recover my account! Not only does it sometimes take hours or days for a response, it’s the same response every time with a different help rep’s name attached to it every time, regardless of any information I give them.

developerResponse.body: Hey, we understand your concern here with the support team. Let's make sure we follow up with you on this. Please send a quick note to t.uber.com/contact so we can connect.

title: Longtime Customer Disappointed
review: I have been a customer for over 3 years and I’ll say one thing about Uber, it makes it easy for you to get around to place like work, grocery stores, etc. But I’ve had a lot of crappy and rude drivers. Last week I had an incident on my way to work. I asked the driver to stop at a Quiktrip so I could get a cup of coffee and he said that’s fine, I was in there for 2 minutes or less. When I came out he was gone! I had my bag in the backseat of his car which included my asthma inhaler, work badge and other personal items. I’ve emailed you guys, filed a complaint, tried to contact the driver(no answer) and I’m just appalled by the lack of sense of urgency on y'alls side! I have the gentleman’s license plate, I would hate to file a police report at this point.

title: What’s changed
review:
I started using uber probably 1 year now. I have seen the progression of the app. Loved the feature of advance scheduling cause I live in a community with only 3 uber cars. This feature is now gone. Not sure it went away with iOS upgrade. 
I commonly use the service in New York and Dallas. The majority of the drivers in New York had clean cars. My complaints have been drivers that English was not there primary or secondary language. Unsafe driving- not wearing seat belt, speeding, hard braking. Only had one driver’s car who seats were ripped and covered with a dirty seat cover. I have no complaints from my Dallas uber drivers. 
I never use the carpool portion because of all the issues I have read about. 
Please bring back scheduled rides.

title: App does not pay out
review:
1.) getting the $ from the fares is close to impossible. I've earned over $100 and the app will not pay. Customer service is non existent and will not help with the issue. Do not drive with uber until you confirm that you will get paid!
2.) if you live on a state line. Be prepared to only service %50 of your area. Uber only allows 1 state. If you drop a fair in another state and want to pick up a fair for the return trip, you are shot outa luck. You drive for free on the return trip, making your "profit" for the forward trip effectively %50. 
Lyft takes more effort to get into as a driver but it is worth every minute of that effort! 
Keep both Uber and Lyft as an app, but when you can choose, select anything over Uber!
3. ) GPS In uber app is worse than using a WalMart Atlas... and LESS reliable! It doesn't load timely and it isn't always correct. A paper Atlas would steer you better

title: Not sure what to rate
review:
I’ve never had a problem with Uber before and it’s been overall pretty great. However last night I ordered one to be picked up at 1:15, I got notified a driver took it and they proceeded to show up to the house at 12:50 then cancelled a couple minutes later with no messages to me. I checked my email later on and Uber charged me for canceling my ride when I did nothing. When I went to try and get it fixed through the app, every time I hit proceed the website would say no internet connection. I find it odd how me trying to get my money back was the only part of the website that couldn’t work due to internet issues.
I’m honestly just disappointed and will probably stick to Lyft from now on to avoid losing more money.

title: Very disappointed
review: Omg not only are some of the driver car not clean but now Uber has disabled my account for absolutely no reason at all. This is Insane and I still have Uber credit that I had already bought ahead of time and now my money is gone they are thieves and they disconnect your accounts for nothing and then they never return emails you can’t, you have to email them and I have to email them they do not call you back at all ridiculous. And have you noticed that they still haven’t put up details about there privacy details that is a huge red flag every time I sign up Uber I start getting spam calls back to back then when I uninstall the app they stop calling. I think I may build a app that shows what companies are selling ppl info to Scam callers or scam companies or to other companies in general because it’s very illegal so I guess you would call it a Sue app

title: Piece of cake!
review:
I’m an “older” woman, somewhat technically savvy but new to Uber.
When I found myself in need of a ride, Uber was there for me.  I downloaded the app  - It was incredibly easy to use, clear, efficient - told me who would pick me up, what kind of car, every detail.  By allowing Uber to see my location, I could see exactly where my driver was and when he’d arrive. It was great! It took 35 minutes TOTAL between the time I downloaded the app, created an account, was picked up and delivered to my destination.  It would have taken me the same time to drive there .... if I would have had a car.  
Don’t hesitate - this is a great service backed by a great app!! Thank you!

title: Robbed by a driver
review:
I use Uber to get to my job at an assisted living facility. Come to find out a driver falsely said I’d left something in his car. Apparently this cost me 15 dollars but never left anything in a car. Apparently when you are robbed the clock starts ticking when Uber will even review your complaint. Apparently I was too late and this driver got away with robbing me. Guess being too busy caring for the elderly during a pandemic to double or triple check their drivers aren’t stealing from customers is not a good enough reason but hey they told me if it happens again be a bit faster with my complaint . If it happens again?! 
Update: Support reached out after telling me tough luck a number of times. Will keep results posted here. Update: so first they say nothing they can do after 30 days and now it 90 days. Uber is allowing their drivers to steal from customers. Horrible service.

title: Surges
review: I’m a single mother who takes the bus but had to use Uber from time to time after I drop my kid off at daycare sometimes the bus runs late and I can’t be late for work. That’s where Uber comes in. I’ve been thankful on many occasions. Fair prices fast friendly and accurate service but lately my normal 9 dollar trip is getting hiked up to 22 dollars due to it being busy. There’s an option if I gain enough points to become a platinum member to have price fluctuation lock which is crap because I pay for my rides and need them just as much as the next person. They say the surge charge is to ensure that they find drivers fast enough to get you where your going, but I feel like Uber is fast enough already! I feel completely jaded by this app but feel helpless because I feel I have no other option. One star for them getting over on the poor just because they can.

title: Uber not safe for women riding alone.
review:
This review is for the company and app. Not the actual driver. 
The Driver’s App took use to the wrong location. 
It to 10 minutes for me and the driver to figure out how to get the app to assign  the car I was in to take me to the correct destination. 
There was no way for me to get customer assistance In the app to deal with this problem at the time of incident. 
It took an hour of searching online the next day to find that there was not contact phone number or email. I had to message them via Facebook.
Then I got a boiler plate apology and $9 refund. 
I want to know what when wrong and how Uber is going to fix it. 
If I had been more distracted, drinking or unwell. I might have gotten out off the car and the driver drove off before I realize I was l at the wrong address in a neighborhood I didn’t know on a freezing dark street.  And if I had left my phone in the car. Or use my last $9 to get a ride it could have ended very badly.  I’m not the only person this has happened to. One friend the driver tried to leave her in an empty field. Now I finding out women have been raped in other cities.  What’s more people sometime use the service to get transportation for their children, older relatives, or disable people.  This is a safety issue for them as well.

developerResponse.body: Hey, sorry to hear that your experience with our team was not up to the mark and concern about the wrong location. We’d want to improve the same for you. Drop more details regarding the same and we’d do the needed.

title: Refunding and taking back money you didn’t accept
review:
I’ve been using Uber for some time now to get to work
I go on it it says $7.45 I click on it and my Uber comes and then I get drop off , an 1hour later Uber refunds the amount I accepted to pay for and takes $9.45 out my bank, the amount I didn’t accept for they took it out of my bank account this is RIDICULOUS.!!!!! At first I let it slide, could’ve been a glitch right? WRONG but now it’s been happening more recent everytime I buy to get an Uber I get refunds back and get charge for the amount I didn’t accept for. little by little Uber takes money out of your account with all the refunds and charges you the pay you didn’t accept. Sorry but you have lost a customer here !! You guys Had great service and everything until you started taking money out of peoples banks that they didn’t accepted for.

title: Works well, but hard to contact UBER for non conventional issues
review: I did not have enough in my UBER cash account for the tip I intended to give the driver, so the tip was not given. I found no way to split the tip to pay the rest with the credit card on file and there was no way to send a message to inquire about this particular problem.  The only options were to switch the payment method for the entire trip (which would have left a big balance in my cash account, which I don’t want), and regarding messages I could only send messages if there was a problem with the trip or with the charges. Another problem, it only let you add an arbitrary amount to UBER cash, only $25, $50, or $100.

title: Poor customer service
review: Customer service is really bad. Not with the actual drivers. But with uber themselves. I got verbally harassed in one of my uber rides. The driver was asking violating questions as well. So I reported the driver. Once I did I got a notification saying that I should be getting a response in a few days. I got absolutely nothing and they disabled my account a few days later. I’ve been trying to reach out to see what the problem was but I have yet to hear from them. I would much rather talk to them on the phone but they don’t have that option. I was put in an uncomfortable situation and uber did nothing about it. The driver is most likely still out there asking under age people violating questions. So disappointed and scared for the people who’ll have to deal with the same exact situation which could’ve been avoided if uber took my situation more seriously.

Everyone hates how terrible the pay is. Also why is Uber investing MILLIONS OF DOLLARS in self automated cars and drones to take the jobs away from workers. This is extremely unmoral, so many people need a side job and you Uber instead of paying them fairly and taking their money and using it for your own gain. Makes sense,  why do I have to investigate this myself?  I was worried the app was broke something stupid. title: What is going on with Uber lately
review:
I used to love Uber. I use it all the time still but lately the drivers have been so far away and quick to cancel. I have noticed that the routes have gotten much worse and they often times lead you don’t a road that has SO MUCH traffic when I know for a fact there are routes with less. 

I propose that for every cancel or Uber driver that is over 12 minutes away the rider (if they have a decent score - which I do of 4.78) should get money TOWARDS THEIR ACCOUNT. I should not get charged a “small fee” or “five dollars” once the third driver has cancelled on me and I want to switch to Lyft. (Which I have been doing a lot of lately). I want to stay loyal to Uber because I used to love it but you guys are making it really hard. 

Please respect your riders!!! Hope to see some new changes coming soon. Thanks!

title: My driver was unwilling to follow my instructions regarding an alternative route to my Destiination
review:
After leaving RSW international airport in Fort Myers And driving towards Martin Luther King Boulevard on 75.  

I requested that my driver exit the highway on colonial Boulevard, as I prefer to go to my Destiination via colonial Boulevard to McGregor Boulevard to my Destiination as opposed to 75 to Martin Luther King Blvd and then to my Destination.

My driver would not follow my instructions and after getting off 75 on the exit for colonial Boulevard he then proceeded to drive back roads to my destination which is not what I wanted , he insisted on following his GPS which brought us Eventually to my Destination

I believe his argument was that he did not speak English and therefore could not understand my instructions and his GPS was telling him to go the way that he wanted to go and not the way The paying customer wanted to go

As I said, I wanted to get off 75 on the colonial Boulevard exit and take colonial Boulevard to McGregor and drive McGregor to my  Destination

He also used the excuse that was more traffic the way I want to go we ended up being stuck in traffic the way he went.

I have used Uber often and I asked other drivers to follow my directions without incident

I am not happy with his service and do not want to use his services again.

title: Multi-stop no longer has a change / add function
review:
This latest version seems to have crippled the functionality to modify your destination if you are in a multiple stop ride. This function needs to be added back in for a number of reasons not the least of which is that it does not allow for human error if by accident a wrong address is entered. Riders can no longer update or correct the destination. Without this function it forces the rider to cancel the trip part way through and call a new ride if the address needs to be changed. That results in increased costs to the rider as well as lost time. It also results in the initial driver receiving a reduced fee than was contemplated when the driver accepted the ride. 

Please kindly fix this. Thank you.

Why would I repeat this service with some credit if it's consitently terrible? There is no resolution here, only a quick throw of credit. I have credit from terrible trips in the past with Uber already because your service has failed in all categories in the past year from drivers, car quality, pickup times, dropoff estimations, multiple pickup of riders out of the way, and customer service just plain ignoring all the issues. I know from my own family and friends the state of customer satisfaction with uber is below zero.

review: I love Uber only sometimes we need more options I think. If there were a way to select female or male driver that would be great and also set up an advance pick up more than 10 min . We used Uber after My Daughters bachelorette party but had to cancel multiple times until we finally got a person we felt comfortable with. title: Decent app, terrible customer service
review:
The app works well. It does what is needed. Location for pickup can be difficult at times. I’ve aligned the pin to my exact address on several occasions only to have the driver think I’m on the opposite side of the street, at a nearby Starbucks, etc. But with the ability to talk with the driver it was always sorted out.

Uber’s customer service is abysmal however. I had two accounts set up - one to business purposes and one for personal use. Uber erroneously charged a tip to one while charging the regular fare to the other. As it’s important to keep those costs separate, I asked for it to be corrected. I didn’t ask for a refund, discount, whatever. Just to bill the correct account. They refused, claiming its “policy.”

You should be aware Uber has a F rating with the BBB. I will no longer be using them at all.

title: Horrible customer service. Bad gps.
review: I have used this app for over a year and had never had an issue. It honestly makes me sad that I’m giving them this rating due to one bad experience.  I Had an issue with the destination that was saved as home. Long story short my trip was longer and had a toll because the driver was lost due to an error with the app gps.  I contacted customer service and they were no help. They explained their fees to me as if I didn’t understand them and provided no assistance. I only asked for a refund of the toll fee, which was .65, yes .65 cents. It was only a matter of principle. The app made mistake when it traced the route and I shouldn’t have to pay for a toll that was not necessary. I wasn’t even asking for a refund for the extra distances expense and no assistance was provided. Be very careful with the route traced by the app.

title: Payment invalid issues
review:
I started using Uber just recently last Saturday and I was able to get a ride for the first time using my Discover card without any problems. The second time I requested for a ride, I keep getting an error that my payment is invalid. 

I tried adding a debit card from a major bank and it still won’t work. I contacted the support team and I was able to get a reply that my account was placed under restriction so they fixed it by having me removed from the restrictions. I tried requesting a ride but still nothing goes through even if I did the troubleshooting suggestions. 

I told them my concern again and they told me my payment is invalid and I could try using apple pay, paypal, bla bla bla and THEY ACCEPT THE STANDARD DEBIT AND CREDIT CARDS TOO. So what really is the problem with this? My cards are both standard and I was even able to get a ride the first time. Please resolve this.

title: What a joke
review: What an absolute joke of an app. It frequently thinks I'm more than 7 blocks away from my actual location and fails to find addresses/popular locations it was able to find without issue previously. Meanwhile I can switch to Google Maps and it's able to find my location and even the locations I search for. Even the drivers are complaining the app frequently fails to give them even basic directions, and instead sends to an entirely wrong spot. One driver told us he was sent 30 min away by his Uber GPS to an empty parking lot, even though his actual pickup was 2 blocks away. I'm switching to Lyft, I shouldn't have to fight an app to get it to work correctly, especially for a paid service. No wonder this company is hemorrhaging money like a blood from a stab wound. Don't waste your time using this until they get an app that actually works like it's supposed to.

title: Slimy behavior: Apple Watch app defaults to using Premiere SUV

developerResponse.body: Hi, we're sorry to hear that you're facing an issue with requesting an Uber through your apple watch. We would like to take a closer look into this for you. Please send us a note regarding this at t.uber.com/contact and we will do the needful.

review:
I’m glad I decided to check my Apple Watch before attempting to leave my iPhone behind and rely on my watch to summon an Uber while I’m out.  My watch wants to summon Premiere SUVs which is 3x more expensive than UberX that I normally use.   

Their help document indicates that the Apple Watch should default to your last used ride type from the iPhone app (mine should be UberX which I use at least once a week).   And since they don’t allow you change the ride type in the watch app itself (which they should!), it feels like this is just a sneaky way of tricking users into having to spend more money by forcing me to have to use Premiere SUV.

Uber - please fix this ASAP.  And the best fix would be to add the ability to choose the ride type from within the watch app itself and not rely on the iPhone app at all.

title: Driver canceled on me?
review: I was standing on the corner waiting for my ride. My phone said the driver was there but I never saw him. I sent a message with what I was wearing. Message back said that he was on the way back. Next thing I knew it said the trip was canceled and it would cost me $5. I was there waiting the whole time. I wish the driver had come back. He was Feom Sweden and I used to live there. Would have been nice to speak to him in Swedish. Other than this, my 4 other rides have been good. The best was in Memphis though. Fabulous friendly drivers who told us about where we were going and tips on the bed places to go and eat. Will definitely use I Uber again.

review: As I updated the app with the new update it seems to me that you either gotta walk two blocks or more to meet up with your driver or pay extra to get the driver to pick you up at your exact location... It personally doesn’t make sense to have people like me walking in areas we may not be familiar with or have customers walk in certain weather conditions to meet up with their driver. title: Uber as an idea turned reality is genius.
review: So the concept of the app is what I love. Providing pedestrians and responsible individuals with the ability to get around conveniently at the press of a button is just great. The usability app is straightforward. However, I did notice the app tends to lag. I would also like to see the prices be a little more cheaper since riders can have multiple destinations which most likely include round-trips that quickly add up. And that’s not to say the prices are bad or anything like that but it would be more valuable if our dollars could go further while meeting whatever fiscal goals the business model of uber presents. Just saying.

title: Poor customer service, but issue resolved

developerResponse.body: Hi, we're always looking to improve your experience with Uber. Anything specific we can look into for you? Let us know by sending a quick note to t.uber.com/contact and we'll connect.

review:
There was an issue beyond my control that caused my account to be deactivated. Several attempts to find out the cause came up with nothing. One customer service representative named Cathy sent me an email stating that I will never ride Uber still not giving a specific reason. 
I decided to send a strongly worded email to the CEO of Uber, and within three hours I got a call back from an actual human being. Turns out that my account was flagged for security reasons, and all I had to do was prove my identity and confirm my method of payment. My account was reactivated right after that.
My beef is that it should not have taken two weeks and an email to the CEO to resolve this. 
People take customer service very seriously, this means you have to make some changes to the way you treat loyal customers.

title: The ride pass causing errors!!!

developerResponse.body: Hi there, the driver needs to accept the request for the trip to be started. If the trip request is not accepted/cancelled by the nearest driver partner, the trip request is forwarded to another nearest driver partner and hence "finding your ride" message pops up. Please note that the fare is not affected by this. For any further queries, send in a note to t.uber.com/contact and we'll follow up.

review: As soon as I purchase my ride pass, the app started to show errors. On one ride, my driver was coming, the app keep showing “finding your ride.” And at the next ride, while my driver was on the way, the app lost its connection to server, and when they could connect, they kept saying “finding your ride” again. I had a perfect reception for data and could still use other app - it was only uber!!! I could not cancel the ride either and had no idea where my driver was. Thankfully, my driver called me and picked me up. I tried to reach out to the customer service when the server was down, but there was no way to contact them. The only way was “help” section, but it was useless when the server was down. The quality of service is proven when they deal with the customer service. Seriously, they need to improve their customer service.

title: I no longer use Uber
review: I haven’t used Uber and a couple of months. I’ve been trying to stop the subscription. I’m not getting any luck AT ALL so far I’ve lost $48 in two months and I haven’t used the service. It’s practically impossible to speak to a human everything is over the phone and the Internet so there’s no human connection. I don’t have 24+ dollars to donate to a service that I don’t use anymore I need help!! I want to stop my service I will no longer use Uber I’d rather go to Lyft. This is huge inconvenience for me. Uber was quick to stop my service  they thought I was another customer who gave a driver a hard time.I couldn’t get a ride until a number I wasn’t able to call back (Uber)called me to dispute a situation I had nothing to do with. I just want to stop the service you all are stealing from me at this point and I’m sick of it and I want my money back.

title: Reliable?
review:
I understand that times are tough and drivers should be safe an all, but there so be drivers who would take your ride. Numerous occasions I had to view 8-9 different drivers to take my ride. Plus, some of the drivers would cancel two to three minutes before they met up. 
Now, if I have to pay a $5 cancellation fee and have the driver cancel my trip, shouldn’t there be a way to get your time back? 
Ohhh, you’ll give me $5, but what about the x amount of time wasted waiting for a driver. Shouldn’t I receive that time back or should I wait for someone to give me that time back? 

Yeah, I ranted and so what? Say what you want, but if your drivers are working they should take the small trips. They build up over time rather than taking one long trip.

title: Very Useful, Slow to Start Up, Drains Battery Very Fast

developerResponse.body: Hey, we understand your concern here with the pool. We want to take a closer look into this for you. Please send a quick note to t.uber.com/contact so we can connect.

review:
Uber is mostly useful but their app takes a long time to start upon an iPhone 6 with no other apps running.  It also drains a new iPhone battery amazingly fast so once I recognize that my ride has come I stop running the app immediately.  Also, be aware that pick up locations are not always accurate.  Finally, using pooled rides in some areas may require a long walk to a pickup location.  In my case it was over a half mile through a neighborhood that felt unsafe so I cancelled the ride and left the area but had to pay a penalty fee.

In summary, I’m glad to have the Uber option in many situations. However, their technology needs considerable work before I would call it a refined product.

review: The new ride options aren’t that great and the routes provided to the drivers aren’t very efficient. Uber has significant room for improvement. As a regular rider, there are very few discounts offered by Uber for customer loyalty or those who are frequent riders. While there are perks to this service there is also stiff competition in this arena. As such, Uber will have to do better to retain riders. What makes me rate this app or service so low is the poor customer service that I’ve received when presenting an issue with my ride. The agents are fairly passive and dismissive of the concern and offer little to no resolve which isn’t good. Hopefully Uber will take this feedback to heart and act on it by providing better all around service and some sort of benefit or concessions for those who are frequent riders spending a certain amount

review: Just updated the app today and the gps is all off and wrong today- my driver was complaining about it too. The app used to notify you that the driver was completing a trip nearby so that you'd understand a slight delay. Now, you just watch what you thought was a close Uber go around the block. Then when you ask about the delay the driver says they were completing a trip nearby. I believe the drivers and this is an app fault not notifying the riders. Also, there used to be a clear difference on screen and price wise between Uber, uber pool, and uber pool express. I HATE that they combined Uber pool and Uber pool express. You have to understand that it's very confusing in a big city to "walk around the block" and be picked up somewhere new with Uber pool express. I wish they'd kept Uber pool without forcing express down our throats. Uber pool is now almost the same price as normal Uber :/

title: Uber is difficult to reach & unsafe

developerResponse.body: Hi, the feedback from our riders is vitally important to us, and we always want their expectations to be met. Let us know more about it by dropping the details at t.uber.com/contact and we'll follow up.

review: Uber customer service is awful. They do not screen their drivers or the condition of the cars. & you can only reach them through the app where you get generic unhelpful responses for random people. I took an Uber trip recently where the car smelled like there was an ammonia leak in the car, and I couldn’t breathe in the car even with both windows down. Uber refused to reimburse me for the trip or look into the issue seriously, insisting it was just an unpleasant odor, instead of investigating the issue. I’m willing to forgive a lot when it comes to driving in NYC- I take the subway and taxis regularly, but I draw the line at health hazards. A company like this should be taking responsibility for the safety of their customers, but unfortunately clearly this is not the case. Will no longer take Ubers and don’t recommend it to anyone who cares about their safety and comfort.

title: Uber is exellent
review: I don’t normally give app reviews, but I just want to say that I very much appreciate that Uber exists. Yes, it’s incredibly innovative and convenient. But, mostly, I just want to say how fortunate I am that I’m able to use Uber as opposed to taxis. A few months ago, I got charged $40 from a cab while the Uber would’ve been $15. He also expected a tip, and ran up the charge by going the wrong way. I gave him a 1 cent tip on the computer thing and ran, vowing to never use taxis again (outside of NYC). And, I’m happy to say that not only are Uber’s prices better, but the ability to rate your driver means a lot, in that they actually have quality control. So, thanks Uber!

title: Game changer
review:
We lived in the suburbs of Milwaukee where often if you called a taxi service it would come from downtown and arrive 30 minutes to 1 hour plus to arrive. I’m ashamed to say there were times where this caused us to re-evaluate our ability to drive after drinking, especially when the bar was closing and we would have to wait outside. IN WISCONSIN. Cost was not the issue, it was time. Thank goodness nothing horrible happened when we drove home tipsy or worse. 

Now there is Uber. Anywhere you are, Uber will be there in 2 to 29 minutes. At a portion of the cost of a taxi!

Uber has made the roads a safer place and me a happier person.

title: No more completing trips nearby
review: I love uber a lot I am very thankful to live in a world where we have this opportunity to get from point a to b. However, I wish riders had the choice to choose wether we want to pair with a driver who is completing a near by trip. Sometimes the rider from the trip before me will change their destination which prolongs my wait time for a ride. If I want to cancel I will be charged which is not fair. We should have the choice to ride with someone who is completing a nearby trip or just wait for the next available rider. It’s very inconvenient and if a driver is stuck in traffic we should have a choice on wether we want to continue riding with them because some of us have to be somewhere at a specific time. Other than that I love uber! Thank you 🤗

title: Keeps ripping me off
review: I'd suggest Lyft. I've been using uber for years uber WAS a great app but now I'd moreso recommend getting a cab or trying lyft (which seems to be more accurate with arrival times). I am constantly mislead about when there's a driver near by and how long it's going to take. I've had to use this app for business and personal and it's beyond frustrating trying to get somewhere the app says 5 minutes when you're considering taking a ride and then your ride is 10 minutes away. Then they've charged me and my business account for canceling due to their misleading app (lyft at least gives you a chance to state "driver too far" "request someone closer".) At first it had been an ongoing joke about how terrible the service has gotten... now I am FED up. I've wasted money and my team has wasted money... take the bus.

title: *sighs*
review: I totally get the cleaning fee charge. Like if someone threw up in my car I’d be upset and charge them too. But I had a night out ok, and started to feel sick while in the car so I started telling the driver multiple times over and over again that I needed to pull over to avoid throwing up in his car. He thought it wasn’t serious for god knows what reason and I had to keep saying it until he finally realized. At that point it was too late, he stopped a second before I threw up all over myself. Easily could have been avoided if he had just stopped the car when I had asked. I had to go home because I had yak all over myself. It is partially my fault, but it would have saved everyone the trouble if he had just listened to me. Uber said the cleaning fee is normal no matter what if someone throws up in the vehicle but i don’t deserve to be fully blamed.  #goodbye2017helloLYFT

title: Terrible First Expierence
review: I just flew in to Orlando and needed a ride. All my cards on Apple Pay and PayPal got declined saying to update my billing information. I called Card services who confirmed they Are not being blocked. Uber doesn't have any contact information. Called the 800 number who is just a voice recording telling you to go back to the app. I finally found a spot in the app to send a message to support. I'm in a Lyft now because Uber couldn't have been anymore than less helpful considering all they did was waste my time. My girlfriend created an account as well and got the same error. So don't even waste your time with this piece of crap company because if you have an issue, they won't be there to support you. All I know is I now have up to 11 $1.00 charges on all my cards linked to Apple Pay. So I have to wait for a reply to get that fixed. Don't waste your time like I did.

title: Ridiculous and Unreliable service
review: I have been using Uber for a while since it came out but sadly over the years its quality of service has declined drastically. Drivers now more than ever accept a ride and cancel within seconds while some accept the ride, drive halfway to my destination, and cancel so it’s impossible to trust the App when needing it as a way to get from point A to point B. Wait time for a ride is extremely lengthy, and there is no online or In-App direct phone number to have verbal communication with someone to assist on an issue. So if you need a phone number or method to contact support for direct help? You can forget it! The chances of you seeing pigs fly are higher than the chances of you actually getting the proper customer help that is needed. Wouldn’t recommend this app for anyone and will personally stop using this app from this point on.

title: ROBBERS
review: Just use Lyft. Used to prefer uber even though they are consistently higher priced because they had always treated me well. That ended the last time I used the app I put in a destination I go to often from my home price was about $15 which is about normal. Got in the uber and the driver said his app wasn’t working but he could get us where we needed to go. Come to find out I was charged $50 for the ride. I have contacted the app many times and the best they could do was a $20 credit. What is that? I want my money back in my account and the credit doesn’t even cover the full amount I was overcharged. I don’t want a credit I will never now use because you stole my money. I have gone back and forth with them about it so many times. All I get back is sorry hope you’ll keep using our service and we are always trying to be better. STRAIGHT ROBBERS! Lyft all day.

review:
If there were no stars I would gladly give it no stars. I am very disappointed i been trying to add my card and get a ride but the app decided to say no there’s an error I called my bank if it was blocked and no it’s not I tried everything with my Wells Fargo bank card and of course it denied it as well I tried it with my moms card and still no and with my aunt. I was very happy and felt very save using this app but sadly I can enjoy that comfort anymore! I even contacted by email customer service and they didn’t even help me at all they just say it just add it and everything and the app still declining it! I am not happy with the customer service at all! I just want to get a ride to point A to B! That’s all I ask. I never had this problem before in my life!😡
I want to speak with someone on the phone not buy the app or by email because they are no help at all

title: Cleanliness
review:
Just left Ezekiel’s vehicle at PHL international airport. First of all, I must say that Ezekiel was most courteous and cordial. His driving was outstanding and safe. My negative was the cleanliness of his vehicle. I had to use a disinfectant wipe on the door handle when I discovered how dirty it was. I’m sure my coat is now dirty as well. The other problem was Ezekiel—he had horrible body odor—maybe he wasn’t aware of this. 

I have been in some spotless Uber cars and some not so clean, but this was the worst. Is it too much for Uber to require that if you drive for them then your vehicle should be “clean”?  

I don’t want to malign Ezekiel but this was the tip of the iceberg. I do hope that Uber takes the necessary steps to insure that all their drivers take the time to ensure that their passengers are not sitting in a dirty vehicle.

title: They started charging fee
review: I am using Uber once in a while, I never checked or even bother to write a review neither good or bad driver that I got. But most of the time I always get the bad one, I paid for the UberX but I end up walking a quarter mile to meet the driver and sometimes they passed me off and never bother to call or text me. Today, I accidentally open my mail and I check the receipt from my yesterday rode, and I found that they charged me extra for Wait Time! What the heck is that? I was waived my hand to the driver and he (the driver) the one passed me by and he took another U turn and come back again! How the hell that I am the one end up paid for it?!  How about we Waiting Time? Sometimes they said 2 minutes away and I end up waiting for 5 minutes? Uber is getting sucked!! Please don’t be greedy! $0.33 that was not much, but my disappointment is the problem here.

title: Inaccurate pick up time & high price @ SFO
review: Tried to request an Uber from SFO. Not only did I receive an absurdly high price but the timing of when the car would actually arrive was completely inaccurate. I had a driver tell me Uber purposely ensures customers would not see actual times for airport pick ups to prevent negative customer reactions. No where on this app is there any ability to provide over all feedback on my experience with Uber or even a clear genuine ability to reach out to a customer service rep. I do not have twitter to reach out to the twitter handle provided for feedback nor do I believe tweeting the airport is an effective means for gathering feedback. This was not an issue with my driver but an issue with Uber itself. Since I have no other means of providing feedback I’m writing a review while I wait for my Uber.

title: Dissatisfied couple
review:
Our first experience with the Uber app. in a unfamiliar city with an impatience and hard to understand Uber Driver!! We were at the correct pick up point and had been on time and waiting for our Uber driver to connect with us. 
The pick up location I specified (@2 major Cross streets) was in a very well know  area and at a Major hotel in the city. He was unable to pick us up because he did not KNOW where were!! The Uber driver cancelled our request!! Fortunately a taxi driver was nearby and over heard my conversation on the phone with the Uber Driver. We were able to reach our destination from a very knowledgable and professional person who knew exactly where we needed to go. The price was reasonable as well. 
But I must say our return pick up Uber driver was exceptional and made the rest
Of our evening stress free.

title: HORRIBLE UPDATE
review: Uber used to be an excellent service. After their latest update their GPS has gotten so much worse. It’s absolutely horrible, I can find a route half as fast through my own google maps, it’s almost as if they try to find a longer route in order to charge you more. Furthermore I don’t mind the walking option, I think it’s great that we get a choice to save money to walk a bit, but if they’re going to offer that then they need to work on the DISTANCE! You can’t have someone walk 13 minutes when the driver they connect you to is only 4 minutes away. That just doesn’t make any sense. It upsets both the driver who cancels half the time and the customer. Fix your programming for that option, unless you purposely do that in order to force us to chose the more expensive option.

title: Uber will hire anyone, and take money from your account freely
review: Drivers often keep driving so they don’t have to pick up the ride, but won’t cancel so they still get paid. Drivers will pick you up then refuse your destination and cause you to be behind schedule because you have to wait for another driver. Drivers have verbally assaulted me and sexually harassed me. Drivers have picked up the ride but not pick me up and unless I cancel and incur the charge, I can’t use the app till the driver either claims to have dropped me off or finally cancels the ride. The app will charge you before completing the ride so if you Uber doesn’t show up or refused the ride, you have to pay a second time and don’t expect to see your money back for days. If you take a pool Uber will often send your driver off route in hopes to pick up more people, doesn’t matter how long it adds to the trip.

title: I love it but I hate it too
review: Being a college student I rely on Uber to get to places I need to go off campus like to get my hair done , doctors appts, or the grocery store. I have a complaint about Uber’s GPS. It has told me my driver has arrived , and I walk to the pick up spot and my driver is no where around. Or it says they’re here and they’re actually 5 mins away. OR it just malfunctions and my driver can’t find me and doesn’t try to call - just gives me the fee. So my driver cancels on me, and I have to pay a $5 fee because Uber can’t get it’s GPS together - on top of me paying 10 or more to get a new ride because I still need to get home. Not to mention it’s not the first time it’s happened. I don’t have a lot of money to waste , so if this continues I’ll probably just go to Lyft.

Today i called an uber at 5:05 and a woman picked it up, it said 10 minutes away and they charged me the money. As soon as she got 2 minutes away she dropped the pickup and they got me another driver that was 10 minutes away as well. Moral is i had to be at work at 5:30 and it’s 5:28 and i still haven’t been picked up . This makes no sense especially when you’re charging people full price. Lyft at least offers discounts every now and then. Uber is so stingy and inconsiderate. Another thing is that there’s no one you can talk to about your concerns. If you google the number they will give you every number except the real one.

review:
The express pool system is terrible. Sometimes you get picked up at a location way far away from where you are. And when the app says you will be picked up at your location, it will not. You still have to walk.

And recently I had an issue where the app claimed that I got picked up when I actually still waiting to be picked up. The driver then contacted me directly and asked for my address. I was pretty concerned of my safety. Like why is the system so messed up? On top of that, the customer service’s terrible as well. They’re not helpful and it’s just the machine replying to your automatically. They don’t even read your complaints.

Overall, terrible service by Uber.

I tried to get Uber support to help, but they couldn’t figure it out. They suggested I’d call my carrier, which I did. But they couldn’t help. review:

title: DON’T USE UBER

review:
I have been using the Uber app for several years now and never experienced any problems until recently. 
I took a trip and disputed the amount due to a driver who had no idea where they were going and ignored the directions on the map. Uber declined to give me a refund so I had to dispute it through my bank. A day later Uber changed their mind and gave me a partial refund for my trip. And we told the bank to drop the dispute. 
Well this has turned into a five month nightmare with Uber. Their customer service refuses to help me or listen to anything I am aging. They respond with robotic answers that don’t even address my situation. The bank says the dispute has been resolved and Uber was paid in full for the trip. But Uber has continued to recharge me the full amount for the trip THREE times now, including switching to charge me on a separate work credit card linked to my Uber account which I did not authorize. 
Uber refuses to resolve the problem and acknowledge they were paid in full.
I have no way to send proof from the bank including statements and a letter because Uber has no customer service support except the app messaging. 
I have reported Uber to the better business bureau and will never use Uber again. STAY AWAY FROM UBER AND THEIR FRAUDULENT BUSINESS PRACTICES!

review: I've been having issues with Uber for the past few months. In September, I got charged for ride pass without my consent. I noticed this charge a few weeks later and after contacting customer support, they told me they couldn't refund me and all I could do was keep using it and turn off the renewal option. I accepted this and turned off the renewal. Today, while looking at my bank statement, I noticed I was charged again for the ride pass service. I check the Uber app and see that I'm subscribed to the service again. I did not sign up for this once again. I contacted customer support again and got the same automated response as before. I'm frustrated about this whole situation because I don't want to keep spending $25 a month when I don't agree to (which is illegal by the way). This issue needs to be fixed or I will stop using Uber.

review:

review:
Driver went to wrong location and when he realized his mistake came to correct location, a golf course clubhouse. As driver did not show up at appointed time I attempted to find someone inside the clubhouse with an Uber app to request another ride as a friend had booked my ride.  only one person remained in clubhouse as it was dark now and this person had no Uber app.  Upon returning outside I found the driver who advised he cancelled my ride as he couldnt wait forever and I would have to pay an inconvenience fee and book a new ride. Pathetic. Uber charged me inconvenience fee when driver could not find location.  This was before above fiasco for which I was charged.   I was at a golf course for god sake, not some location in Timbuktu.

title: Great...when it works

review:
I have been using Uber for years. Over the last year or so as I’ve travelled the world more, the problems have only increased with the app and my account. My account has randomly been disabled multiple times. Figuring out how to contact Uber about it is like finding a needle in a haystack. I have been stuck in an airport a few times and forced to use more expensive taxis (tonight included) because Uber decided it was the right time to disable my account again or randomly not allow credit card payments. Now I’m trying to use another email address and phone number I own to set another account up, and whenever I click to agree to the TOC and privacy policy it just redirects me back to the previous screen. Every time. 

The idea of Uber is great. But from a customer service and functional standpoint it just fails too often.

review: As Uber states with every update, they are trying to update the app as often as possible to keep to “fresh”. Problem is that with too many updates and no info other than that riders are left in the dark about the new features. My biggest problem with the new update is that I am no longer prompted at the end of a ride to rate my driver, or tip them. I have to go into my ride history, find the ride, then do it. I have a feeling a lot of riders will not go through that process resulting in less driver tips which, when a driver goes out of their way for someone or provides any service, even a cell phone charger, the customer’s best way to show appreciation is to tip since the driver can match the tip with a the ride, but if you only rate them, they have no way to tell who rated what and why.

review: I’ve had minimal problems with this app but it didn’t work while i was in Havana, Cuba. It’s been “hit and miss” while in London, England. Absolutely terrible in Amsterdam, Netherlands! I’m in Amsterdam at the moment and was just charged 10 Euros for a ride that the driver canceled because HE didn’t arrive at the pick up location! And after searching for him for nearly 20min, he cancels, I called another Uber and all of a sudden he’s found me. After spending 20min on my American cellular network trying to figure out where he is; I’ve been charged for the cancelled ride, the actual ride, and my cellular fees just to get home. It’s very unfair, it’s raining, and I’m wet as I type this. I’m highly upset and todays events and would rate Uber lower but I did make it some thank god.

title: Disappointing Again

review:
For several months, Uber has sent the car to a different location than what I requested. Last night, I could not understand my driver’s English when I was trying to find out where he was. Finally, I saw him waving from across a dark, busy downtown street. I had been standing out since call was made and had identified myself as wearing a red coat. The only reason I saw the driver was because there was a short break in traffic. There was no apology or conversation in the car, and then this morning I see I was charged a wait time fee. I do not understand, when I did everything possible for a successful pickup, why I have to pay for Uber’s faulty GPS.
And forget about trying to get the charge removed - Uber makes customer service difficult to reach.
I think this last ride puts me into the Lyft camp. 
Very unhappy with this experience.
Angela Carlson

title: Uber is forgetting who the customer is

developerResponse.body: Hi, this doesn't sound right. We're always looking to improve your experience with Uber and we would certainly like to know more about this. Let us know about any such specific incident by sending a quick note to t.uber.com/contact and we'll connect.

review: I’m not rooting against Uber and I genuinely support immigrants finding a way to make a living in this inclusive country. But I’m tired of two things. 1) I’m tired of people who have a hard time understanding English telling me to “come find me. Find my dot and come meet me”. No. Find my dot and come meet me, in the customer. Uber was suppose to be better than a taxi because it’s a customer-centric company. It doesn’t feel that way. I might as well take a cab. The extra $5 in fare isn’t worth it to me. 2) I’ve had 3 straight fares where after 5-10 minutes of waiting for an Uber, the driver cancels on me. And then I’m stuck waiting an extra 10-20 minutes for a ride. Is there any penalty to a driver? There’s a $5 penalty if I cancel, but it seems like I get canceled on more than I do the canceling. Just downloaded Lyft today. Will see if that changes things.

title: Fees discrepancy
review:
I’ve helped my parents setup and use Uber on a couple occasions before without issues and fares were as promised.  But on my very recent experience, in NYC, the fare charged to my credit card was almost 20% higher than the fare displayed on the app.  Not sure what happened there, but glad I have signed up for instant text notification whenever my AE card is used electronically (“card not present” purchases). 

Uber did help rectify and refund me the difference very smoothly after I contacted them though.  So we’re good.  Just that I’m not sure if this is accuracy of the app or what, glad I took a screenshot right before I hit submit button as evidence.  

Otherwise, rest of the app is very smooth!

title: It maybe worth it.

developerResponse.body: Hi, this certainly sounds like a frustrating experience. The feedback from our riders is vitally important to us, and we always want their expectations to be met. Let us know more about it by dropping the details at t.uber.com/contact.

review:
I’m going to list the pros and cons as this app has cracked doors for me. So here they are;

You meet great people who will offer you other jobs if it have another career. 

You sometimes get great tips and can make $30 in one hour. 

You have fun trips sometimes when you have a nice destination like to San Francisco or Yosemite. 

It’s fun sometimes.

The cons;

You meet a lot of arsholes, drunks, people with no class, racists, people who will think they are better and superior than you, creeps, prostitutes, homeless, and pick up people in really shady parts of town. 

Other careless drivers almost hit you on the road.

Bad roads take a toll on your car. 

It is tiring some nights. 

People eat in your car and spill stuff in it, want to throw up in it. Dent your car, scratch it. 

Sometimes you make $3 a ride, $1 of those dollars has to be spent on gas so you net $2 total. You can make $30 a day or $150 a day. 

Weekends are the best, it’s not even worth it driving in the day as small towns are flooded with Ubers. 

Only do rides with a surge and avoid picking up people who are 8 minutes away. Stick with 5 minutes or less to avoid wasting gas. You’ve been warned. 

This will save you months of headaches. 

Only do this until you find a real job. It gets you through hard times.

title: No customer service (see additional info)
review:
I requested an Uber around 2 AM on the 18. The stupid driver started the trip when she was no where near me. Uber charged me the minimum fare. I contacted them and even had screen shots to prove that I was no where near the driver. They said in 3-5 business days that I would receive a refund. 
1st issue: It took y’all less than a minute to take the money from me! Why should I wait 5 days to get MY money back?!
2nd issue: It has now been 6 business days and I still don’t have MY money back. Fix this issue and I’ll give you 5 stars.
I used Uber the most because they are cheaper than Lyft. But if y’all aren’t going to provide the customer service, then I’ll happily pay more for their better service. 
This comes from someone who has been in customer service jobs for over 12 years now... SMH.

Finally while sitting at work tonight I received a response from someone named Kelvin. He gave me more than a generic response and when I went to check the app, my money had been refunded!! He’s a keeper!!!

title: Love the app
review: I love Uber. Use it a lot for my children (teenager and young adult). And I love the new pool service which gives you a discount on your ride. The only part I don’t like is the tipping system. Have always loved Uber versus a cab cause it’s all included. Never had to worry about what the appropriate tip was. Now I do have to worry about it. And I know the drivers rate you after knowing  how well you tip them. I wish this part was all inclusive as it started out being. I don’t mind being rated as we are good people and pleasant passengers. But I do mind being rated on how deep my pockets are. Either they should rate not knowing how rich you are or tipping should not be encouraged as it is. If it wasn’t for this, it’d be a five star rating.

title: “Pick up site”
review:
I use Uber to get to work in hospitals and then return to the hotels I’m moored in by my employer.  In other words, on a pretty regular basis.
Hotels have only one pick up site, but the same cannot be said about hospitals.  Main entrance? Emergency Department entrance?  There’s really no way to specify so that the driver and I know where to meet.  I wind up having to track the driver’s progress and try to time when s/he is at a light and so can safely and legally answer my call to clarify where I am.  I’m perfectly comfortable waiting at the ED entrance but there is usually a 50/50 chance that the driver can readily find it.  It would be WONDERFUL if the app would make it possible to be clear on which pick up site it refers to.

title: Uber drivers be really stupid
review: Uber is an okay app to get to your destination. But I swear most of the time is makes me think they just hire anybody and I’m sure they do. These Uber drivers I get have no sense of direction. The map literally tells you when to turn and where to drop off the passenger. So I don’t understand why I’m being asked to tell them where to go? You’re the driver so follow the freakin map. Another problem I have is when the driver takes let’s say 10 minutes  to pick you up when it says they are 5 minutes away. If the driver is not ready to drive and get to the pickup destination in that time period, why are you accepting rides then? It wastes the passengers time when they could get another driver who is ready to drive

title: Schedule a ride suggestion
review: I ordered a ride for 5pm because that’s when I get out of work. They showed up 10 minutes early and canceled the ride. I was stuck with the $5 fee and had to wait 20 minutes for a new Uber to come. Why give an option to schedule when it doesn’t work efficiently. How about implementing a feature that notifies drivers that a person is looking to be picked up at 5pm and whomever is the closest and can get there for that time be notified. Or something similar. This is my 2nd time of this happening. I can’t use my phone at work so that’s why I thought this scheduling function would be good for me.

title: Service
review: I must say I’ve been using Uber for years now on a daily basis. I rarely if ever had any problems or complaints, but as of recently the service, time waiting for a driver to even be called, and just overall experience with Uber has been horrible to say the least. I now find myself regularly waiting upwards of 15 mins to get a driver dispatched to my location, sometimes with the option to call another driver for a higher price, which even then the app just keeps trying to locate a driver endlessly. I am at the point of completely giving all my business to Lyft. The service as of these past months has been horrid. For living directly in the center of a city like Los Angeles, this is completely unacceptable and unprofessional. I don’t if I’ve had my last ride with Uber at this point...

title: Bad customer service
review:
I’m giving them 1 star because customer services was bad. Very generic responses and not attentive to the issue that was happening. Took a ride and I would say 5-7 minutes into the ride the car broke down. The driver of Uber advised they would have another come and pick me up (as it’s something that’s never happened to me) and so I waited for an hour with my child in the cold expecting a ride. I ended up having a relative of mine come and pick me up which took about another half hour for them to get to me because I could not take wait and because I was told that’s not the way to handle the situation.

When I went to follow up with Uber on the full refund, all they did was give me a $5 credit which is what I don’t even want. Charged me $11 for a ride that wasn’t even close to my final destination. 

Lyft doesn’t do this to their customers.

I pre-ordered a ride and cancelled it a few hours later because I was offered a ride from a family member and I saw that they charged me and even though I cancelled the ride request they didn’t issue me a refund, so I did the only logical thing to do which was of course message their customer support representatives and show them PHOTO EVIDENCE of my bank statement saying that they charged me even though I cancelled the ride. However the representative was just going in circles with me and not helping me resolve my issue. Therefore I’m NEVER using Uber again and I’m leaving a bad review on the BBB website for Uber as well. With that said everyone should take public transportation, drive themselves or use Lyft.

title: Perpetual error mssg - “Cannot access the network”
review: I had high hopes for my uner app. It worked once or twice. The last several times i have tried to use it, it opens fine, asks where i want to go, i type in the destination, and that is it. I have tried MANY times all of the troubleshooting available on the uber site.  None made a difference.  What is particularly maddening is that uber has no live support number to call. If you cannot troubleshoot the app yourself, you are done. All the problems with uber forced me to try out lyft - and now i am a huge user of lyft. The app works reliably, which is not true with the uber app, AND lyft has live customer service if you need it. I wish uber was more reliable - i like to have options when purchasing services, but the uber app is persistently unreliable, and ubers refusal to provide live customer support is a huge problem.

title: Please don’t change my comfort without asking
review: I was very pleased with my ride until she cut the air off about 8 miles from the airport and let the windows down without asking. I was suffocating and could not breath. Unfortunately, I had to ask her to please turn the air back on after about 4 miles. This is only my third time using Uber and had good experiences and have heard great reviews and even noticed my driver had a great rating. I thought it was very distasteful to come with comfort and then choose to take away that without asking first. The car was very clean and the drive was excellent. I really wanted to and would have given her a 5 star rating. For the $45 paid, please give me air!!

title: I was waiting in front of building.
review: I was waiting in front of building. Somehow he thought pick up place is one block away. Could be Uber GPS’s fault. Not his. But I don’t know. I was charged waiting time by driver while I was waiting in front of building. Because he was waiting for me one block away. I paid to be picked up in front of the building not car pool. I want waiting time being refund. It was warm night. He had window down his side. He didn’t bother to ask me if I wanted window down or turn on air conditioning. When I commented the car was warm then he asked me I wanted air conditioner but that was almost end of the ride. So I said don’t bother since I am almost at the destination. I always tip and had good experiences w Uber. But not this ride. This ride reminded me of taking yellow cab. Then what is the point of taking Uber??

title: Charged Unwarranted Cleaning Fee WARNING
review: Be wary when using this app and please pay attention to your bank account after rides. I have been using Uber for 3+ years and never had anything bad to say until now. On August 7th I was charged an additional $20 on top of the original $6.50 for a “mess” that required a clean up. Keep in mind, I never eat or drink in Uber’s unless it’s water because Im aware of this problem. I personally think that the driver was unhappy with the short trip and is aware of how easy Uber sides with drivers. I put in a complaint to combat this issue and of course Uber is taking their time. I am a college student and I take $20 being stolen from me very seriously since I’m far from rich. Uber, you need to do something in order to protect your passengers from this fraud!!! I recommend just using Lyft because their customer support far exceeds what Uber is capable of.

title: Lyft is Better
review: I used to only use Uber but they have really let the quality of their product go downhill. Whenever I need a ride, Lyft is always significantly cheaper. Also, I have tried the Uber electric scooters (JUMP scooters) and about half of the ones I tried did not work at all but I still got charged for using them. I tried to use the JUMP electric bikes too, and it would not lock. I had to call Uber and get it resolved and it was extremely frustrating. I got charged for an extra 14 minutes of use and I was late to my meeting because of the poor quality of Uber’s products. I highly recommend Lyft instead, they were much more responsive with any quality concerns and they care more about their customers and drivers. Don’t waste your money on Uber, they’ve proven time and time again that they don’t value our time or money. Poor quality!

If you get a new phone and your card on file has expired before you use it again, you CANNOT even log in to your Uber account on your phone without confirming your old card. title: Horrible algorithm
review: I ordered an express pool ride in San Francisco during the Chinese New Year parade and because of that parade, there were blocked roads. The uber app decided to place me on the other side of the blocked street of the parade, unable to be reached by my uber driver. I can back this up with screenshots that i took but unfortunately this platform wont allow me to share it. Please feel free to contact me for further information.

title: GPS needs work
review:
I never had a problem with Uber pool until the most recent update. On several occasions Uber makes me go out of my way...

For example, when leaving home Uber pick up always sends me to a specific location when I Uber to work, I decided I would be smart and walk to that location as I request my Uber and it sent me to be picked up in front of my home... very annoying

On another occasion while taking Uber pool it made me walk up a block, no biggie.... I noticed a girl walking toward the block I live on...the Uber drives a block up to pick me up...so in short, the Uber driver picked me up from the street she lives on, forcing her to walk an unnecessary block, and Uber picked me up on the block she lives on... causing me to walk an unnecessary block...

title: Good, but...
review: Admittedly, I have not used Uber very much, but the times I have used it, it has worked just fine and conveniently.  However, under Help, there is detailed information on how to schedule a pickup in advance.  In practice, it appears to not exist - at least I can’t seem to find anything in the app that allows me to schedule a pickup in advance.  Help states that there is a car/clock icon to the right of the “Where to” field, but there is no such icon that I can see either on my iPhone, my iPad, or on the web site.  If this feature has been removed, then you need to update Help so that saps like me don’t waste a lot of time trying to figure out just what the heck they are doing wrong.

title: Little Lost and Confused
review: I uber almost everyday from school and sometimes to there also. One thing I notice is that the GPS system in the app is ridiculous! It’s hard for the drivers to find where I am and it usually almost always gets my pickup locations wrong. Also, payment is becoming a problem. I have a card that should automatically take the amount out but now i all of a sudden have to do it manually and sometimes it STILL doesn’t except. The thing usually says “Something went wrong” or “You have an outgoing payment from ___” when I thought it takes the money out automatically. I know there’s money on the card too. Just get this fixed

title: Needs massive improvements!
review:
I really enjoy using the app however...
I have been using uber for a few years now, and I must say as time goes on I’m finding it harder to actually want to use uber. I used to love it and recommend it to everyone who asked. However lately it’s been a nightmare. I have been charged multiple times for a “waiting fee” even though I am ALWAYS outside before my ride arrives. (I find it rude to keep them waiting). There has been times when I have been charged a “cancellation fee” when the driver cancels seconds before arriving to my location. This isn’t right to do to PAYING customers. I wonder how many other people haven’t noticed these charges. Please work on this problem because I really want to love uber again.

title: So easy and convenient
review: I have never been a fan of taking "taxis" but this has exceed my expectations and more. The ability to track and see available cars around your area is phenomenal. The prices vary but if they're short distanced it's highly affordable, each Uber driver I've had so far go above and beyond to give you great service. Plus this is the best way to travel if you're in a hurry they get here in less than 5 mins traditional "taxis" take more than 20 mins before Uber came along. This app is completely user friendly even for the most technologically challenged people. Continue the great work you have a customer for life.

title: I used to love uber
review: I used to love uber way more than lyft but since 2018 started uber has been going downhill, they let anyone drive, they take forever to write you back when you make a complaint lf when a driver cancels, and another thing they literally charge you more than others if you ride uber all the time. If you don’t believe me check it out yourself if you catch uber all the time request a ride and look at the price, and then ask to borrow someone else’s phone and see if they are the same. I was at work twice, and this happened with TWO different coworkers phones, at first i thought it was a mistake or based on rating but she was rated lower than me. Can’t really put the blame on uber, just have to get my own car. Definitely will not be spending my money with uber anymore. Thank you for the time you did help out though.. wish you guys the best!

title: Disappointing
review: I had a driver cancel on almost immediately after he confirmed and I was billed. Then I try another and get declined as they charged me for the whole trip I never took. As we know Uber will NEVER let you talk to a human and provide no option anywhere to do so. So it took countless “help” issues being created to have painfully slow and generic answers given to me. Finally after well over an hour I was told the amount would be credited in 3-5 business days. Great, that really helps me when I’m desperately trying to get to work. They offered no resolution whatsoever and could not care less while intermittently sending me generic response after generic response as I pleaded for some form of temporary resolution at least. I honestly will use a competitor as I was genuinely disgusted by the complete lack of customer service options, especially for such a massive business.

title: Promotion problem.
review: Actually I always had good experience with an uber and I use uber almost everyday and I was so happy and I had no problems until uber gave me a promotion 25% off or 75% off or whatever but I noticed that my promise never worked even though it was showing up on my account that I’ve gotten this promotion and it hasn’t expired yet. I asked for the refund and sent the screenshot of my promotion to them then the uber changed my 75% off promotion to be something else. Anyone has the same problem? And what should I do? Should I keep asking them for refund which is just annoying or I have to just ignore it? You know if uber don’t want me to have the discount promotion. They shouldn’t have sent me any promotion to appear on my account at first.

title: Thanks to Uber made my Ferry
review:
The airline busted 2 of the luggage wheels and told me that Wheels were not included in the luggage insurance. So, when arriving to Seattle in the light Rail and tried to run to catch the 6:35 ferry, I realized that, the way the streets in Seattle are,  and the Brocken wheels bag I had, I was not going to make the ferry. 

There were no taxis outside the light rail station, and I remember I had signed up in Uber years ago.  I had  15 minutes to catch the ferry and I was 8 minutes away.  I got an answer right away and Joe was on his way in 2 minutes.  Helped me with the heavy bags and got me there in time to buy my the ferry ticket and get in.  Super happy with  the service and the Driver!!!

Uber is a great tool, Service is great but no show trip is mysterious. For instance, I called for a ride last time before last time, ETA was showing 2 minutes, then I noticed Uber Car was going to opposite direction where I was calling from, called the driver after 5 mins, Driver was saying that trip got cancelled. My Systems never  showed cancelled until I cancelled after 35 mins. Got a bill from Uber worth of 0 but Uber app asked me to pay BDT 30 to next Driver. My question is, why should passenger pay extra while Driver was not responding for 30 mins. Hope this kind glitches will be fixed soon
title: Service is great but no show trip is mysterious!

review:
Dear Uber. Why did I pay your additional fee in Pool to be dropped off at my exact destination and was still dropped off blocks away to save someone else on time?

And again with pool, why did I remove the option to walk to and from my destination, because I did not want to walk, only for it to then charge me the fee for not walking, and then tell me where I had to walk anyway?

title: Very strange

review:
UPDATE September 24, 2017: 
Uber now allows you to not have your location always tracked!

Original Review, April 13, 2017:
I was laying in bed one night, and I unlocked my my iPhone, and got a notification that Iber had been tracking my location and whether I wanted to stop it. I had taken an Uber that morning so I guess it had tacked me all day. 

Uber is a great app and the concept is great, but this recent change where I always need to share my location is ridiculous. 

Now I say the app can never track my location. Just a bit too creepy to think it might be tracking me. So if I want to use it I need to find a nearby address and type that in as my location. This is a pain. So I've found myself using the Gett app more. 

Gett's cab drivers want nothing more than to make Uber disappear. Continuing to creep its users out is a quick way for Uber to give Gett more of its business and make their cabbies stronger, who will stomp Uber out in city councils around the world. 

So, Uber, just stop tracking me please. I want you to win but you're making it hard.
