title: Great app that needs to save me from myself.
review:
I really love Uber. I’ve never once had a problem with the service, nor have I had any significant problems with the app. Still, I’m giving 4 stars. I’m withholding the 5th star for two reasons:
1. This is the only time I’ve been able to give less than 5 stars to anything Uber without being wracked with guilt, and
2. Observing the animation of the car on a map as it approaches me for pickup is crazy-making. 

Let me explain. 

The only thing that drives (hahahaha) me nuts is watching the little car icon that represents my approaching driver. The animation will tell me the car is 4 minutes away, then the car will spin every which way, go away from me, come back, miss turns, stop moving for interminably long periods—now I’m being told it’s 9 minutes away?!

Ultimately the driver arrives in a timely fashion and all is well. I can imagine myriad ways how the confusion occurs: bounces gps signals, communication between to phones in different places, and so on. But I can’t stop watching that little car. 

Save me from my anxiety and earn the 5th star!

None of these charges matched my app recent trips of transactions and now that I’m bringing it up... they can’t see anything. I’ll be using Lyft from now on.

title: Wonderful!

review:
I use Uber every day to get to/from work. 

I am an expat without a car and it’s useful to have Uber. 

I want to suggest an option for Saved Places, where I can add destinations to my Saved Places any time. Right now, I can only add destinations to my Saved Places during the trip. Sometimes I forget or I have something else to focus on and it’s irritating to be unable to simply save the destination when I arrive. 

I don’t understand why this isn’t an option but please add the ability to add locations to Saved Places any time I want. 

I would also like to be able to add a static pick up spot. Sometimes drivers will arrive but one street over from my apartment. My pickup location for my apartment won’t change, so marking a specific spot for pickup every time would be very useful. 

Finally it would be nice to have the option to select a route. To get to work, google maps recommends a longer route but I know a faster way. If I could edit the route for the driver I could avoid the problem of explaining the faster route to a new driver every day.
title: Almost perfect

review:

It looks like some drivers are finding ways to cheat Uber policies. Sometimes, I noticed that they accept the call and they don’t move from their location for 20 minutes or more. I had to cancel and I was charged a cancellation fee. I talked to another driver and he said this is becoming a common practice with Uber drivers that just want to collect the cancellation fee and take another ride from the competition.
I travel often to Lima and initially I was very happy with the service. Waiting time was about 5 minutes. Now is about 15-20 min. The other day I could not get a driver to accept my request for more than 30 minutes during rush hour. Also the app connection froze. I ended taking a cab from the street which I am very reluctant to do but I had no choice. 
A couple of times I got into a car with a different driver.
Very worried about the reliability of the Uber service in Peru.

title: Uber falling apart in Lima, Peru

review:
Biggest Complaints:

1) Why is it that drivers can pick up a trip BEFORE finishing their other route?!? I'm sorry, but I don't want to wait for a driver to finish taking someone else to their destination, drop them off, and then head towards me, wasting quite a bit of my time when there may be other drivers or taxis nearby who are ready to take me right away.

2) On that note, when I see that a driver is "finishing another route", why is it that I can't cancel to try to get another driver who is actually ready and nearby? When that's the case, and I try to cancel, I get a notice saying I may be charged because the driver is already on their way... BS! I can see they're finishing another trip that's going to take 7 minutes (or whatever it may be)! So why is it that drivers can cancel on me, but when I want to cancel on them (before they're even done with another trip and I'm having to wait on them) I will get charged?!

Uber clearly does not put the customer first. When I want a fast ride, I don't want to wait on someone else's ride. And when I see that my driver is in the middle of a different trip, I want to be able to cancel, without getting charged when they're clearly not yet on the way.

title: Estimated prices.
review: Uber was my number one transportation. As of yesterday im done with Uber. These estimated prices are a joke. My route from school to home is very easy and simple one street straight up. Always $8 or $6 if its early. This driver drove thru different streets and i even told him he went to far from my turn. He just took his time did quiet a few turns on different streets and i was like what are you doing? I got charged $15 at the end of the ride this is ridiculous. Now drivers will drive around so you can get charged more this is stealing. I had $20  to spend on my uber credits now it dipped in to my debit card and over drafted me . Sorry Uber This new change has caused me to leave Uber. Lyft will be my new transportation. That some shady stuff estimated price allowing drivers to ride around and charge more no way. My family and I are done. Thank you

title: Rating Thomas
review:
I can not say enough about our huber driver Thomas tonight; I called an Huber driver tonight for my brother to take him home. He is physically limited with COPD. When I got him in the car he had serious breathing problems. Thomas reacted calmly and with complete professionalism when he called 911 for me. He relayed his condition and completed the call. He then went to his trunk, got out plastic gloves and started monitoring his pulse and kept my brother calm. The paramedics arrived and took over and we went to the hospital. 
I applaud this man for his patience and calmness, and for making me feel calm and that he cared more about my brother then his time. Thank you Thomas!
Gerald Wengert

title: Love Uber. Two suggestions.
review:
Great app! Two suggestions. 1) make it easier to see how to set a pickup time. 2) make it more intuitive to cancel a ride. 

When I schedule a pickup time, it not clear that the pickup time has been scheduled, so it’s way too easy to accidentally book a regular ride, immediately after. Then that ride has to be cancelled, and that is not intuitive either. 

Other than that, I love Uber and the app! We’ve had endless pleasant experiences with the entrepreneurs, who make up the Uber team. As a group, they are friendly, knowledgeable and energetic! Great service! Great experience— time after time!!

title: Wait time.
review:
I have a 3 star and thought about giving even less. Not a reflection on the driver I don’t believe but the billing time. 
I have a lot of friends that recommend Uber and are now going elsewhere. My problem is that every time I book I give Uber 10 min leeway and they are starting yo charge me wait time even though they are at fault. Once the drive was next door and we were waiting and we were charged wait time. Another at the motel we were waiting in front when driver arrived and still charges wait time. 
The last driver didn’t even really help put out bags in the back of the vehicle, only a problem for me because I am a disabled combat vet and a senior so it is harder for me to load the bags. 
Thinking very seriously about trying the competition. 
Jacque Carté

Update: 
So get response from Uber that says they want to resolve the issue and to PM them, only to be sent a message after I send the info they wanted, and told to contact another entity. 
Just a basic run around it looks like. 
Really didn’t expect much different. Heard they were going through some end of stage issues. I can believe that.

title: Bye Uber
review:
The first time I used the app a few years ago I was amazed at its simplicity and ease and super impressed with the cost and quickness/ efficiency to get a ride. 
Fast forward to a recent trip (it has been probably a year or more since I used it) and I’m done.
Not only was the ride cost off by more than $15, I was charged fees I’ve never seen before and for things I had no control over such as pick up time that inconvenienced me and that I was annoyed with to begin with. And there appears to be no recourse or way to lodge any sort of feedback through the app (I’m not complaining about the poor driver). 
So sad that something that started out so great has now fallen by the waste side as just another faceless, clueless, and uncaring corporate monster. 
Now to get this **** off my phone.  I’ll call a taxi before I use Uber again.

title: App Awful
review:
App still awful - now forcing use of location services when the Uber location is notoriously bad in Boston. Sends drivers down one way DRIVEWAYS that they can’t get out of especially in Longwood hospital area. Does not recognize where rider REALLY is waiting even when you type in your exact address. Using UBERx - should not have to walk 1-3 blocks to find a lost driver who has incorrect info from Uber. 

Uber drivers are great, but app remains awful. Location services are extremely inaccurate.
Driver not provided with exact address even though I have location services turned off on my phone and type in my exact address.
Trips get canceled by app when assigned driver is within 1-3 blocks of pickup & new (much farther away) driver assigned with no explanation (using UberX - not pool - resulting in significant change in arrival time with no fare adjustment.)

title: Be careful of safety
review: Uber takes no accountability for safety. They’ve allowed drivers to pick up passengers in 2 door vehicles, older model poor quality cars, and more. I have no idea how the drivers get away with lying about the type of car they’re driving, but Uber is allowing it. Passengers are forced to accept the ride because Uber does not allow us to cancel upon arrival and request new driver due to vehicle options.  STICK with your quality of vehicle standards! NOW a ‘basic’ $5 ride is near $9. Therefore, STOP increasing and adding charges! You were once a great service. Now you’re just a middle man allowing unsafe conditions.  You claim to provide safety community guidelines when you do not. To make matters worse, you say my life is only worth $5. Therefore, be Pro-Passenger, not pro-driver. If it wasn’t for the passenger, there’d be no driver. REMEMBER, not all passengers are bad.😢

title: Fine app but
review:
Fix your update times! My driver is not 3 minutes away when I’ve been waiting for the last 10. This used to happen every once in a while but it’s getting increasingly worse, the other day it said driver was 7 minutes away and he showed up 20 minutes later, I don’t mind the waiting but at least give me accurate wait times. 

Maybe they do this to make sure people are ready in an accurate time but that only works if you say the driver is 3 minutes out and they’re actually 5 minutes out. Some of us are actually on time and waiting for our ride so having an accurate wait time would be nice.

title: Canceled Ride
review:
You charged me five dollars for a canceled ride from Reagan national airport. I am the one that should be paid. The driver went to the wrong place and I had to wait in the cold  with my luggage for almost 30 minutes. He was supposed to meet me on the upper floor gate four and he was waiting In the lower floor. He then told me he’s going to turn around and come back to pick me up. I waited and waited. And then he told me he was parked on the other side of the road and asked me to come and cross the road with my luggage. When I said I can’t he hung up on me. Never had that experience with Uber which I used many times before.  Not good!!
Alan

title: Wait fee when I wasn’t even late!
review: This morning, I booked a ride with Uber ahead of time, to be picked up between 11:30 and 11:45am. I started getting the notifications that my driver was on his way at 11:10, and at 11:15 I was informed that he was there. I wasn’t ready, as I’d booked for 15 minutes later!  I called my driver to let him know I’d be right there, and that I wasn’t expecting him yet. I don’t believe I should have been charged the wait fee, as I booked for a certain time, but my driver was significantly early. He told me he’d run into this problem with pre-booked rides before. It’s a problem with the app, sounds like. It was only $2.22, but it’s about the principle of it. If I book a time, and my driver is early, I shouldn’t be penalized for it.

title: Stick with other ride sharing apps
review: I’ve used uber for years. And I’ve always been okay with the application, drivers, and overall experience. But lately uber has been very bad with their driving algorithm for pooling. The eta times are never correct, it will always seem like it till get you to a place in time but add 15-40min on it. Depending on if your city or suburbs. It’s even wrong in the “no later than” time. Also the routes it chooses is just poor. I would be going to one side of the city and it would be pick up a passenger on the other side of the city and literally pass the point in which it picked me up in the first place on its way back to drop me off. So disappointed. Once is fine, twice is coincidence, but now I’m just thinking there route algorithm is not up to par.

title: Needs work
review: Uber was ok before but now, they’ve changed things that don’t need to be changed. They need a customer service phone line. Emailing is annoying & you never speak to the same person twice. Which means, the new person answering has to read all previous messages, which they don’t, & that’s stupid. VIPs need to be treated as such. If I’m taking an Uber everyday to work, I should get a discount where rare riders don’t. Drivers need to be held accountable for accepting a ride & then not picking that person up or calling you before pickup & then cancelling your ride bcuz they don’t wanna go that direction. Uber needs to stop being greedy with surge pricing. A usual $7-$10 ride, during surge pricing, shouldn’t be $59-$104, that’s absolutely ridiculous.

title: Needs a serious fix in order to work properly
review:
Firstly, and mentioned, probably, by everyone here, the GPS is terrible. It doesn't recognizes what side of the street you're, what's the precise address, etc  (it may cost you a lot of time trying to reach the driver and self explaining a new route). 

Secondly, and not less important, the uber drivers. Wow. I don't know what kind of selective process it uses but let's face it. It doesn't work, at least in Brazil. Uber's team is made by non drivers that: 1) don't  drive properly, 2) don't  know how to follow a GPS (partly Uber's fault), 3) don't know how to deal with customers.

Last but not least, as mentioned above there's a high chance of having your trip delayed, and for the first time in the history of customer services, you, customer will pay for their malfunction. How? Being charged small amount of cash when their driver cancel or even quits trying to get to your location. Not just cash but, as said before, cost you a lot of time embarrassing you to you're bosses, friends, dates etc.

Unfortunately in Brazil we don't have a good public transportation because I'm a daily user but craving to stop using, its such a pity.

review: I used to love Uber application but lately they are always messing up with the pick up and sometimes drop off. They can’t find my address anymore and before it used to appear the pick up at the same place I wanted and now it always send the car to a pick up point that is far from where I am. Also the directions for drop off used to be very straightforward and now is always going around , many times in circles to take me to my destination. I wonder if it is in purpose to bill more money .

title: Safe & efficient
review: Uber has been my main transportation as of this year. All the cars I’ve been in are clean and maintained. I usually look at the rating & the number of trips that the driver has done before hopping into the car. I know a lot of people here are complaining that some drivers don’t speak English. However, I love meeting people from all over the world! It’s multicultural and some drivers share their cultures when I try to have conversation with them. I like the features in the app also especially when the app notify me when the driver will pick up/drop off another person while pooling.

title: Philadelphia Uber
review: I had two rides earlier today with Uber in Philadelphia and tonight I’m getting a notification from my credit card company that there’s an additional approved charge. When I checked the receipt, there was a WAIT TIME charge for both visits. First of all, neither driver had to wait for me! I had to call the first driver before he arrived to ensure he cane to the right location, because they usually DON’T. Then, the second driver drive past me and then stoop in the middle of the street expecting me to cross the street in the traffic with my luggage! He had his music blasting in the car and then started ‘sharing’ his personal life stories ....like I actually cared! I just wanted to get to the airport on time. So I guess because I didn’t tip their drivers for these trips...when I normally do...Uber charges me WAIT TIME when NO ONE had to wait for me!! Ridiculous!!!!

title: Driver left me standing
review: At midnight at the airport my Uber driver called me to ask me where I was headed to and I found out that the reason he picked someone else up even though I had agreed to the price and he was on his way, it was because he was also driving for lift and decided to go with a different fare that would be of a longer distance for him. Needless to say I was very upset as he passed me by and I was trying to wave him down with my phone with the other passenger in his backseat. The next Uber driver that picked me up was a true gentleman. Lesson is you don’t tell a Uber driver where your destination is. They are not supposed ask that.

title: Genius.
review:
I use UBER all the time - in all cities in the USA - and I have had nothing but stellar service from the app and the drivers.  It’s a real pleasure to use UBER.  Has changed my life.   Can’t believe these negative reviews here for one second.  

Only one time did I have an issue.  UBER driver drove right past my exit (ie I could see his course of travel on my phone) and driver kept on driving and driving further away from my home.  I suspect driver was double dipping between UBER and LYFT - and needed to drop off LYFT passenger before coming to get me.   No worries though. I simply canceled the ride and got a new UBER no muss, no fuss.  No charge.  

Genius.

title: Bad Customer Support
review:
So far I had very good experience using app and with drivers around where ever I have used this app.

But recently on one of booking driver refused for ride as he wants me to cancel the ride and pay him all the cash so he can drop me to my location privately.

I took initiative to file complaint against such practice and make aware such things on Uber support platform. As ride wasn’t taken so it won’t be available in my ride history but I spoke to Driver using “Uber call option on app” so I asked them to fetch details from there end as neither I am having any more details , though I gave details of my pickup location, driver name as it appeared on my recent list as “ xxx Uber”, time for requesting ride.

Besides all above things that I did in courtesy I re-shared details so that other fellow passengers shouldn’t be framed such way and their trips can be tracked on Uber till drop off location (safety reasons only)
But Uber support mocked me repeatedly by same copy paste messaging lines and asked to share details on help option and further asked me to write everything in English (that I was doing , with very few grammatical errors).

Anyway thanks for such ordeal Uber team.

I am giving 0 stars for such support team. Thanks !

title: Poor drivers choice
review: I needed to get to work quick so I checked both Uber and Lyft to see how many drivers are nearby. Uber had one car down the street from my home and another 5 minutes away at the mall yet still gave me a driver 11 minutes away and in the middle of another ride instead. I called and told him if he could cancel my trip to save me from being late to work and he never did. had to wait so I don’t waste $13 and got I trouble at work. Uber NEVER EVER asks drivers if they want to accept a ride when I’m in an Uber, they just get added on. So why give me the FARTHEST and LEAST WANTED person in my area? Uber gets on my nerves because this happens 3/5 times when I want a ride. Always gives me the most farthest rider and it’s annoying for someone who just wanted a quick ride and could’ve used lyft which would’ve been faster.

title: New interface or mistake?
review:
Well, it’s a mistake either way. I book a ride, it says meet at pickup spot, but then doesn’t show my driver on the map anymore? Is this a new interface or is a technical mistake?

If it’s a new interface, wow, what a colossal failure to know what your product is. Why would I choose this product over a traditional cab if I can’t track the progress the Uber is making to get to me? That’s what made Uber better- I could see it coming plan my exit. Why would I want to be told to go wait at a pickup point like a child after school waiting for their parents when Lyft gives me the ability to head outside exactly as the car is arriving? It must be a mistake. Either way, I’ll be going with one of your competitors for a while until y’all work it out.

title: Random Prices

review:

Close out and open it again and the prices will be raised even more. Try another time and it might be lowered; I did this multiple times within 10-20 seconds and the prices changed dramatically each time.

They constantly change pricing to make more cash, has nothing to do with traffic or availability etc.

They also now updated the app so you request rides at the estimated price (example $10-12) but literksly no cars will pop up for 5min so then the app asks “do you want to upgrade to a new Uber for a higher price that’s available now?” And all the options of the new cars they offer are literally over $30 dollars lol. This app and company is a scam.

title: Theft
review:
Be sure to check every trip you take. I have easily been charged on 4 different occasions almost double my trip amount. Uber will let you request the ride at $10 and then make the base rate a different price once the ride happens resulting in a $24 charge to your account (without your permission.) The customer service is so hit or miss it’s almost useless. They will refund your wait time fee of mere pennies on the dollar instead of the addtl $10 they snuck on your base rate, on top of that their CS reps will ignore your responses when replying to them and leave you again frustrated. It does what it’s supposed to do in getting you from A to B but I wouldn’t trust uber as far as I could throw them. Especially with access to my debit card number.

They pull up to your destination a block away even if your destination has a crescent driveway...so you don’t see them. Finally, when you try calling them because you can’t find them, they don’t answer. Afterwords, they cancel the trip due to customer reasons and then you just spent 15 mins of your life waiting for a car that didn’t want to pick you up in the first place;  get charge 6 dollars for a driver, driving further away from you so you can cancel the trip yourself. MONEY HUNGRY Company!! I am so tired of wasting my time !!!

title: The Best App Investment
review: I love Uber. But like all businesses they have their pros and cons. They always cater to their valued customers. Uber will give you discounts and ride passes all of the time. However, they do get their money’s worth with the surge charges. I wish the XL and SUV rides weren’t that expensive. Yes they have more space and they carry more people, however the car is going the same route. I honestly don’t know why it cost so much. They don’t have a customer service phone number but emailing will do the job just fine. Also if you have been overcharged or have an unknown charge for something Uber will not hesitate to remove or investigate the charge. I highly recommend Uber.

title: Uber app - usually dependable
review:
Most conversations with Uber drivers seem to start with how unreliable and frustrating the app is, on both sides. Most of the time it's fine, but maybe once in 4 or 5 uses, it randomly changes the pickup point - usually some distance away. Most drivers realize the fault lies in the app, not in the customer typing in the wrong address - but occasionally it leads to a heated conversation and a missed ride. 
Minor point - predicted ETA is frequently unreliable, but usually only by a minute or two in either direction. 
It's interesting, sometimes funny, to watch the incoming vehicle icon spinning around, going the wrong way on one-way streets, or moving at light speed: none of which is (probably) happening.

title: Needs to improve!!!
review: Needs to improve in a lot of stuff. We need to speak with actual humans in  customer service. Needs improve in gps navigation sometimes the routes are way off and not in the same location when using pool as it says. Sometimes it takes me 50-1hr when I use pool. It shouldn’t take that long because of so many pick ups. I take uber everyday morning and afternoons they should have a special package for people that use your transportation everyday. Also I don’t like when you give me a “uber credit” NO! give us our money back back to our bank account that’s not even right. Please improve I know you probably don’t care but I’m pretty sure people can agree with me. Thank you.

title: Can't cancel the ride
review: There's an option to cancel the ride but you have to pay the fee. I understand and think that the fee is necessary if people keep changing their mind and just want to cancel the ride without a reason. But if the driver didn't arrive on time and was taking extra long to pick up, there's no option for us to cancel without extra charge. So you are stuck, you cannot change your plan to take taxi or other transit but you have to keep waiting for the driver to come pick up, or else, pay $40 for canceling the ride. It'd be great if there's that option or the estimated time has to be improved to be more accurate.

title: UBER EXPRESS POOL IS TRASH
review: I was a loyal Uber user, used the app at least 3x a day. I've used all the functions on Uber, pool, x, xl, elite you name it I've used it. I was unpleasantly surprised when I saw the Uber pool express option pop up. I have a number of issues with this new function. For starters this is being advertised as a more economical option but it's just a sorry excuse for them to raise the Uber x prices. Now the regular pool cost what the x use to cost and the x is this ridiculously higher price. This function is also ableist and unsafe! I've seen post of people having to walk 7 blocks through major traffic or in the night in unsafe neighborhoods. I understand that there are other options you can choose but this is just preying on those who rely on Uber and are not wealthy. title: Disappointed!!!!
review: Anar was very good.  But TWO drivers decided to cancel on us, leaving us standing in the rain, when they were only moments away from our pickup point!!! I tipped my previous driver your highest tip rate, and gave him a cash tip + a 5 star rating. My thoughts are that you should have drivers who are committed to serving clients before their own personal interests. As far as I’m concerned, I don’t see a reason to use UBER again based on your drivers’ lack of business ethic.

title: CANCELATION FEES
review:
I don't like it when we charged a cancelation fee when a driver is driving the other way and obviously does not want to take the ride.  At this point we are left not choice but to cancel and rebook another ride.  By this time we are charged a cancelation fee for nothing.  This then becomes a problem when the ride is a business trip and becomes an issue for expenses.  Uber says that the credit is then done on the next ride, but no where you can visibly see credit.  I have tried to call to discuss but you can't call UBer.  If this keeps up, I will use another source of transportation.  
I like Uber, but I really don't like being charged for nothing.

title: It was great until It was not
review: Always used Uber cause they were solid on the prices, I used it for around 5 years but now it’s changed, I just cancel my account cause after being charge for my trip on my card as always but this time they charge me almost double the next day cause NY Congestion Surcharge, I don’t mind paying it but it should be charged when the trip is asked like any other taxes, it’s not like that’s something new but charge after almost double and not even have a link to talk to a representative about it that’s just untrustworthy, what will be next.. I hope that Uber have some more sense about not just over charging people after we the costumer  pay what the price was given. I can’t trust companies like this. If that happens to anyone of you costumers of Uber please think about it. It’s not worth the risk.

title: Fees- pick up location
review:
Uber never seems to get my pick up location right. It’s not really a problem when I’m at home, because I can manually reset it. but when I’m traveling and don’t have a great idea of where I am, I need to trust the GPS. More than half the time it gets my location wrong, so the pick ups either get cancelled or I get charged waiting fees. 

Similarly, I shouldn’t be charged for cancelling rides that take way too long. A lot of drivers will take 2-3 times longer than estimated (one couldn’t get to me at all but wouldn’t cancel), but if I cancel I still get charged fees. If the problem is with the driver, I should not have to pay. I don’t complain when it’s just a few extra minutes, but it’s regularly more than double the estimated wait time.

The second experience consisted of my driver being at my destination but not getting me for 10 minutes. After I got in the car, he was messing around with his phone and deleted my destination and asked me to reenter it. As a result, my fare changed from $12 for a Pool to a $19-25 range for a UberX once I put the destination in again and Uber Support told me there was nothing they could do about that.

review:

I watched as drivers accepted to pick me up and cancelled one after the other. This went on for about 20 minutes and continued for another 25 minutes after I called and waited for a traditional taxi service. 

***Heres my issue with Uber - instead of Uber having it in their algorithm to ask me if I would like to cancel after a driver cancels on me, the app automatically begins searching for a new driver. ***

After getting fed up of this cycle and calling my local taxi service, I had to pay $11 to the final Uber driver for inconveniencing him. No the value wasn't much but it did add insult to injury and I after my two terrible experiences I will never use Uber again nor recommend their services to anyone. 

Look, if you're accustomed to a certain level of service and professionalism - just contact a professional driving service.

review:
Am a long term Uber fan. 

However: 

Could you please you train drivers to learn basic local geography? This includes really basic factors - DC as as a city and DC neighborhoods are divided into quadrants called Northwest, Southwest, Southeast and Northeast? Right?

Drivers will never find the right address if they DONT KNOW this infrastructure or get this basic fact wrong, as my driver just did. She was wandering around in Southwest instead of Northwest - an hour away from the right address - as a result. 

Also could you explain to drivers that streets are mainly organized alphabetically in Washington? For example,  "S Street" comes before or after "R" street and it is not short for "Southern Street", as my driver was just insisting.  

Do you have any maps? Could your drivers  please be expected to learn basic landmarks (e.g. Pentagon, "Senate", "White House") - basic orientation would help drivers a lot. 

Finally - not sure why -- but Uber does not seem to use mainstream/normal navigation apps. Your drivers typically get directed to the back of many (most) large buildings in Washington even when the address is very clear  instead of to the correct address. Why? Huge waste of time for all concerned.  Get Googlemaps! 

Thank you.
title: Uber Washington challenges

I’m done with Uber now after this last ride.

Uber only responded in short answers telling me it was an issue with my card and my card wasn’t compatible with them, neither of which was true. I had used both cards I tried on the app elsewhere that night (successfully), I don’t believe that my Visa and Amex card are “incompatible with Uber,” and I even used Apple Pay on a different app after this ordeal. Every payment method had worked successfully outside of the Uber app. Uber didn’t care to fix my issue, try to accurately pinpoint the problem, or make sure I got a ride. I deleted the app and my account, from now on I’ll just use Lyft.

review: One of the most frustrating apps I've used. The app was incredibly slow and didn't allow me to sign up, kept going back to different steps in the sign up process, so I signed up on my laptop. I signed in on the app after creating my account on my laptop and tried to update certain information and other things like my profile picture. App wouldn't let me, told me I needed to contact support to do so. I then proceeded to add my payment method. The app wouldn't add my card saying I was already using my card on the account. I went back and checked and it wasn't on there. Left the app and tried to see if I could add it on the website and I couldn't. I went back to the app, it had logged me out, so I tried to sign in once more. Told me my account was suspended. Incredibly irritating, I am just going to use Lyft.

title: Mixed emotions

review:
I love the Uber service.  Please don’t misunderstand.  
My issue is with the app.  
There are some issues with ride requests timing out for assist and for WAV.  That makes it very difficult & can honestly get a bit stressful.  I also can’t find and specs for WAV rides.  It seems there should be info somewhere to allow clients to get ramp measurements, number of additional seats available, etc. 
I’ve also noticed that when selecting a ride, there is no space for a note to the driver.  There are things that may make finding the location to pick us up difficult, such as a flag lot, a hard to see address or a certain driveway or corner.  Being able to note that with our ride info could be helpful.

title: Worst First Experience Ever

review: A few nights ago was our first experience using Uber. We used it three times. The first two were great. The third we did NOT get what was shown to us on the screen. We were shown the first level of vehicle. Cost being 20 but knew it would end up being $23 or so. After we arrived home we realized we had been overcharged. I realized Uber has said we were charged correctly. I realize that. But that’s NOT the case. It is not what we agreed to. I would never ask or agree for a $60 vehicle. We didn’t need it because there was only two of us. It makes no sense. This was our first experience using Uber and now we are rethinking ever using it again. They have the worst customer service ever. You can’t talk to anybody. They don’t listen. All they do is tell you that you’re wrong. Horrible customer service!

title: Compliments for my driver Sayed
review: If you are in the DC area, please seek out Sayed as your Uber driver. He was professional, courteous, helpful, an excellent driver, and extremely intelligent. He has been in the States for 2 years but speaks impeccable English. While his professional background is in IT, he is equally conversant in any number of subjects. It’s people like Sayed who make me hopeful that one day soon this country will regain its global reputation for embracing diversity and inclusivity. With people of his caliber, we have the opportunity to make this great country even greater! Best of luck to you and your family in the future, Sayed. It was a pleasure driving with you.

title: Terrible customer service support
review: Today I left my cell phone in my Uber. I called it multiple times and after a few minutes it automatically began to go to voicemail meaning the driver turned the phone off because it was 5 in the morning my phone was fully charged. After navigating Uber’s poorly put together website, I found out the only support number is for the drivers. So now I can’t reach the driver. I can’t get into my Uber app via my iPad and this driver basically decided to keep my phone and there is nothing I can do to report them. Though ultimately it’s my fault for leaving my device, Uber should have a more strict policy on what drivers should have to do in the event an item is left. I will be spending my money with Lyft moving forward.

title: There is no way to talk to an actual human when you need help.
review: I ordered from Uber eats of the Uber app. After getting my order several days later I went into my bank account and noticed that Uber charged me twice on two separate days for the same amount. My order was placed on December 31, the first transaction was on January 2, and the second transaction was on January 4. When trying to contact Uber to get my refund of at least one of the transactions. My help options were very limited in fact I couldn’t even find anywhere where it says contact us. I’ve never had any trouble with Uber or Uber eats before I don’t know what happened with this transaction. But the customer service is absolutely ridiculous. I still have not received a refund for one of the transactions that hit my bank account.

title: Hidden fee for “Long Pickup” - dishonest pricing
review: I scheduled a ride and was given an upfront price of $8-9. However upon completion of the ride and after looking at my receipt I noticed Uber added on a “Long Pickup Fee” because the driver was coming from quite a ways up the road. This was not added in the initial estimate for the ride and I did not know about it until after the ride. We, as riders, should not be punished for our driver accepting a ride if they are a considerable distance away. It is not within our power to control who does and doesn’t accept our ride requests. I was very displeased with this hidden charge and I was not able to dispute it within the app or a customer service line, as I couldn’t locate any sort of customer service number to call. Will not be using Uber again.

title: No support
review: Probably the worst customer service I’ve ever dealt with. There’s essentially none. You go through the app which is very difficult to navigate for support and they give you preset issues that often don’t match the one you’re dealing with. If you don’t have one of the two issues that they have in their app, you’re pretty much screwed bc that’s the only support service they have. I just found out that I have been charged for a bunch of rides and Uber hasn’t given me any way of contacting them. I called the number and they said it’s only for drivers. I emailed and they said the request did not go through. I keep being prompted to use the app which is not letting me talk to anyone because of its preset system of discounting any issues you want to talk about with the company. It’s so sad that their so cheap.

title: Advice
review:
Aipana was professional and nice. And I would add a tip, but her vehicle was badly dented, and VERY cluttered. The trunk was half full of personal “stuff”, and was unable to accommodate our bags (coming from the airport). The front seat was also full of clothing and “stuff”.
Plus ... the seat cover on the backseat prevented us from fastening seatbelt, creating a safety hazard. Had it not been so late in the evening, I would have turned her away. You need to get that fixed. I will NOT accept that level of “un-safety” in the future.
Moreover ... you charged me $0.55 for a delay. THE DELAY WAS HER’s, NOT MINE. I PROVIDED DOOR LOCATION AND DESCRIPTION OF US. WE DID NOT CAUSE THE DELAY, so that can be your tip.

title: Lost Item
review: Absolutely unbelievable ! My rider was 2 minutes from my house and I realized I left my key. I was charged $15 for this error. Ok, will now use another service. I am so disappointed. I do not tip on the App, but always give my drivers extra cash. So sad. Such a poor business model. I have been using  your service for years but will now use Lift. Such a disappointment! And apparently every nickname you put in is already taken. Why do I have to put in a nickname? I have never ever forgotten an item in a ride and had to ask the driver to return. Extremely poor business model.

title: Absolute Diaster
review: Had to request the Uber driver to stop our trip and let us out. He failed several times to safely follow a route for us. First, he could not find the exit from the parking lot. Second, he turned the wrong way on a one-way street and headed into on-going traffic. Third, he missed the exit to our destination area and went in the opposite direction from our destination. Fourth, he was operating in the left lane of a multi-lane interstate highway when he realized the exit he needed to take came up and he abruptly crossed four lanes of traffic to make the exit and at a high rate of speed. At this point, we asked him to take us to a safe location where we could exit and cancel our trip. We do not believe that we should incur any expense and this operator should not be permitted to continue to operate for you in your name.

title: Pretty good, could be better
review: My biggest complaint is the lack of features and accessibility for the blind/visually impaired. Often I have drivers pick me up at my gps location and they end up going to the wrong area, call and ask where I’m at. I’m blind, I don’t know what’s around me business wise. If they had a feature to inform the drivers automatically I had vision issues it would help greatly. The “messaging the driver” feature doesn’t make sense because most drivers don’t read them or it would require them to use their phone while driving. The light colored feature is good but many drivers don’t use it either.

title: GPS & Payment option needs work
review:
Though no fault of the driver, the app’s GPS still needs work. I’ve had drivers apologizing to me that they had to turn around because Uber’s map directed them to left into a “No Left Turn” sign. I still need to be picked up and dropped off 2 houses away because I live on a corner house.
Also, Uber’s payment option is still glitchy especially if you have several options like ApplePay and Uber Cash. It always chooses my American Express even though I have the toggle on for Uber Cash. 
Restarting the app several times is annoying but eventually works. 

I’ve been a solid 5 star rider for almost 2 years and there is no such thing as customer service for this glitchy app. However, 99% of my drivers have been great so that’s the only reason why I haven’t gone to Lyft… yet.

title: Uber won’t let me use it and won’t fix my problem
review: I never do this, but I can’t even use their service thanks to an error. I transferred my number back to my iPhone  from VOIP for safe keeping while I was in Japan for a year. I come back and try to use Uber, it says my number is incompatible. I contact customer service, send them the screenshot proof, they say it’s fixed. Same error. 2nd time, repeat the same steps. Same error. My number is verified. Third time with customer support, the guy sends me the same message over and over while I tell him how poor how service is. I had no trouble with Lyft. Accepted my number and was on the go. Why do I keep trying? Justice? Who knows, but they have not helped me in the least in one month of trying, and the apps auto detect VOIP doesn’t work properly and screwed me. Thanks for nothing.

title: Good Overall, Some Changes Needed
review: For one the surge pricing is outrageous sometimes. I’ve had multiple experiences where an uberX to my house 5 miles away is over $300. This is ridiculous. Another issue is drivers canceling pickups because of the trip length. Multiple times drivers have cancelled the pickup on me after calling and asking the trip length. When I tell them it’s about 3 miles, they hang up and cancel the ride. I eventually got an uber home after 4 cancelled Ubers and 20 minutes of waiting. There needs to be some sort of cap on surge pricing, and fines need to be put in for Uber drivers who repeatedly cancel pickups on riders for shorter distance trips.

title: Wait charge
review: Last night I called an Uber for my husband and I.  I watched when he would arrive and waited outside as it said he had arrived. Could not find him and when I texted him he said he was outside waiting. Nope he went to the wrong address. Gave him address again and he called me 10 minutes or so to say he was across the intersection and told me to meet him there. I told him to please pull around to where we were as it was pouring out and I was in high heels. So he pulled around to get us and got us to our destination and I gave him over 20% tip. Today I find that he had the nerve to charge us a waiting fee. We were where we said we would be and he was not at the right place and asked us to trudge across a large puddled street in the cold pouring rain. It was only .43 but not at all should we have been charged any wait fee!

title: Navigational Inconveniences
review:
I have experienced a different location was set while awaiting to be picked up from my actual location. The navigation was set to a few houses away from where I initially wanted to be picked up. I specifically remember seeing current location as I was putting the address to be dropped off. It was an inconvenience for me, as I had to walk with my many bags to my driver because I didn’t want him to leave me behind. The passenger we picked up on the way to my location had mentioned he experienced the same issue, and had to walk himself a block over. As a result we waited, and as the passenger mentioned he had set his location and we were not where he wanted to be picked up. 
I think it has something to do with the navigation but we must resolve this issue soon or I will expunge the app.

title: Uber Pool Update
review: This new Uber Pool Update which requires you to walk to meet you Uber isn’t  really helpful. For one it makes you feel as if you’ve wasted your money even order Uber in the first place because you have to walk halfway to meet your driver. The app then required you to pay an extra dollar if you want to be picked up at your direct location which is excessive and waste of money. Secondly, if someone wants to call an Uber Pool without paying an extra fee and now has to walk around in an area they are unfamiliar with. Or if the rider has to walk to the Uber driver for 5min in order to be picked up in an Uber pool and the Uber driver leaves and cancels the tris because you’re late to meet them walking to an randomly selected meeting destination. Please get rid of this new Uber pool update. It’s not working for the driver or the rider.

title: Getting Frustrated
review:
I use Uber very frequently and lately I’ve had some real issues. I’ll get assigned a driver and then they seem to just sit in one place for ages before actually coming. They usually make an excuse. Either traffic - which is false because you don’t just sit in one place for five plus minutes because of traffic or they are with another customer which is also BS because the app says when they are finishing another ride. 

But what’s really prompted me to write this review is that my last two rides have included a “waiting” fee. 

One trip I had to run down an airport Terminal with my luggage even though I was at the exact numbered point I was instructed to be at and they drive right pass me (and yes, I was waving the color screen like an idiot trying to flag them down).

The other trip, I was literally standing outside my house waiting for the pickup so I can even begin to understand that. 

It’s only $0.20 but it’s not on the receipt in the app, only on the email. I hate hidden fees and I hate being nickeled and dimed and I especially hate being penalized for something I did not do wrong....

I have been a pretty loyal Uber user but with other choices now, I may be making the switch.

title: Real Review
review:
things aren’t always perfect, drivers are sometimes rude while others are considerate
and pleasant, and pool is just too many stops sometimes with us squishing in the car. However it is efficient, and a lot of times cheaper which is a huge plus (though the rides add up sometimes). Deals and discounts are granted to those who have had the app for quite a while which comes in handy! Lately many issues with drivers (i live in NY) however Uber costumer service has been the best in helping fix unfair charges. Also sometimes weird routing that seems longer that it should be. App is overall worth it though 🤷🏽‍♀️.

title: Wonderful but the GPS...
review: I love the convenience of Uber! Every Uber driver I’ve had, has provided me with a spectacular experience, and it’s a much better experience than taking a cab... however, my only complaint is that their GPS system seems to either send the driver to the wrong address when picking me up and/or makes the driver take the longest route possible to get to my location. To me, this hasn’t been a big enough inconvenience to give the app less than 4 stars because my driver is able to text me when s/he isn’t able to find my location. Uber can use some improvements, but I would still highly recommend!

title: Taking advantage
review: As of late I’m disappointed at this service, I’ve used this occasionally for when I visit areas I’m not familiar with on vacation. But Friday night was the last straw and I want to be heard. I booked a ride at a bar across from the beach in SD and the ride was originally $27. The driver charged me a cleaning fee for sand that I did not even bring to the car, we weren’t even on the beach, we came out of a building and now charged me $70 and apparently the driver sent pictures of sand all over the seats. This is unfair and wrong because we weren’t even covered in sand or dirt, we came out of a bar. He planted that mess and now I feel taken advantage of my card being charged over the amount and now I’m going to dispute it with my bank, I will never trust this app again and no one will listen on contact email so here’s my complaint.

review: My experience, and my understanding is that most everyone has had a similar experience: they are great. I never have to wait longer than 15 minutes for a ride. Usually less. Nine out of 10 drivers are courteous and clean and make good conversation. Or stay quiet if you're not in the mood. The prices are a little high and it's encouraging me to figure out other ways to get around, as well as just not drink out at bars. But still it's a priceless app , just to be able to get a ride most places you are. I've used it in a rural areas in Connecticut as well as New York City.
title: Does Uber really need reviews?

review: Unfortunately every ride I request in the past recently has caused delays from when the app said I would get a ride or to my destination. I ordered a car, waited 11 minutes, then the driver cancelled when they were literally at the corner of my street. I had to wait ten minutes for another driver. Many times I am switched between drivers as they are on their way to pick me up. Drivers often circle the blocks unnecessarily or take longer routes, making my original “three minutes to pick up” into 8 or more minutes every time. Drivers are often rude and don’t apologize for delays. They don’t pull up to where you are waiting and they don’t drop you off immediately in front of your destination.

title: Looking for a car in a hurry, SKIP UBER

review:
I use Uber regularly and have had several occasions where the driver was unable to identify where exactly I was located. Sometimes I’ve had to walk a block to get to the driver, which seems a bit ridiculous. I am an able bodied person but not everyone is. One time the driver couldn’t find me at all, I was in a parking lot. I could see the driver going back and fourth before he gave up and picked up someone else.
If I can see the driver, why can’t they see me the same way? It seems silly and quite annoying, actually.
It has not stopped me from using the app but I do use Lyft sometimes and probably wouldn’t have gone that rout at all if I had not experienced this major flaw.

title: Only semi convenient

review:
Why is it that everything is an experience now? The tipping experience?! Really. 
The latest update includes improvements to the tipping experience. How about improvements for a better way for the drivers to find my location. The pick up experience, the ride experience, the drop off experience... what’s next, the shutting of the car door experience when I exit the ride. Really, the tipping experience. 
Overall the service & the drivers have been very good that’s why I given you 5 stars, but come on, the tipping experience. It’s not the parting of the Red Sea.
title: The Tipping Experience?

review:
I use to use uber almost every day and night. Once on my way to the airport on an Uber loft, where I took more time that needed, I was the 2nd passenger. The Uber drop the lady with me, then took another passenger, then dropped him, then another passenger, then I noticed the driver was driving the opposite way to airport. Starting being late, I begged the passenger to get another Uber and the driver to drive me for a cash payment. I was in the car but in the system it’s like I wasn’t. You could see my profile still in the Uber but every time the drive had notifications for new customers. 
When finally could reach customer service the day after, they just wanted to refund a ridiculous 17$ without any way to solve this inconvenient where I was about to lose a flight and were not nice on the phone. 
Such a shame
title: System failure on Pool

review: If I could give Uber a ZERO, I would! They outsource their customer and driver support. Good luck getting your point across to someone in India. I have repeatedly asked Uber for a supervisor or the number for their legal team and they have ignored my request over and over.  They won Prop 22 in California forcing drivers to be “Independent Contractors” yet stand in the way when drivers try to take advantage of the benefits of being an “Independent Contractor” Try and file an “Exempted Nevada Business License” and you will see what I see.  Uber is unethical at best. Go LYFT all the way.  Lyft actually does background checks on all their drivers after the Pandemic to ensure safety. UBER didn’t run one background check on any of their inactive drivers. They just wanted to make sure you paid your fees.  Who do you think the SAFER company to ride with is?
title: Ratings Ratings Ratings

review: i put in the app for a 10, no, 9 minute drive, and it costed me 20 dollars and by the time we almost got “there”, i finally got connection, 17 minutes later, and found out that we past the place and was going to a totally different place cause for him the place was — bar inn but for me it showed — lake inn on the app. Because I was almost late i changed it costing me an extra 2 dollars for a mistake the app made. So i had to go to the change destination thing, edit, and since it was already on it, I just reselected the location. Got me real mad but thought to myself I would get a refund for it if I reported it and these guys really just said quote “i am sorry for the gps issue but since you have already payed, we will not change the price”. ....... I will never use an uber again.
title: I will never use it again

review:
Well , I was using Uber for a 4 years from now , since I moved to USA . 
Some of drivers very nice , some of them very rude .
I have two kids 5 and 3 years old and I always take boosters for them .
First - I don’t like that Uber doesn’t have any option to choose car with car seat . And I can’t add additional passengers to let driver know that I won’t be alone - I have two kids with me . And
Than I often see their eyes , like I have while football team with me .

And I just left his car , shut the door, take my kids back and call to Uber . And they didn’t do nothing . I’m not gonna use Uber anymore . It’s not child friendly in my opinion and some drivers too . Little kids are human too !
title: I’m not satisfied with Uber drivers and Uber child friendliness.

review: If I can give this app zero stars I will! They’ll literally charge you for extra things randomly for no reason, They charged me from cents to dollars and I still don’t even know what that mean And The fact that they don’t even have a customer service number pisses me off! They only have a call line for the “drivers”. I’ll literally have difficult issues and they want us to go on the help section in the app that don’t even match my issues and it’s so frustrating!! The only reason I even use this app just because I have to go to work but other than that it’s just terrible JUST TERRIBLE! Also, the drivers don’t even go by the pinpoints you want them to meet you at and they’ll still charge YOU for long pick up UNFAIR! I’m still trying to figure out how to reach them to get my money back!

title: Unnecessary!!!

review: I use uber to get me literally everywhere but now I had to start using lyft when uber decides to mess up. The drivers on uber either accept rides and don’t move or accept them, drive half way to you and cancel. That leaves me being late to school, to work or to anywhere i’m heading. Here in the past two weeks it’s been happening every morning and I must say I am very disappointed. This app is unreliable and when I try to get a refund for all these cancellations when the driver doesn’t move or answer my calls they only refund me once and not all of the other times. I would not recommend unless you enjoy being late to everywhere you go for absolutely no reason

title: A rollercoaster

review: We requested an Uber from Navy Pier to 2911 North Seeley Avenue. However, Uber did not give driver the street number. Consequently she took us to the wrong side of town. We tried to edit /adjust via my app, but were unable to do that. This prevented our driver from picking up her next fare and our charges increased dramatically. I know this because we took Uber this morning to the same destination. I am requesting that you credit my account to the $17-$18 fare originally quoted. Also, Uber did not give our driver the street address even though I entered it upon request. This was an error on Uber’s part, not our driver. She was excellent and to be commended for getting us to our final destination. Please let me hear from you ASAP with credit for difference in cost. Thank you.

title: Uber Mistake

review:
On Sept 7th I ordered an Uber.  I was standing waiting outside as they said they were 1 min away.  In 3 min they said they had arrived.  There was NO uber to be seen at the requested address.  I looked at the app and the uber was showing to be at a different address than what i had requested.... i punched in the app that they were at the incorrect address and requested them at the corrected address which they again had said they arrived, again they went to the wring address and again they said they were at the address that i requested.

Uber charged me for 2 cancelled trips.  I did not cancel any trips but tried to correspond with the driver with no response.

Finally the 3rd Uber that was ordered, showed up at the correct address.

How do i get my money back as this was not my fault?

title: BEWARE.  RIPPED OFF

review:
I was excited to learn when we got to Cabo that Uber was now available in Cabo.

Monday, July 29
The first ride from our hotel to San Jose Cabo worked really well.  Very nice driver.

Wednesday, July 31
Uber driver didn’t showed showed up in front of the hotel.  Instead he called me and talked in Spanish a good thing we were in front of the hotel and the hotel employee help us with talking to him. The car was too hot because the ac was not very good (an older car)

review: So I love uber, its really convenient. But...I am stationed on base and sometimes drivers will wait until it charges me to tell me they cant make it on base, so then I have to refute the charge and it gets messy. I wish uber would add a filter for people who have a base pass. Its very helpful to military because a lot of us are stationed here and dont have vehicles here, so its great. But I wish it wasnt such a hastle to find a driver that has a pass. Because of this issue, if I have an appointment or somewhere to be in a certain amount if time I just call a taxi instead because they are always on time. But other than that I love the app and its great!
title: Good but sometimes frustrating

review: I was charged a $40 cleaning fee for tracking a little dirt onto the floor of the car. The driver sent in pictures of the “damage” which is clearly just some dirt on the rubber floor mat. The Uber help section says that the $40 charge is for vomiting in the car, so I messaged help saying that I was charged incorrectly. The help response was clearly a computer generated one and there is no way to reach out to a representative about the issue. When I tried to acknowledge that there was some dirt but clearly not $40 of damage they just stopped responding and continued sending the “was your issue fixed” message. It is as though they made the entire process intentionally difficult to discourage people from getting their money back on fraudulent charges. I am very displeased and frustrated and will be using lyft in the future.

I get it “saves money” but the more I take the pool it puts me further ways from my house .. one time it literally had me walk to a bus stop which was up the street and around the corner .. I could’ve just took the bus .. which is only $2.25! Every time they pick me up they either have passed my house to get to the pick up spot on drive pass my house after picking up from the pick up spot . It just doesn’t seem effective at all. I understand I can choose “no walk” but it shouldn’t even be an option . Especially because when it’s late people have to walk in the dark to a corner/ foreign place & just wait.

I’ve been late to work twice now because of wait times - and I ordered the Uber 30 minutes in advance for a five minute ride. The last time, my driver made me wait 15+ minutes because they were sitting in a Dunkin Donuts drive through, only to cancel on me and leave me late for work. I wouldn’t be so upset about this if Uber had better customer service, but it’s extremely difficult to get unconventional issues like this one resolved, because they have no support phone line or email. Be it escaping from home, work, the airport or the bar... Uber is proving that people who need a ride, don't have to rely on a taxi or something else that may or may not pick up in your area, or is outrageously overpriced! If you're not watching the way of the world over the last few years, you just might miss seeing Uber leading the industry in personal ride assists. Get out there and enjoy the ride!

title: The GPS is just too unreliable. Switching back to Lyft.
review:
I travel A LOT for work and my company wanted me to switch to Uber for billing reasons. So far the three work trips (separate cities for about 4 days each) I've used it for have been horrible. I'm constantly having to cancel calls because the GPS goes to the wrong location. And every time I have to cancel it charges me $5 saying the driver is already in their way.... Even if I cancel within 20 seconds after I realise their GPS has screwed up again. 

It NEVER gets the arrival location right, I'm trying to follow where the car is on the map and it's constantly sliding around not showing me where the driver is waiting. I can't waste this kind of time and money when Uber is neither cheaper nor more efficient than Lyft. 

Bonus issue, there's no way to leave a text note about the trip OR leave feedback on the app. You can only pick from a few of their pre-defined issues, or say nothing at all. 

Hopefully someday you can improve but you've cost me too much time and money already so I'm going back to Lyft. I rarely had these issues with them in over a year of heavy usage.

Most of the time my bus or train actually leaves before my Uber arrives because the arrival time is inaccurate! And second, why say that you give us the closest driver when it’s a lie! I had 2 drivers next to me waiting for assignment yet you gave me one 7min away and it took him 10min to get to me! And third, it takes too long to actually find a ride!!! title: UBER EXPRESS IS 💩
review: Uber Express feels like extortion. Additionally, in the instance that you do miss communicate and your driver cancels, when you are “credited” 5 dollars for the trip, the app charges you more for your next ride in an effort make up the difference on Uber’s end. In my city, using a car is inconvenient. Most people rely on uber and public transportation. Uber is the best of the car services but there are a few features that make it such a pain to use.

title: Don't bother- GET LYFT
review: They charge you an extra high rate because it's a "busy time", they assign you a driver and you wait over 10 minutes and the first driver cancels. They assign a second driver, you wait another 8 min, he calls to say he's stuck in traffic and wants to know where you are going. He cancels 4 min later. Your friend pulls out her Uber app to order the same trip at the exact same time they assign a 3rd driver and it's $14 less at that time. You wait another 5 min and later find out they charged you the original high price even though at the same time they assigned your driver, it was $14 less. Their customer service is nonexistent, they give canned responses and don't actually address or attempt to fix the issue despite multiple requests. title: Satellite view would help the drivers
review: Uber is a great service and the few times I’ve used it, I had good experiences.  However this last time I was almost late to my destination because the driver couldn’t tell I was waiting for him inside a walled apartment complex.  The Uber app had him driving all over a subdivision behind the complex because according to the map, it was the closest way...but he was a mile from me and not getting any closer.  The driver said the app told him to cancel the ride because of the delay but my texts assured him I was still waiting.  A satellite view of the area would have prevented this.  Still a satisfied customer though.

title: Doing Drivers a Disservice
review:
I'm not going to be like others and complain about the drivers, the language they speak, or any other racist comments that others have posted. I used UberPool tonight and it was pretty good. I saved $15. If it was a time sensitive trip, I would have used UberX. That's the service, not the app. 

Emails asking for reviews and tips should be smart links that offer me the option of using the app if I am using a mobile browser. The website kept timing me out and I could not add a tip. I eventually went back to the app and found where to add a tip. 

Uber is doing it's drivers a disservice by not have a working web site for tips and directing people to the app when using a mobile browser.

title: Last ride
review: I will be taking my last ride with uber tonight. Multiple times there have been inconsistent service, unreliable drivers and an utter lack of customer service. I have been left waiting over ten or 15 minutes for a ride because the drivers could not find the location and my rides have been sent to other drivers. I do not understand why there isn't a GPS reading class that drivers have to pass. It is so frustrating to sit there and see a driver in the app making multiple turns that are out of bounds. I once had a driver go down to my route where I was headed without me and it had to be resent to another driver! I couldn't believe it and he canceled the ride which ended up in me paying for his incompetence . Unbelievable UBER. I will be trying lyft and if that fails Regular taxis might be the best route.

title: Incompetent!
review:
I will NEVER EVER use Uber services again! ). They charged me for using their services for no show rides. I tried to contact driver(s) and never heard back from them. Tried calling Uber itself  and that was a joke! In one instance the  driver contacted me  by text)1 minute before my ride was due (by text) telling me my ride was cancelled to the airport  causing me to miss my flight, which in turn caused me to miss the birth of my granddaughter. 😡. Then they had the nerve to charge me for the invisible driver and car that never showed up, which in turn caused me to have to shut down my bank account to have the charges removed. 
   That being said unless you  really enjoy invisible cars,  invisible drivers,  and a ghost line where nobody answers the phone I advise you to invest your REAL money with a reputable taxi service! 👎👎👎👎👎

title: Agree to a price then all rides around are more expensive???
review:
I used to use Uber a lot in NYC, but haven’t used it much since moving to LA. Since when did we agree to a price then EVERY AVAILABLE RIDE OPTION we receive a “your ride is now at a higher price. Open the app to accept”??? Never using this again. Feels like a bait and switch. Just tell me the actual price up front and it would probably be fine.

Also... The estimate says a lower price than what the initial charge was which doesn’t make sense. I get that it’s an estimate, but what’s up with all of these up sells. Just tell me up front what you’re going to charge. 

Then the eta seems to go way past the initial eta after denying paying more than double for a “ride now” many many times. This app WASTES time, is misleading, and cannot be trusted. UBER, what happened???

title: This review is in regards to the “Eats” portion of the Uber app
review: It’s cool that the Uber rides app doubles as an Uber Eats app, but unfortunately the Eats portion barely works.  There is NO way to communicate with your delivery driver through the Eats part of the app, and I never receive any communication from the driver either.  The “eats” portion of the app only has about a 60% success rate.  4 separate times I have just not received my order at all, and my order says complete, and I can’t get ahold of the delivery person and they never call me.  (I live in a downtown apartment and I don’t have these issues with Postmates or doordash.)  I’m sure Uber is tired of refunding me for orders I never receive so maybe you guys should just add a call button so drivers can contact me when they can’t find my apartment.

title: I love Uber but hate the unprofessional drivers
review: Uber as a service is extremely convenient but few of the unprofessional drivers associated with Uber are a big big reason to look for alternatives. If Uber looks at my account, they will find drivers cancelling the rides at will. In many instances driver calls up to ask for drop location and cancels the ride after committing to pickup. Thats not it, drivers have cancelled the ride after 15-20 mins of wait for pickup. Whenever I have reported about the inconvenience of cancel rides to Uber, i just get an email saying we work with our drivers for professional behavior. I am so highly disappointed. Uber needs to take some corrective measures on an immediate basis.

review:
I moved to the United States awhile back and updated my phone number and country immediately. Uber still sends me promotions/offers for the city I lived in previously in a completely different country in their local currency. Tried rectifying this many times to no avail!

Secondly, I cancel an Uber because the line is too inefficient and I have already been waiting outside too long. Uber pairs me up again with the same person I initially cancelled with. 

Thirdly, I use uber almost every single day to commute to work, and multiple times a day sometimes. Always get matched with someone who is very far, or takes a very long time. This is especially frustrating with pool when you get matched with someone when on the freeway and the driver has to go all the way back again to where we started to pick someone up! I understand it takes time on pool, but it’s ok as long as on the way. The pool should not be matched in a why where we have to go in the completely opposite direction at least 10 mins to pick someone up!! 

Also, on top of all this I get no customer loyalty offers or ride passes even though I use it so regularly! I am considering uninstalling Uber now, literally.
title: Very Very Unhappy

review: This has happened to me multiple times. The drive I requested couldn’t find the location I was at so they canceled and I was charged a non refundable fee. This particular time I called the drive multiple times and the driver did not answer. I also used the in app text message to tell the driver that was in the correct location and also looking for them. The driver replied “be right there” then canceled. I don’t feel it’s right that I have to pay for a service I never received and that the driver didn’t provide. Uber I have been a loyal customer using your services to get to and from work for years. You need to fix this. I don’t have the money to just donate to your drivers because they made a mistake. Fix it or I’m going to the better business bureau!
title: Driver canceled I get charged that’s not right

review:
I guess Uber going down the bad customer service route and trying to cash out on their reputation. 
Why? 
1) Uber drivers cancel rides after they accepted it and you have waited for them for a prolonged time - Wasting your precious time at the very least, but many times your money too. Since they often charge you a cancellation fee. 
2) this is a widespread problem (Google it) yet the company does not provide you with a customer service or an option to put such complaint on their site. (As if they are unaware of it)
3) the fact that Uber doesn’t take any serious steps to fight this means that in one way or other this works in their favor. And they don’t want to antagonize their precious drivers. 
4) they will refund your money if you ask for it. But then you not only wasted 5-10 minutes waiting for the car that never arrives, you also wasted another 5-10 minutes figuring out how to file a complaint and get a refund. (This is not one their standard quick list of problems). 
5) Uber provides no way for you to rate a driver which didn’t show up. So you don’t know which of the high star drivers do this frequently.
title: Drivers cancel the trip and charge you

review: This is just my experience with the app and it’s functionality. I’ve used it exactly twice, the last time in Chicago two years ago and had no problem. Why one star? This morning while going through my credit card statement, I found an $85 charge for Uber Eats, a service I’ve never used. Clearly my account had been hacked. Ok, that’s not Uber’s fault necessarily, but try to get a resolution from them. There’s no way to actually talk to a human. They say to do everything through the app which is absolutely useless with this. I found the button saying Uber Eats which refused to launch. After trying everything imaginable to get some sort of account info or help, I called the CC company, explained the situation and they credited back the $$. Closed the Uber account and deleted the app.

title: Beware of cancellations and inaccurate ETA
review:
The drivers get lost a lot and miss the passengers. Then they drive on without cancelling the trip because that impacts their rating. This forces the customer to cancel the trip, which results in a fee. It’s a great way for Uber to make money out of thin air. As a customer, you would be stuck with your $5 fee and wasted time and stress. You will be late for work with no one to complain to, because you can only reach support if your driver is attempting to kill you! By all means, don’t call 911 if that’s the case, call the most unhelpful and lacking support app in the world instead...

Further, DO NOT EVER rely on the ETA given by the app. I have never, not once, arrived at work when the app has suggested I would. It does not account for traffic whatsoever, so it’s usually double the time recommended.

title: Terrible Customer Service
review:
After countless Uber rides, it’s safe to say that this company offers terrible customer service. Many times, I have been overcharged, promised a “guaranteed” arrival time and price and denied help when asking for help to reimburse a few bucks for the inconvenience and flat lies. After providing proof and screenshots, I’m still denied by the snark of the people sending automated messages. It’s almost like the app is made to be untruthful of pickup and drop off times and prices. 

No driver ever arrives on time. The app will say an earlier arrival time and it’s usually half the time it actually takes to arrive. The gps is horrible, despite my frequent updates.

Often, the drivers don’t speak enough English to communicate basic directions so they can’t understand when you say “I’m on the other side of the street.” The quality of the vehicles is often terrible or stuffy and smelly with no ventilation. I’ve also been sexually harassed by several drivers. 

I finally decided to delete my account. I only used uber because they’re sometimes slightly cheaper than Lyft. Ultimately, the few extra bucks is worth it because Uber will charge you them anyway without telling you. Uber, Bye.
