title: Need options to select the type of driver/Car
review: I’ve been in several situations Where the Uber car is full of the smell of cigarettes or if they smell of air freshener which I’m allergic to. It’s not fun to order an Uber and then the car comes and you can’t even use it because of this odor. And then you have to order another one which could have a similar or worse problem. Uber needs to provide options to for customers to be able to indicate when there is an issue or when there is a need for special considerations. For example include a  comments box that allows the customer to answer the type of car or the smell of Car they are looking for - in my case, no air-freshener and no cigarettes smoke. I’m still sneezing from smelling a car I didn’t even ride in and it’s 30 minutes already!

title: No Drivers Available & Increased Fare
review:
The trip to my son’s daycare is a 1 minute drive (I only use Uber when it’s raining). It used to take between 2-10mins for an Uber to arrive but now it takes several minutes to even find an Uber (if it finds one). The fate used to be $7.78 but now on average it is $20+ for a 1 minute drive! 

Taking an Uber to Walmart used to be between $10-$11 but now is more than twice that. I spent approximately $40 just to go get baby formula. It took 17 minutes for the Uber to pick me up to go and 22 minutes to pick me up to come home. 

It’s scary. So many people depend on Uber. Uber needs to stop punishing the customer (common sense) because they (the company) won’t fix the problems they are having. I won’t be using Uber much longer. I think the company believes that most people are so dependent on them that they will pay triple the price and wait 3-4 times as long but nope. There are independent drivers now, people are using Taxi’s again and taking Lyft. 

I understand that the money has to come from somewhere but the customer shouldn’t have to pay triple the amount. Maybe the company should look into a solution within their finances.

review: Somehow I am always with drivers who are not knowledgeable about the area. The worst is that the GPS and ETA is not always accurate or actually gives them a longer route than they need to take. I can’t even describe how many times that I’ve had to give drivers directions because the GPS led them somewhere else. A lot of these drivers actually don’t even know the general area, let alone how to get to a specific place. I really think Uber should look into finding drivers who have a bit more knowledge about the places they will be driving to and/or fixing their GPS. Even the google maps a more accurate than the Uber GPS.

review:
Overall it was nice. Now a days the drivers only respond to surge times (during office hours. I keep waiting for rides, nobody accepts. Then the surge fare is applies after a while and BOOM! 
The route tracing is also not as good as other local apps from my area. They go around the world in circles instead of giving the rider the best route.
50% of the times, I meet rookie drivers who knows nothing about this town I’m in. (Dhaka, BD). I have to keep speaking to them to teach them the way to my destinations, where I always take rides from and to landmarks.
The driver management system needs more work. Both on the app system and driver ends.

Lately uber drivers have been wasting my time making me wait when I’m on a hurry to go to work , I have report multiple times uber drivers who clearly seem they don’t want to pick me up , they just want to make me wait and have me cancel the ride and get the fee money. title: It’s great but...
review: Uber is usually a good trip except when it is cloudy in Miami, the app doesn’t work! Getting an Uber driver that speaks English is a rarity and you need to know where you are going and HOW to get there if they don’t speak any English because chances are, they just got here and don’t know their way around!! Shared rides can take a while but most of all there is an extreme chance of sharing with someone who is drunk and either sick or abusive to fellow passengers!  I have experienced BOTH!   All in all, take an “EXPRESS” ride and you are pretty well good to go and should arrive pretty well in time. 👍🏻

title: PoolExpress

review: The new pool express feature has, so far, been very frustrating. I don’t mind walking a block or two (or more) to get to a main thoroughfare or an easier place for pickup. But in my experience on multiple occasions, the feature makes you walk a block in either direction, only to have the driver pass your destination to pick you up and then turn around. If your destination is along a major road as well, the same thing happens on the drop off. You are dropped a block or more from your destination, only to watch the driver leave you and drive past it. What’s the gimmick here? Nothing about this situation makes anything more efficient for anyone!

review: The app is getting progressively worse. I enter an address, it recognizes the business where I am, but the driver ends up 2 businesses down. I’m sure there’s a safety component but I have to message the driver every time. The app also doesn’t reflect driver’s current status. It will show they’re minutes away as they’re arriving - then immediately barrage my phone with threats to meet the driver or be charged. I have also had several occasions of pairing with a driver, to watch them sit for 5 minutes without moving - or responding to messages. They then cancel the ride - the app can’t alert the company to a non responsive driver?! Yet if I canceled the ride I would be charged for their time - y’all don’t pay me when your drivers dip out. It’s hot wet garbage. Ride share is a dime a dozen, focus on customer experience.

title: Drivers
review:
I sing the praises of ALL Uber drivers I have ever had, and that is a lot of trips. I have consistently had the most wonderful drivers. Never could I possibly complain. They are such gentlemen, polite, helpful, happy and I seem to know practically their entire life story in the time it takes to travel . For this I am very grateful because I ask the questions and they are more than happy to answer . Even when I vacationed in Colorado all the drivers I had there were top notch. I appreciate talkers and happy people and your drivers are like cruising around with an old friend!
Thank You,
Tami Seurkamp

I tried to cancel the trip but was alerted that I would be charged $5! I called the driver back and he hung up on me...Ill try NYC LYFT and see if I have better luck!

Very disappointing.... glad I’m not waiting on a ride.

title: Cancellation Charges
review: I was very unhappy to learn that I received a cancellation charge after cancelling my ride a minute after ordering it. When I found out that it would take my Uber driver 10 minutes just to get me I think it’s reasonable for me to want to cancel. When I received the email from Uber on the late charge they said that you only receive a minute of grace period to cancel and I think that’s very unreasonable considering how long it would take the driver to get to me when I’m in a very populated area. I cancelled my ride and ordered a Lyft and my driver came in just 2 minutes. I think I’ll start using Lyft more often since it seems like they connect me with drivers closer to me and don’t charge cancellation charges for cancelling a minute after ordering.

title: So many GPS issues and picky drivers
review: I’m not sure if it’s just where I live and I live in Los Angeles a very populated city but these drivers are getting more and more picky and I understand because they’re not getting a fee from smaller rides, but something is something , if I wanna go say at least 5 miles away from my house it takes forever for a ride to come!!!! as well as the GPS is a complete utter mess , they have them going the longest route ever when there’s so many other simpler routes, as well as I noticed when I’m waiting for an Uber there’s so many drivers around but they don’t want to get me either because it’s a short ride or they simply just sit there and waste my time.

title: Disappointing and Expensive
review: Multiple times while using this app I have been showed a rough estimate of the cost of my trip, only for the actually cost (after I’ve ridden) to be completely exuberant and unlike the cost I was initially showed. The app gives me no explanation, and I never do anything to warrant the extra charge. I once was taking a trip to the town over and the estimated cost said it would be $30-40. As a broke college student, this amount pained me but I still took it. After arriving to my destination, a full $120 was charged to my account. After an hour of trying to find anything I could do to negate this as I knew that was my grocery money for the month, I was able to request a refund somewhere in the app. They gave me a dollar back. Thanks, Uber. Maybe try Lyft instead.

title: App ok Uber is unreliable!
review:
The last 3 attempts to use Uber have been canceled by Uber!
All 3 rides were either to the airport or from the airport!  1 trip I even requested the day before & almost missed my flight because I had to find another way, last minute to the airport because no one showed up!
Uber quotes me a price only to have them jack it up almost double because there are not many drivers out there!
2 of the 3 trips that were canceled by Uber because there were no drivers, we ended up taking a taxi which ended up being cheaper than the bait and switch price I was quoted!
Until Uber management can figure out how to make Uber great again I won’t be using this app!  It’s managements fault for not coming up with a better solution to make their drivers feel safe during this pandemic!  Their drivers are scared to drive so not many drivers out there right now!
I have no problem getting a taxi though!
If I cancel Uber They have no problem charging me!  They’ve canceled me 3 times now and I have nothing to show for it!  Not even an apology!  Hopefully someone at Uber who makes the big decisions will see this—there’s no other place I’ve found to complain but here.

title: Uber Rewards Aren’t Even Worth it
review: As an Uber “Gold” member, I’ve spent hundreds of dollars in Uber.... in order to get any “rewards” you gave to accumulate at least 500 stars. The first time that I did so the reward was decent, 15% off 3 rides when paying with Venmo..... now the best you can get is $5 in Uber cash?????? That is literally a JOKE For a Reward. You have to spend hundreds of dollars for a choice between $5 in “Uber Cash” , up to 2 months free of Apple News+ or donate 20 meals to feed the hungry........ come on now Uber. You can do way better. Customers shouldn’t need to earn so many points for rewards like those.. those rewards don’t excite me, and make me want to keep spending to get another “reward” it’d be way better to get more uber credits or something .

Come on Uber

title: Disastrous customer service

I contacted their help support and I get an email from a real person with copy pastes instructions that I already tried and didn't work. I reply to say that, and then the response to that is a new email trom ANOTHER person, saying the exact same stuff like the first guy, like they can't see the whole email chain or something. I have now done this back and forth NINE times, NINE, and am nowhere near getting back into my account. I have never hated a company more, I truly lost any trust i had in them. Abandon ship.

And the absolute worst part is that they're going to read this review, say Sorry, and then direct me to the EXACT SAME HELP SYSTEM.

I never have requested any credits or adjustments and I didn’t request a credit on this trip. I request that Uber fix this crappy service and stop making people’s trips unnecessarily longer to scam them into paying more money. This service is a scam and I won’t be using it anymore. I suggest you all pay close attention to the route on your trips. Call Uber out if it makes detours like this. Scam.

title: Deceptive pricing ALWAYS, horrible customer service
review: Every time that I have ridden Uber, I have been deceived by their hidden pricing and charged random fees such a “booking fees”, random surges, and RANDOM tolls. I am warning you to PLEASE check your receipts and make sure your charges add up. I am given “30% promos” that seemingly make Uber cheaper than Lyft, but then am just charged this 30% promo back in the form of random charges at the end of the ride. Every time I use Uber, I end up being charged more than the upfront cost displayed on the screen. When contacting customer service, they reply with a difference random outsourced employee every time and they can never get their story straight about why they charged me extra. Never trust Uber. Please go support businesses that ACTUALLY value customers and stay far away from Uber.

title: Giving incorrect time estimates, hope you don't need to be punctual
review:

Got a response from uber saying that 
"we understand your concern regarding the ETA. The feedback from our riders is vitally important to us, and we always want their expectations to be met. The ETA times are estimates and not guaranteed. A variety of external factors like heavy traffic or road construction can impact travel time"

If the estimation changes while waiting to connect to a driver I should be informed of that so that I can arrange a different form of travel. title: It’s 2019, get a better working map already
review:
To be honest I use Uber a lot, maybe too often if you ask me. I like the app mostly, the design is sleek and easy to read, the functions work mostly, and it gets the work done - most of the times

What frustrates me about this app is that it has no sense of real time whatsoever. Living in a city like NY could be complicated, but google map has it figured out to the seconds. It’s deceiving that the Uber app tells you they can get you to some place in 15 minutes, but then you realize that it doesn’t include the time the car takes to get to your place, and then there’s traffic.

Oh sweet old blueberry traffic jam. Now you’re stuck in the middle of traffic, while the app just adds a minute to your estimated time of arrive every agonizing second you sit there.

I’ve had a better time watching clock tick than watching the Uber app.

Uber, it’s 2019. Google has it figured out, even Apple with its map of a joke had it figured out. Please don’t try to trick your customers into thinking that you’re faster than the other ride sharing apps when you’re not.

With all of today’s technology - and with Uber at the forefront of it all - it’s unbelievable that your GPS’s aren’t the best ones of all the GPS’s available. So my only conclusion is that you have not heard anything about it from the passengers, and because I’m such a huge supporter I’m bringing it to your attention.   

You’re welcome :-)
title: Awesome tool but fix your GPS
Riding with Dogs: Easy Emoji?!
review:
I am moving to a city this summer without a car for the first time (small town girl) and am going to have my dog with me. I know uber will let dogs ride in cars that the drivers allow, but I was wondering if y’all had thought of adding a feature that lets drivers know immediately that you will have a dog with you?! Like a dog emoji that will pop up beside my name and obviously they still have the right to accept or decline my ride?! Then there is no need to let them accept my ride and then have to ask their permission for my dog to come too!
-From A Dog Momma

title: Mickey Mouse company (Russia)
review:
First of all, they hire absolutely random people, and it doesn't bother them, at all. No personality check, nothing. Feels like no ID checks as well. Drivers can't navigate properly. They even sometimes ask where to ride!! I just hope that there will be automated cars soon.
As for app. Total disappointment. Not intuitive, I even can't choose pickup point from the start. And it's a nightmare when you're trying to choose where to ride. In a limited time period, you can't figure out this crappy interface.
Pickup points is a theme. If you happen to be near some Mall, I bet you can't choose different pickup points, it'll keep choosing the points it wants. Unbelievable.
Support is a story. It doesn't exist as a matter. Just some automated answers. Avoid this screwed company.

title: Annoyed
review: It was going fine at first. But I had scheduled a ride to pick me up the next day and I go back on hours before hand to try and cancel it because I needed to change the time. Well it says I have no upcoming trips and I’m very confused. Well I spend an hour to figure it out and out of no where, it shows my trip and so I try to cancel it and it says something went wrong and I can’t do anything. So I try to just schedule another ride and it didn’t submit at first and it said that something went wrong again. At this point I’m just very irritated. Finally after trying to figure out the situation, it let me see my upcoming rides and let me cancel my original one. This seriously needs to be fixed!

title: Beware!!!
review: Verified my account and gained access to it. But they hit me with a verification step that ask for the card info. I type in all the right info due to me still having the card and every card I ever owned and it’s was worthless and wrong in their eyes. Please beware that they have made me pay for wat pass by jus scanning my face as soon as I opened the app and after them offering me a free $25 they can’t verify my account after 2 days of me accessing it. I was getting sent to create an account and when I use the same email that they was saying wasn’t linked to an account, it was and I accessed it. Y’all needa new verification process or to go out of business. At this point y’all are finessing and making it sound good with the deals that are way in Canada and Uber it’s in Canada yet!

title: Someone will be dead before you get an Uber.
review:
Your policy is getting worse and worse! I’m so tired of it! Yesterday I ordered uber, waited 10min and the  driver just drove by without stopping and canceled the trip. I was supposed go see my friend who got into a huge car accident and now he is fighting for his life. I had to wait more time for another car and crying because I thought I’ll never see my friend again. Someone will really be dead sometimes before you get an Uber if your drivers will keep canceling rides upon your policy. 
Oh you know what? They gave me $7 for this issue. Wow. Thanks. 
From now on, I’m gonna rate every driver with one star until you change your policy. I don’t have a car and guess what? I use Uber 4-6 times almost every day. Let’s count it........
To be continued......

title: Great but one thing....
review:
Used to be 5 stars, now 4. Had someone cancel a trip on me (never saw them), and got a response from Uber that said “Your driver said you were not wearing a face cover or mask”
First off, no one ever showed up.
Second, I was wearing an n95 mask...
Third, there is no way to let Uber know that I was wearing a mask... sounds like a loophole in the app. I’m guessing the real reason they cancelled was because they didn’t want to drive me to the airport (which is fine), but Uber, please don’t send me a long email lecturing me on wearing a mask, when I was, and then not give me a way to dispute it. Otherwise, app is 5/5!

title: Disappointing
review:
Long time Uber rider but in this case, I attempted to rent short scooter rides for both my son and I on the same credit card.  The app would not allow this so I instead purchased a gift card ($25 min purchase) which I attempted to have my son use to activate the scooter rental for
him but the app would not accept the use of the gift card.  Meanwhile, the charges were burning on my scooter.  It became apparent we were going to have to scrap the idea all together.  Now I’m charged for a rental I didn’t even use, plus a $25 gift card that also can’t be used.  I think there was some glitches between the scooters and the Uber app I was using. After 3 weeks of stall tactics and diversions it became clear Uber was more interested in keeping my funds than working out the problem.  Goodbye Uber!

title: They do what they want.
review:
I’m never using Uber again, I’m downloading Lyft RIGHT NOW!!
first of all Uber thinks your money is THEIR money so don’t be surprised when you wake up and find that they’ve charged you 40 dollars for a trip you never took. And Uber eats is THE WORST!!! You maybe sometimes might get what you ordered. I ordered 2 meals both of which I paid for , I only received one.... NO REFUND for the one that they never sent. And am I the only one who had noticed that it is IMPOSSIBLE to reach Uber support on the phone. They’ll pretend like they’re understaffed because of the Covid-19 situation and that’s why no one is available to talk to you, but the truth is now that I think about it, it’s a always been like that, they don’t want to help their customers.
Well they have made enough money of me, I’m done.

title: Trash
review:
Tried to schedule Uber in advance today. That’s no longer available. Also can’t specify pickup location. Tapping clock next to uberx does nothing. Only allows me to choose my current location. Trash company, trash app, doesn’t pay drivers well, more expensive than lyft in literally every case. Too bad only Uber is available in Paris.

And true to Uber’s terrible customer service, they responded to this review suggesting that I force-close the app to be able to set future trips, even though I’ve found information on their own site indicating that the feature isn’t available in all locations, including Paris. They just don’t get it!

Then they respond again telling me to contact customer service. For what? Uber, do me a favor and just don’t respond to this review.

title: Uber welcomes fraudulent activity
review:
Uber charged my card for 6 fraudulent rides in one day last week, with no record of the rides in my account (I haven’t used Uber in over a year). Fraud is an extremely urgent issue, and Uber refuses to provide customers with a way to speak with an actual human. The only avenue to report this is to fill out a general purpose pre-built form, and hope someone eventually calls you back while Uber continues to bill you for fraudulent rides. (Everyone I know who has dealt with similar Uber fraud never received responses).

This is a despicably irresponsible company, and as I will not sit and wait while Uber raids my checking account, my only recourse is to pursue the matter through my bank and block all Uber transactions. I will never do business with this company again.

title: Customer Support
review: Uber has been an active service for some years now and the customer support is still highly inadequate. Today’s experience was the absolute worst! I was charged for a ride I NEVER received! My ride history shows a driver that was never on their way! The person that was on their way turned around and never came. Both expect the cancellation fee money. I don’t understand how a driver makes money regardless if they actually get a person from A to B! I literally saw my driver 3 mins from me and then turn around to the airport! I requested my ride at 11:30am and he supposedly arrived at 6:51pm. 7:05pm now they expect the cancellation fee money. This is completely unacceptable. I will NEVER be using Uber again. I will be telling everyone I know to not use this service as well.

title: Strange things happen...
review:
Booked a car this morning from my home to Hingham shipyard for 5:30. Ten minutes ago I received a message saying my driver was 5 minutes away. Went outside and saw another message: another driver was 25 minutes away and coming to pick me up. That way I missed Miley commuter boat. Wouldn’t it be possible to organize these things in a better way? Drivers who cancel at the last minute should be fined and customers should be given enough time to think about options. Unless someone believes that we are here to serve Uber drivers and not the other way ‘round!
Thank you,
MG.

review: Uber is convenient. However the pool is complicated. It shows a map of a nearby location where you must walk. I myself sometimes find it difficult to understand the map. One thing I do love about Uber is no long waiting and most drivers are very friendly 😃

title: On Uber
review:
Uber is a necessity in my life—there, I’ve admitted it. Despite its many flaws, I won’t stop haling rides any time soon. However, there are a few adjustments that would make life better:

Improve the GPS. As of late, the gps is less real-time tracking and more a disappearing and reappearing act that makes predicting when I should step out into the cold, dark night much less precise

Create a reporting/cancellation system for scammers. The rise of scammers who accept a ride only to stay still or drive in the opposite direction, simply to reap cancellation fees, is despicable. What about a reporting feature where customers who get ripped off under this system get refunded and the driver penalized?

Of course, I can get a refund on canceling fee but my time is wasted. 

This kind of situation happens for a while, to be exact, it often happens after the updates. I hope it will be fixed soon.

title: PLEASE CREATE A SERVICE FOR ELDERLY RIDERS

The ride pass was the answer to most of my problems with this app but it has been unavailable to me since May... at least get rid of the button in the menu like I could get it. I was ok paying $20 upfront to lock in some prices so I knew about what I was spending for the next couple of weeks.

review:
Got sick of lyft, long wait times, no drivers, high prices and I live in north oakland.

title: Sick of lyft

review:
While I have personally never had a problem, I am concerned about safety regarding drivers with criminal backgrounds. After something I read in the headlines yesterday about Uber and possible lack of doing enough personal background checks, it just made me a little more wary. 
That said, I solely use Uber, and rarely am I alone which makes me feel safer, and I have had nothing but decent people as drivers. 
Also, I am so grateful we can add a tip through the app. I never carry cash, not even coin, so early on, some drivers got stiffed unfortunately. So thank you for that. 
4+ rating. Just beef up the security for your patrons.
title: LOVE Uber

review: So I’ve been a user of the UberPool system since it’s creation and I have to say that by and large the UberPool system is fairly disappointing. When I first began using the service it allowed me to take rides at a relatively low cost and also in a relatively fair time frame but since the new updates it appears as if Uber is more concerned with forcing riders to go routes that are inefficient then actually serving the rider who is in the vehicle paying for the ride at the time. My assessment of this service is that if you are in a hurry,  DO NOT USE UberPool. If you are willing to add an additional 15 minutes to your arrival time then UberPool is the right choice for you.
title: Uber Pool is Nice.. But it does have its flaws

review:
I was and pretty much still am a huge & grateful supporter of Uber however I do not understand how the caliber of drivers has sunken to the bottom ! The cars often smell, the drivers are often rude and the routes given by the Navigation system are terrible... so much time is wasted. What used to be a 20-30minute morning ride to work now takes an hour. The pool used to guarantee no more then 2 pick ups on your route and now it’s an endless tour with the drivers just driving far out of the way to pick up & drop off often more then 5 different commuters.
Their follow-up and customer service is great but the day to day operations needs improvement !

review: I love Uber. Not because I use it all the time but I love it because of the driver. Now now you might say you had a bad experience with one driver or you’ve been apart of an altercation with a drive but in my experience with Uber drivers they’ve all been either a 4 stars or above. And yes Uber has it’s down sides but in my opinion I love it. Hope my review helpful for you who are reading 😁
title: Love Uber ❤️❤️❤️❤️

review:
This new app is too controlling of the rider.
For whatever corporate reason, instead of Uber taking the responsibility to pay drivers well or providing health care, in this app Uber is “guilting” me to tip & also limiting the number of words I can say about how great the driver is. Why are u taking away my liberty to speak .

As for tipping, yes I do for a special driver with cash or fresh baked goods/coffee from a bakery, but no way will I be guilted & drilled by corporate to give & when I do it’ll be cash, not by your new obnoxious feature.

Remember Moe Fuerstein & the fire close to Christmas where he continued paying his workers full salary until the factory was rebuilt & was widely honored?

Uber is a new style business, a paragon for operating via Smart Phones, & can be a force for real social good.

Pay your people well, I’ll keep riding, stop wasting $$ in automated cars, using guilt to avoid yr corporate responsibility & pay drivers well w/ bennies & stop eliminating my ability to complement the driver.

All of us have one chance at life, no do-overs. Wouldn’t u like Uber complimented at a State of the Union or by the world as Mr Fuerstein was from his actions at Polartec ?

title: Great Value, Buggy System

review: Two minutes into finding my ride (and while driver was still 8 minutes away) he calls me because he can't read the map and figure out where to pick me up. Had never happened to me before and I've been picked up dozens of times from my apartment, so I tried explaining and he didn't understand and frankly sounded flustered so I canceled the ride because I was concerned about safely and timely getting to my destination with a driver who clearly couldn't read a map and had no understanding of basic navigation. Was charged $5.00 (quite a lot for a 30 second phone call), disputed the charge, and was denied a refund. Apparently customers are penalized when drivers can't read a map. Good riddance. I'll be using Lyft from now on.
title: Charged me for canceling because driver cant re a map

review: A star for eventually getting me there, but oh man this service is so buggy and frustrating. I've had drivers not show up and I get charged for dropping the ride even though I'm just waiting. I've had people pick me up through the Uber system then charge me taxi rates. I've had some of the most frustrating customer experience issues with them, trying to explain the situation and all they say is "we reviewed the case and we found that everything is fine." I don't necessarily think the customer is always right, but not listening and not having adequate support--to include avoiding questions and ignoring me when I ask for them to provide information that directly pertains to me? Atrocious. Uber, you have earned Lyft a new customer👌🏻

developerResponse.body: We understand this can be frustrating and we are working towards making this better. We would appreciate it if you could send out a description of this with details at t.uber.com/contact and we will take it up from there.

title: Customer Support & Reliability are trash

review: Since tourists aren’t familiar with logical pickup spots at their hotels, especially with closed sidewalks due to construction, communication by phone to pinpoint what corner of an intersection is preferred by the driver is important! Paying a fee because the driver claims the client wasn’t where they were expected to be is unfair. Both drivers who accepted us changed lanes right in front of us to go to the opposite corner. Luckily the second one had his window down and was able to be flagged down to not have to order a third driver! Communion is the key!
title: Knowing best location at popular LasVegas hotels

review: I want to like Uber. Yet, there is a huge problem. I recently took a trip to Las Vegas. I needed to get to Cracker Barrel from the strip. I try Uber. No cars whatsoever. It stayed that way for the rest of the night. The next day I want to go to a BBQ place. We try Uber to no avail. Uber failed when I needed it most. This app did not do what I asked it to. I could not get a ride for two days in a row. Ruined my vacation. Useless. I can’t enjoy this app if it does not function properly. Uber is not working as intended and I am very disappointed with the service. Can’t get a single car to me in the middle of a city. Might as well use a taxi. I want to like this app but then there is stuff like this how Uber fails you when you need it most.
title: Can’t enjoy it

review:
I scheduled a ride in advance recently, and instead of sending a confirmation notification via the App, it sent via email. Right before the time of the scheduled pick up I received standard notifications including a reminder of the scheduled ride and that “your driver has been assigned.” I never received a notification that the driver arrived. Then about five minutes after my requested pick up, I received two notifications that no drivers were available and also the driver had to cancel, then I was charged the cancellation fee. 

This process has worked well for me in the past (as recent as last week), but something was broken with this experience today.
title: Inconsistent Notifications

review: While the application is really awesome and helpful the developer’s team has to to do a better job in supporting the customers when there is a bug in the app. I have been messaging the Uber team for few weeks now informing them that there is a problem with the family profiles on iPhones and all what I get from them: we are working on it!! Last week I sent another message and the support team sent me the instructions on how to use the family profile!! When I sent them the previous conversations, they replied back that they have a problem!! You have just released a new update but no fix.
title: Awesome app but bad technical support

review:
I flew airplanes over 1,000 hours from 1989 to 2015. This included jets and turbine Helicoptors. During my entire flying years I was an active Alcoholic. I can’t say I was drinking or drunk while acting as pilot in command, but I would always prefer technology to drive me to the helicopter for time saving flights around New York. title: Fly with technology not a Alcoholic

review: I just spent the weekend in San Diego and used Uber for transportation instead of renting a car as I usually do. I have used Uber before where the pickup point was clearly defined but was concerned about being picked up at the airport. No problem. The driver called me and talked me through the pickup. Using Uber turned out to cost much less than car rental and hotel parking fees. Best of all, the problem of finding parking places disappears and the time between ordering a ride with app and the car arriving was never longer than the wait for valet parking.
title: Convenience and savings

review: Uber has the worst customer service in the world! Its reps didn’t even bother to solve my issue although I messaged them many times. I owed an amount and after paying it tried using my debit card again for Uber but they didn’t accept my card anymore. They only responded that my card was no longer compatible to use with Uber. This is a lie! I’ve been an Uber customer for over 5 years and once even had a debit card unblocked after they told me it was blocked. The fact that they treat their customers unfairly is just sad. Go with Lyft. At least they’re more professional than Uber. Many Lyft drivers have confessed to me that they switched to Lyft because more and more customers are switching to Lyft daily. I believe it since I’m personally changing to Lyft now.

title: Not to happy

review: I’ve had several instances of poor drivers. One who literally tried to sexually harass me, one who tried to get me to join his church, and a slew of others asking to divert away from the app entirely and go solely on cash. My experiences with Uber only keep me coming back because no other rideshare service compares to how well these issues have been addressed. But separately, my only concern, that still hasn’t been addressed, is the issue with the app not knowing where I live. I’m in an apartment complex, and it registers me as living on the next street over, even though the map physically shows my location at the apartment complex. Please fix this!

title: Very dependable, could be better

review: I’ve had the app for about a year now and everything’s gone well up until recently. When i call for an uberX it can take up to 5 minutes for them to find a driver, then the driver will be 20 minutes away, Even though they show drivers all around my area. Then i’m sitting there waiting 15 minutes for my ride to work - JUST FOR THE DRIVER TO CANCEL. There needs to be some kind of way for users to be compensated for their wasted time, not just the drivers. Also the navigation system that the uber drivers use is terrible. They’re always going somewhere other than the pickup point i’ve dropped. It’s all just very frustrating. Make me wanna try lyft, and you already know i dont wanna try lyft🤦🏽‍♂️.

title: What’s Going On?

review:
To start off, I’ve used Uber for over a year now and I’ve averaged out at least 100 rides. 

What I’m trying to say is that I’m a loyal Uber user but every now and then I get charged for unfair fares but I always get Uber credit reimbursed which is fine.

This time, however, I spilled WATER on the seat. The driver reported me for having alcohol and then I was charged $14 for a cleaning fee.... The ride was nearly $5 and it went up to $18...
I tried to dispute this charge but the cleaning fees blah blah I MUST be charged.

Charged $14 for what?? To let the seat air dry? You know, I would’ve been unhappy but understanding if it was $5 but they do not want to change it and have sent me the same support message again. I’m sorry. I am not a Word document, you cannot copy and paste your excuses to me.

I am no longer using Uber ever again nor am I recommending it. I think it’s so unfair that, as a loyal customer, I am being charged 14 dollars to let this driver’s seat get “professionally cleaned” because HE stopped abruptly and then my water spilled. Yes... professionally clean it by putting your windows down and letting it air dry.

So upset with you, Uber. Lyft... here I come I guess. 😐

developerResponse.body: Hi there! This doesn't sound right. We want to take a closer look into this for you. Please send a quick note to t.uber.com/contact and we'll take it up from there.

title: Never Using Again

review: I’d always been a frequent Uber user for about 4 years now. One day out of nowhere Uber blocked me. I mailed them twice asking them the reason, but all I was given was “we’re sorry we cannot disclose the reason but it is due to a suspicious activity”. So I’m guessing, travelling in Uber itself has become suspicious. I requested them to get a customer agent to call me on my number to further resolve the issue but there’s been no response. I was blocked 5 months back and it’s been the same ever since. It’s amusing how when you block a customer and don’t even give a reason for that. There’s no contacting the customer care either. I’m highly disappointed in Uber India and have been since discouraging friends and family to use the Service.

We weren’t able to figure out how to request a ride ahead of when we specifically wanted to leave. Consequently, we ended up requesting a car when one was available and ended up cutting a few hours off our vacation and getting to the airport about an hour and a half early. It was a little stressful wondering if we would be successful in getting an Uber ride when we needed one.

When the driver does not have another pick up, why can’t he drop the rider off at their destination? The whole idea of calling an Uber is for convenience to be taken to their destination.  For example, my last driver seemed to have gotten lost. I texted him that I walked to the location the app told me to walk and 2 mins turned into 5 mins. The driver called me, I told him I was at the pickup location and he couldn’t tell me where he was!!! It was pouring rain outside. I was standing in the street telling him where are you!

title: The New Uber pool is confusing.

review: TWO Uber drivers canceled their trips on me late this afternoon in Soho, while I waited in the cold. The 1st time I was waiting on the exact corner he requested me to, I talked to him on the phone 4 times, confirmed the location,  & he said he was waiting there with his lights flashing- but he wasn’t where the app told me to wait! Then he said he had to go. Do I ordered a 2nd Uber, walked to another location, communicated on the app while I was walking & when I arrived. He answered OK. But he was a no-show & canceled. Now I have 2 cancelation fees of $5 each. The 3rd call I walked several more blocks, but the nice driver showed up, fortunately, because my phone went dead while I was waiting. I will switch to Lyft if this isn’t resolved!!!  HORRIBLE experience.

title: POOR service in NYC

review:
Uber is extremely reasonable. The value of the ride for the price you pay is fantastic. However, the surcharges in bad weather are tremendous. In a snow storm two weeks ago a $14 ride became $96.
Surcharges even in busy times are high. Even more insulting is that they Book they ride at a lower fare, keep you waiting for ten minutes, cancel on you telling you the car can’t make your request that you are being rebooked. The new car is at the surcharge rate and if you don’t take it they want to charge you a cancellation fee. They do drop that fee if you complain. 

The app should give you the option to accept or not after you know where the pick up is, how long the trip will take and the final fee.

developerResponse.body: Hi, the trip fare and dynamic pricing are subjective to demand and supply in the area at the time. It constantly changes with the rise/fall in either factor. We are working towards the dynamic fare policies to make it as fair for both our riders and partners.

title: Plus and Minus Uber
userName: to ubet or not to uber

review:

This app is great to have but I have to have lots of patience at the same time.

title: Very disappointed

review:
I have been watching my almost 5 star rating steadily decline now since uber has finally come to the Buffalo area. My prior experience with uber was when uber was promoted as a true cashless ride service where cash tipping was discouraged and certainly not an in app feature. Since enabling tipping, and my recent experience, I can only assume your drivers are making their ratings based off how much you tip which is absurd; quick research online seems to suggest needing to tip $5 for 5 stars! I can’t even describe how crazy that is because if I’m tipping $5 on every ride, I may as well just pay standard taxi fare...

Rating should be solely on you as a rider; tipping should truly be optional and have no bearing on you rating.

developerResponse.body: We understand your concern here, the Tipping is up to you and it’s completely optional. They are not included in the fare, nor are they expected or required. If you decide that you would like to tip, your driver is welcome to accept. It's just an easy way to say thanks. Do let us know how else can we make our service a 5 star!

title: Rating system is absurd

review:
Dear Uber,

Stop flooding my app with your eats and other stuff. I open it for a ride. I'm about to give you my business, stop making it a hassle to find a ride or see the map. I don't care about uber eats and there's even a separate section for it. STOP IT ALREADY. 

The drivers I've had have been good. The fares are usually reasonable though they can get excessive at certain times so watch out for that. The issue is with the app UI. I don't care a fig about their eats part and the more they try to shove that down my throat the less likely I am to turn to uber. Its only gotten worse as time goes on, too. Just make a separate app for it already.

review: I’ve had uber for a while now. I loved the app up until my bank let me know that I was being charged for an Uber pass for the past 3months and I had no idea. When I did find it I got a kickback through email and when I called the number it hung up and told me to reach out online. Finally I got a hold of someone within the Uber app (that’s the only way to reach someone) and they promised me a refund within 5 business days. It’s been 2 weeks and I haven’t received my refund and worst of all I can’t talk to anyone about this!! Be ware of fully trusting this app.
userName: I'll tell you how it is
title: Good luck trying to talk to a real person.

review: I've been an uber driver for almost 2 yrs now and i had to renew my papers. I told them i have receipt for proof to show that its real but they still went and banned my account. The next day I went back to my mechanic to fill out a new form with the correct details but nothing has happened still. I contacted them a lot of times and they keep telling me the same thing to wait 3-5 days to review my account its been 2 weeks and nothing has happened still. Whats the point of being a gold driver and having support 24hrs if they can't even help you.

title: Bad service

review: As a college student, I have been using Uber as my main mode of transportation since the middle of 2017, and up until the last 4 months have been happy with it. However, in recent months, Uber has been raising their prices and not offering as many discounts as they used to. What used to be on average a 6-7 dollar ride for me is now a 15-17 dollar ride. Additionally, what Uber has done to the option of pool rides with the newer “express” pool is the biggest scam of the whole app. It’s the only reasonably priced option for getting around, however is extremely inconvenient to use. I have been slowly switching over to Lyft which has way better prices and better customer service, as well as utilizing public transits. I wouldn’t recommend Uber to anyone anymore.

title: Uber: Too big to care!
review:
UberPool was already ludicrously inconvenient with drivers taking absurd detours during rides to pick up other passengers whose pickup locations were out of the way. Now if you want door to door service without the hassle of walking to a central pickup spot (which at this point just makes it a glorified bus service), you need to pay extra on fare. A 5-10 minute ride can cost you $10 or MORE. For a Pool!

Oh and the infuriating experiences with drivers driving past pickup spots and having to stomach nonsense cancellation fees despite the drivers being at fault is STILL an issue. 

Officially DONE with this app. All I ask is that Uber deliver a less frustrating experience than the MTA and somehow they’ve managed to fail miserably at it. Lyft will get my business from now on.

Apparently one of my uber drivers reported that I was an unaccompanied minor which I am not a minor at all! Uber has no real way if getting in contact with a representative so all you can do is email and it’s different representatives every time so you have to reexplain your situation. They keep telling me that I need to submit a valid ID but just bc I’m 18 doesn’t mean I have an ID. They don’t even give you the opportunity to put in your date of birth when you make an account so how do they expect to know if you’re a minor or not. Im very upset with uber and will not be using them again I will be switching to lyft or any other riding system.

review:
This was the first time that I used the app rather than being with someone else. I was very confused. Being picked up at a hotel, the app told me to go across street to reach the car and continued to say so as the driver pulled up at the hotel. When I was dropped off, the app still said the car was waiting across from the hotel for me. The app said it had problems connecting to their network. 

My phone battery was low and after charging it then trying a reboot, the app showed the ride as complete. Whatever the problem was it seems that it could have been programmed to give better feedback while the pro town exists.

title: Improve App Entry Selections for New Users
review:
This was our first time using Uber.  You should make it less confusing by clarifying the difference between immediate pick-up & a later scheduled pick-up. I inadvertently selected the pay option too soon, & it had not provided a selection for next day pick-up.  An Uber driver left immediately & arrived in 5 minutes to find out I needed Uber the next day. He showed me how to reschedule it. A slight change on the App would prevent a new user from making this error.  

Other than this, we found everything about Uber great & will use it in the future.

title: Uber my Uber
review:
Uber is now in the heart of transport of my city Kolkata. We need Uber. But refinement is required in the location app. Also Uber needs to stop allowing any one to join Uber as a owner of any small car. - Standard Of Uber Car is minimum is Swift D - smaller family car shouldn’t be included in Uber car.
Also I noticed the search mechanism is not customer friendly during busy days and in rain. 
There should be a range of increase and decreases of fare. 
I hope Uber will take care of these issues and continue to be the best service provider.

title: Awsomeeeeeeee
review: Being a driver for almost 4 years now is all worth it, if you are thinking about doing it a little or a lot. The people you meet and the places is an experience alone. UBER as a company is always there when I need and gives great feedback. The experience also challenges you for a better and more professional part of you to become. I tell people “It will make or break you”. It made me and if you like driving that new awesome car of yours then make sure you keep it clean to rack up them 5 stars.  Happy trails.

title: Good service but can be improved to deal with adversities
review: Most of the times the app and service work well, but on certain instances like when a driver takes more time than needed to pick you up because they took a longer than needed (and sometimes in some countries on purpose ) and you cant cancel the pickup because you are charged, when you know another driver is closer by and faster. Or when your driver is on a bad mood and out of nothing complaints about your luggage dirty wheels getting into his trunck. I have to say that Uber is a people business so they need to improve the recruitment and also implement mystery pickups to test the extraordinary scenarios.

review: First and foremost never trust any company who you can’t call directly or at least have a customer service to talk to I feel insignificant texting Uber or if it really is a person on the corespondent end and when I had concern about a hold on my bank card Uber gave a cut and dry reason which I believe would’ve sufficed but when I seen it twice back to back then I went wait a min this is some kind of fraud and when I look up costumer supporting the internet no phone number just got to the app and there the run around began I don’t know about who ever reads this but I work hard for my money and don’t like it being in limbo and dont like the distrust from Uber been an customer for over 3 years now this next time I’ll call a cab cut and dry!!!!

title: Opaque and inconsistent
review: I’ve been using Uber for many years now, and the service, pricing, and customer service simply isn’t what it used to be. I’ve already been overcharged in error for a ride a never took, and have had a terrible experience getting a refund. Burned from my first experience, Uber doesn’t allow an actual fixed price for your ride as has been done in the past. “Regulations and driver safety” they say, but their safety record does not reflect this. Lyft is both less expensive and has better customer service, and none of the pricing issues. I will be using lyft from now on for both personal and business.

title: Military
review: I’ve been using Uber for a while and I’ve never had any problems, until I enlisted and began living on base for technical training. There have been numerous times where I’ve ordered an Uber or Uber Eats, and the driver has told me last minute that they can’t get on base and I have to walk over a mile to get back to my dorm or to get my food, even though I’ve already paid for the entire trip. This is a very common problem problem among technical training students and it’d be extremely helpful if there were a feature that connects military to people that have base access.

title: Awful support team and app issues
review: I’ve waiting in que for airport ride for over an hour at time and when the app says to start driving to the pick up location it kicks me out of que and I have to start all over! GPS on the app is horrible as well. I’ve had many time where I accept a ride and it continues to load and load, I eventually have to close the app completely and lose my ride. Don’t get me starting on trying to get ahold of support. I waited 20 minutes on hold for someone and when I finally got someone on the line I get hung up on. So disappointing. I’ve been driving with Uber for TWO YEARS! I think I’ll finally be making the switch to LYFT. I’m done with all the issues and not getting any support. It’s a good thing it’s only part time for me.

review: I can’t book a ride in advance on Uber, I try to schedule a a ride in advance, it brings me to select my form of payment.  I click on my form of payment, but it doesn’t bring me to the next step.  It just stays on the payment page.  I tried to add another payment method, nothing works.  I tried to contact them using the chat service, they said I had to wait for the support team to email me back.  There is no contact number, and the chat team does not help with issues, they just tell you an email will be sent.  The email never came for me, so I ended up having to schedule with a more reliable driving service.  This will be the last time I use Uber

title: Delayed Arrivals
review: This has happened multiple times and I’m finally annoyed enough to write a review. I ordered my Uber, driver accepts.. only to realize the driver is far away, dropping off another rider. I’ve tried to cancel the ride to get an available driver but the app was going to charge me “$5 for the driver’s time.” I understand cancelling after the driver had already started driving to pick you up, but the driver was dropping someone else off. When I order a ride, I want a driver that is available. I live in a major downtown metropolis area, there really isn’t a reason to have to wait on the driver completing another ride. If the driver has to wait on me, I get charged a fine. I should be able to set my settings to only accept rides from drivers that are available.

title: Upset
review: So I’ve been trying to use my debit card and it wouldn’t work, and it tells me call my bank so I did and my bank says everything is ok, and it’s been doing this for about a week, and I got my new credit card in the mail and it still doesn’t work tells me to call my bank and so I did. And it’s been like this for about 2 almost 3 weeks, I have a protective order against my ex boyfriend so when I have to sit outside knowing he knows where I work is very scary, let a lone my cards are being declined when I clearly know there’s no reason they should be. So I’m stuck outside my restaurant trying to find a ride home. It’s dangerous for me and very nerve racking and I’ve sent them a message over and over and no response. No number to call for any type of help.

title: Worst Experience Ever with UBER
review:
I ordered a ride from a restaurant and your app advised that a driver accepted and was 19 min away. I waited outside the establishment—Big Rock Restaurant in Birmingham MI. The app indicated that the driver was at my pick-up location, which had closed,   My phone rang. It was your driver. He was at a different address across town and said he had no idea where Big Rock was. I was tired of waiting and didn’t want to wait any longer. So I cancelled the ride. Your driver was rude and hung up on me. Then I got charged $5. 

Hear this:  It’s. It the money. It’s the principal. I tip service providers more that $5 all day long when their service is good or excellent. But when I get this kind of treatment I move quickly to the competitor. I am now exclusively a Lyft customer. I will NEVER use you again.

I asked to pick me up at Newark, NJ airport the driver told me to wait for him at level second and wait 15 minutes, After that time, I received a message telling me that he couldn’t pick me up due to heavy transit which wasn’t true and recommended to call or contact another driver, after a  trip, I wanted to get home as soon as posible and decided to take a yellow cab available in the airport. Two days later I found Uber charged my credit card $6.84, the reason: The driver who never showed off was waiting for me more than 15 minutes. Even with an actual street address, it still often wants me to walk to another street.  The app shows my location, so why can’t it direct the car right to me?   Before I discovered the Edit Location feature, I did at least have the amusement of watching (on the app) my car driving all over the place looking for me!😂   But seriously this needs to be fixed somehow.

title: Updates don’t happen / work
review: Uber is great and I use them weekly to and from the airport. Problem is I get emails from them to purchase a ride pass which in my case would save the company money. As always I click on the email and it sends me to the app and I get the error message sorry we are experiencing technical issues try again later. Reach out to Uber and they tell me to update the app it was 3 days ago and passes do not show up in my menu. Fix your issues so we can use the resources you are developing.

title: Ride to LAX by Abdellah on Fri. Feb. 22, 2019
review: I was wrongly charged a wait fee, when I pre-ordered a ride to LAX!!! The time frame was 4:50am-5:00am. He came at 4:35 and called me to tell me he was there. I told him that I would be down at 4:50, the start time of the pre ordered Uber. I got to his car at 4:50, he loaded my luggage and we drove off. I saw my receipt and was shocked to have been charged over a $6.00 wait fee!!!!!!! I was going to tip him $10 cash and I’m glad I did not! I tipped him on the app, $3.00 because of this. Totally wrongfully charged, especially with a pre-ordered Uber and I was on time! Sorry Abdellah, next time you wait because you were early, don’t be shady and charge your customer!

Uber is very quick to take out the money but it takes 3-5 business days for us to receive the refund? We should receive our refund right away. I still don’t receive my refund for the last two times this happened, and just today it happened again. It’s seriously getting out of hand and even double thinking if I should keep using I Uber.

title: I really HATE the new update.
review:
1) Every time I try to order a ride I have to be extra careful I don’t accidentally load $25 of Uber cash. It really feels like you guys are forcing that and want someone to accidentally load that $25.
2) Uber pool no longer looks like the budget friendly option I thought it was supposed to be... It also does not make sense to pay just so the driver can meet you.
To be honest it makes me feel that Uber is very money hungry. It no longer feels like a friendly service to me personally. I am very disappointed in the new changes, I liked the app a lot more before. I’ll definitely be using Uber a lot less.

title: App doesn’t allow reset by rider or driver
review:
Got picked up Monday 10/22 by a driver looking for Jason (rider). Since I was also looking for Jason (driver), he yelled out Jason and we thought we were matched until we got a mile down the road and compared destinations.
At that point, he tried to close / reset this transaction. When he could not, he looked at my phone and tried to do the same. Meanwhile, my driver (Jason) called looking for me and reported me missing. After both of us closing our apps, we tried “pairing us” on a new ride which put me with a driver miles away while still in his car.
It cost me 3 rides last night to get one place, 2 cancellations and a cash payment for a ride “off the system” because it would not connect us.  What a mess!  Next time I’ll try Lift.

title: Personal hygiene of drivers
review: I think it would be useful if you told your drivers to shower daily AND wash their Clothes regularly (if you bathe regularly but never wash your clothes, you will still smell terrible — you must DO BOTH). I take Uber a lot, and I’m often in cars with drivers who smell very badly. I think it would be helpful for Uber to instruct their drivers on this important point for customer satisfaction. When you rate a driver there’s no way to communicate this point in the satisfaction category. Leads one to want to find a different way to travel.

title: Back to 5 star
review:
I knew it what was the cause of battery life draining. It was Uber is the cause of battery life to go down why you had to remove that option and bring back the While using app instead. 3 stars gone because of this ting , the other government ting and do shame thing to women uber staff That is Terrible man terrible...

Two star given because of better than taxi in Thailand but I heard government gonna take down Uber in Thailand soon or not because it is illegal in Thailand

*update add another 3 stars because location while using is back!

title: Request Cancellation Fee to be waived
review:
Why must I be charged $5.00 to cancel a trip where your Uber driver takes way too long to get to my destination  that results in me missing my bus - you guys cannot have it both ways - when your driver has to wait on the rider you charge a waiting fee and when your driver arrive late and the trip has to be canceled you charge the rider $5.00 for your driver time - WHAT ABOUT MY TIME AND  MY INCONVENIENCE - take that into consideration - Uber service is getting “under my skin “ - too many complains and no one with a pulse to talk to - need to change that 
For today I’ll give Uber one star

title: 0/5 - Uber Navigation Error
review: Two days ago I had to jump a fence to get to my destination so I wouldn’t be late for work. Uber’s proprietary navigation service thinks that a road that’s been blocked off for 40+ years is somehow still a through street. I don’t need to give drivers additional directions to or from a location just in case they use the navigation service provided by Uber. Drivers shouldn’t have to compare directions between different navigation services each time they accept a ride. I would like to provide feedback to Uber so they can correct this ongoing issue, but their “help” page offers no such option. Let’s see if they care more about negative App Store reviews than providing an accurate service for their customers.

developerResponse.body: We really appreciate the time you took to help us improve. We understand this can be frustrating and are working towards making this better. Let us know more about it by dropping the details at t.uber.com/contact and we'll connect.

title: Longer wait, higher prices
review: I’m all for cost-saving options. I usually enjoy using Pool and I’ve tried Express Pool several times but I’ve also had to cancel all my rides because it’s too inconvenient and the kinks in it haven’t been worked out yet. All these options were created to increase affordability and I find myself disgusted at the prices nowadays. It’s sky-high just to ride a pool now and it takes double the time of the actual drive to get to my location. Not to mention these jokes of a “promo” - 40% off rides up to $6? I can’t get even get a ride for $6 anymore going a reasonable distance. The maps are awful and take you on major detours, oftentimes I have to tell my driver where to go to save time. This app is so ridiculous, I’m ready to delete it.

title: Customer Service Needs Improvement
review:
I apologize for the low rating, but I am doing that so this is read.

There needs to be better Customer service when there are ride issues. I manually typed in both addresses for pick up and drop off because I don’t trust the GPS. The driver never made it over to my location. Next thing I know, my ride is cancelled. They didn’t call me or anything to acknowledge they couldn’t find me. Lyft at least texts you when your ride is at the pickup so you can call them and sort out the issue. I was standing in the same spot where I entered the address, freezing for 10 minutes. So then I ordered another Uber pool and again, stood for another 10 minutes waiting. 

The app claims I will get my $5 back towards another ride. But how do I know if that will even be applied since I usually have a discount from good rating??? How about you credit my account back because at this point I would rather use Lyft. At least there’s a way to contact them...

Again, I’m sorry for the rating because I do like using Uber and Lyft, but I’m sure my rating was impacted for the “missed” ride that I didn’t even miss!

title: Pickup near or at airports but not at the passenger terminal
review: I work in the aviation industry. I often find myself needing a pickup at an airport, but not at the passenger terminal. I often put in the address of my pickup only to have the app change my pickup location to the passenger terminal. Sometimes this is a mile away or more on the other side of the airport. It results in me having to call the driver and give instructions on where to pick up. It is often confusing for them. I have had to make the trek to the passenger terminal a few times due to a drivers inability to work with me on the issue. In addition it’s hard to leave feedback like this on the app...I generally can only rate a driver or communicate a problem with the driver.

title: Very good site.
review:
Could be more user friendly but works pretty well. Recommended improvements.  

1. Don’t carry a compass and often on wrong site of street.  Label four corners at meeting site SW, NW, NE, SE.  

2. Give definitions of different types car ride option. Perhaps put a “Need Help? “ next to ride type choices ... ie “Uber X” .  

3.  Put car color and  type next to license number ie “RED SUV”.   I don’t know car types very well so saying VW Rabbit would mean nothing to me unless I’d owned ones.  (The photos are often too small for weak eyes to get a clear picture.). In big cities like DC and NYC with an enormous number of cars, that would be a big help.). 

4, On every page have a cancel button. I’ve had to stop a few times and could only think to turn off the phone. 

5.  Have a place to send message to driver when rating. Several have new. Great and I wanted to send a note in addition to sending a tip.  If that link exists, make it more obvious 

Thank you for your consideration.

title: App improvements?
review: Uber has implemented a system that takes care of their drivers. Like charging you after 2mins of waiting when your drivers arrives. And also a $5.00 cancellation fee If you cancel after 2 mins of the request for a driver. I think this app should protect their customers as well. If you request a uber and the map shows them 10 mins away after the driver accepted the call. Uber should charge the driver a fee if he doesn’t driver to the pickup location after 5 mins of receiving the request. I’m getting tired of waiting 20 mins for pickup when the driver is 4 mins away from my location. I think the service would be better. And I would feel valued as a customer.

title: Awesome!!
review: Thankfully, I have encountered nothing but awesome drivers with Uber!!  It is so unfortunate there are those who have attempted to tarnish the majority of genuine, honest people who make a choice and difference to become ride share drivers with Uber. Thank you to Uber for the additional security measures put in place for the safety of customers, as well as drivers!!  Thank you for the honest drivers who make a difference in the lives of so many each and everyday. May you be encouraged to know how much we appreciate you!  Thank you!!  Keep up the great work!!

title: Fine enough opportunity-buggy app
review:
I continue to have an issue where once I complete a “quest” to earn a weekend bonus, it stops letting me see my earnings activity.  In the app, navigating to find a place to message or email support is next to impossible. Eventually found that I had to tweet them to get a response.  Calling will get you to a person, but the issue is not fixed. (Just updated again). 
I also will get a message that “improper use has been detected” if the APP pairs me with the same rider twice in one night. So far, no action has been taken against me for this, but getting anything saying that you are misusing the app when you aren’t is nerve wracking.

title: Can not add multiple stops
review: I’ve never had to request an Uber for multiple stops before so this might be a recent bug, but who knows. i had to be dropped off at my first destination because my driver said he couldn’t drive me further without the multiple destinations being added. i was left in the snow, for about 30 minutes (thankfully it wasn’t too cold). i don’t believe this was the drivers fault. he couldn’t have been more apologetic. later that evening i had the same issue with multiple destinations not being able to be added. might try Lyft instead to see if this is an option without issue

title: Terrible
review: It’s stupid and very unnecessary new rule that unaccompanied minors can’t ride anymore is killing me. Some kids have jobs at 14 and need emergency rides every once in a while. I was late to work because of this. Also I very clearly pay for all my rides but a little while later, Uber tells me that I need to pay a fee for all rides I took in the past, and it’s quite expensive. Uber also has an impossible customer service to reach, making it very difficult to solve any mistakes. One more problem i have with the app is that it won’t accept any of my payment methods. Not even my card for some stupid reason. I have had too much problems in the past with Uber and can honestly go on for hours why Uber shouldn’t be your choice for transportation.

title: Give us a phone number to call
review: Charging $150 with no warning, no reasoning, and no way to dispute it without going through 5 menu screens on their app. Searching "Uber help line" "Uber support phone number" "Uber customer support" or "Uber customer support phone number USA" yeilds zero results because, guess what? They want to make sure you have no way to contact them directly! I guess I'll dispute the charge on my card - except they rejected both my cards and forced me to pay through Venmo, adding another middleman that will make disputing this charge even more impossible. I have been a very frequent customer for five years and have had zero incidents, and now a sudden charge with absolutely zero explanation and nothing I can do about it!

title: Uber uses hidden, bogus fees of 20% to pad cost of ride
review:
I object to the last minute addition of bogus fees. I had to pay an extra 20% for a non existent charge that Uber invented. It was not on the original cost when I was looking.  The explanation to tolls, venue charges, etc actually says it may not be a legitimate charge, but Uber will add it anyway. That was the case twice for a pickup at an Amtrak station. Uber may not be cheaper than a taxi anymore because of such padding of ride charges. Come on Uber, what’s the matter with being honest with your valued customers?
   Also, I noticed that Lyft and Uber rides cost exactly the same. Not even a penny difference. No wonder people want regulation that protects them from a monopoly situation. I don’t think it’s a good idea to burn up your goodwill by shoddy practices.
