title: Compliments galore

review:
My friend and I (both in our 70s) ordered an Uber. It was raining hard and quite cold.  We were outside of a popular San Francisco hotel (we did this as they have unloading/loading zone).  The app said 5 minutes,  traffic was horrible so we knew it would take longer.  Then the app said our driver was arriving.  But it never showed.  About 5 minutes later I was asked to tip and/or rate my ride!!  Huh??  We were getting soaked so I ordered another driver to get home.
Later I traced the no-show driver — clearly someone grabbed our Uber and took it on a local drive (our drive was a much longer drive over the Bay Bridge to Piedmont).  
We know to verify who our driver is (license plate) but please warn the drivers to carefully verify you are picking up the right passenger.  Thank you.

developerResponse.body: Hi, we're sorry to hear that your driver-partner may have picked up the wrong rider. We would certainly like to know more about this. Send in a quick note to t.uber.com/contact and we'll connect.

title: No show

review: For the longest time I had a great experience with Uber but as of late that has dramatically changed. On my original account they had an incorrect email address and I attempted to inform Uber of this but because the only support I can find is through the website instead of talking to someone to explain the problem and have it fixed I am locked out of that account. When I try to contact support about that account I can’t get the emails. I had gold status on that account. Now I made a new account but the prices are more expensive and I don’t get any promotions. I have no idea why I was locked out of the account. Incredibly disappointed in the customer service because I have in fact received none.

developerResponse.body: Hi there, we're sorry to hear that you've been locked out of your account. We want to look into this for you. Please contact our support team at t.uber.com/contact and we'll take it up from there.

title: App is great. Support is awful.

review:
I used for couple years, but I decided to delete this awful app recently due to its very poor customer service. A 20 minute trip turned out to be an almost 50 minute trip, because of the negligence of the driver. I was late for class in that day, when I could have been in class well before class started if I had had not used this awful app and had simply taken the metro and then walk to school. 

I contacted the Uber customer service, and all they gave me is a 5 dollar Uber credit. Seriously!? I wrote back to them again, but they just refused to do anything else to resolve the problem. So, if you plan to use this app, use at your own risk, and be prepared to be late if you have no luck to get a decent driver.

developerResponse.body: Hi there, we're sorry to hear about your experience. The feedback from our riders is vitally important to us, and we always want their expectations to be met. Let us know more about it by dropping the details at t.uber.com/contact and we'll connect.

title: Terrible customer service

review:
Her name was Yong and several issues need to be brought to the attention of Uber management so she can be mentored. 

When she first arrived at curbside, she never got out of the car to assist us in loading our luggage. My wife has a medical disability and loading luggage is not an activity that is compatible. Luckily we didn’t have heavy items so the loading got done. 

Her driving was a bit erratic and wasn’t able to consistently stay in the lane. Her speed varied noticeably despite light traffic.  Taking curves was not smooth.  This was all a reflection either of a tired driver or an inattentive driver. 

She made a couple of hands free personal calls and the volume was loud and distracting. The conversation was heard by us. 

Zero conversation, including hello or goodbye. 

When we arrived at the destination she stayed in the car and made zero effort to assist in unloading our luggage nor did she have a reason for that behavior (it would have been understandable if she had an injury or some other reason).

developerResponse.body: Hi, we are sorry to hear about your experience with driver-partner. We'd like to sort this out for you. Hence, would really appreciate it if you could send out a description of this with details at t.uber.com/contact and we'll look into it.

title: My Uber driver last night

review: Uber has increasingly been losing its appeal. Countless times there has been errors in navigation, pickups, drop offs, & cancellations. There used to be little to no errors when I would use the app but now there are so many more with every ride I take. Pool options used to be more cost friendly and time friendly which they no longer are. The most annoying thing about them are that riders whose pickups and drop off are no where near your own pickup and drop off can get added to the ride. Errors on both Uber & the drivers part are becoming more frequent and makes me want to change ride share apps.

developerResponse.body: Hey, this is definitely not what we want to hear. Tell us more about the concern you are facing and we'll work on improving it.

title: Losing its appeal

review:
I called for an Uber ride last night and had four drivers accept the ride and subsequently cancel while I was waiting.  I was effectively left stranded late at night with my two children outside of a major stadium.  We ended up being the last people in the parking lot.  The app just continued to send me to different drivers.  Thank god we were in a well lit area.  The most frustrating thing about the experience was there is no way to contact Uber.  I could not find any customer service information.  Finally, after more than an hour passed the fifth driver called me for directions and got us home safe.
This morning I still can not locate a phone number to call.  I now have serious doubts in whether to trust Uber with my safety.

developerResponse.body: Hi, we are sorry to hear about your unpleasant experience with the driver-partner for canceling the ride. The feedback from our riders is vitally important to us, and we always want their expectations to be met. The Uber app comes with an in-app support feature for when you need your questions answered. Select ‘Help’ from the app menu and you can choose any of the options under ‘Report an Issue’, or you can go right to your ‘Last Trip’ to report an issue from your most recent trip.

title: Left me stranded

review:
First time using Uber and I’ve spent over an hour trying to figure out how to set a schedule pick up ride to the airport. I couldn’t find anything helpful online either. My wife helped me look by going on her app which had the scheduling icon, but mine didn’t. I found out that it was because of the recent update. Please fix this update! Last week I was able to see the scheduling icon, but after the newest update, the scheduling icon doesn’t exist. I ended up having to login into my wife’s phone who doesn’t update her apps thank goodness just to schedule a ride.

For future reference, Uber should put scheduling on their website in case this apps scheduling doesn’t work.

developerResponse.body: Hi, sorry to hear about the trouble with scheduled rides feature. To make this work, we request you to force close the Uber app and re-open it again. If this does not help, you will find us at t.uber.com/contact .

title: Scheduling problem

review: Usually everything goes smooth , I’m a just get me to my destination type person but I’ve gotten great drivers that are full of personality. I just wanted to put in notice the horrible experience with Uber they charged me for a ride that I didn’t take . I waited like 40 mins just to get a ride home . Like at this point it isn’t fair I’d like to talk to someone about getting a refund for both ride I took and the one I didn’t it’s completely unfair. What makes it worse is that you can’t talk to somebody and they aren’t quick with refunds if you can take my money in a split second I expect the same for giving me back my money !!!

title: Nightmare

review: I literally use Uber everyday and have been using Uber for over a year now and literally EVERYTIME I get an Uber the driver is overcharging me for my ride. My final straw With Uber was a couple days ago. The Uber driver drove off with ALL of my sisters clothes and Uber has been giving me the run around for the past 2 days when I asked them to contact the driver. I contacted the driver multiple times the night she left with my sisters clothes and she blocked my number. Also there needs to be a way to talk to people who work with Uber OVER THE PHONE and not just through text because they respond when they feel like it. My sister still doesn’t have her clothes and when she gets them back I will be deleting Uber off of my phone.

title: Uber doesn’t care about the riders

review: My name is Mark Mahoney. Today I was unfairly charged a cancellation fee by Uber after waiting for 20 minutes for an Uber to take me home. I called for the Uber while standing on the curb outside Rayburn. One car had to cancel according to the message sent me, then a second assigned car cancelled on me. Finally the third assigned driver arrived to where I was standing on Independence Avenue and took me home. I got home and found out I had, to my extreme surprise, been assigned a $5 cancellation fee. I should not have to pay that fee. If anything Uber should compensate me for having 2 drivers cancel on me and making me wait for a protracted period of time.

developerResponse.body: Hi, this certainly sounds frustrating. We'd like to help you with the cancellation charges. Please send in a note to t.uber.com/contact and we'll connect.

title: Unfairly charged a cancellation fee.

review:
Uber pool is a joke. It takes forever to load and then says “meet driver in 1 min” super far away from where you are so you have to walk/run to get there.  Then the driver will literally drive right by where your original pick up or drop off spot would have been but yet you’re stuck walking. Uber pools have dropped me in wrong neighborhoods, on busy streets with no crosswalks, and in real sketchy areas “to keep them on a more direct route.” I used to enjoy Uber but now I feel like it’s taking advantage of customers. 

And there should be a way to say that when you rate a driver, a customer should be able write that it was a ridiculous route or bad drop off or pick up place so that Uber knows in the future to not do that. 
It’s unsafe and unprofessional.

title: Uber pool

review: I have been using Uber consistently for over four years now, since my retirement.  Without Uber, I would not have met my fitness goals—I go to a Rehabilitation Institute gym about 10 miles from where I live.  Public transportation can get me there  in about 2 hours and $5.  With Uber, it’s a 20 minute trip and $8 more but door to door and worth every penny (especially in the winter).  I lost a little over 90 pounds since using Uber.  Thank you, Uber Exercise  Program (and  Rehabilitation Institute of Chicago)!
title: Uber helped my successful fitness program!

review:
We have been on Uber many times in Vegas and many other cities and this was the WORST ride ever. First, there was no waiting. Second, he pulled up and just sat in the suv while we tried to figure out how to open the back. My wife was in the back seat and she said all of a sudden he sai “Jesus Christ are they trying to break my car. He finally came to the back and asked the same question. I tried to tell him we had suitcases to put in and most drivers help. He just stood and stared at me so I asked him if we were going to get our ride. He asked if we still wanted to take it so i said yes you are here so let’s go. He got in the car with a silent treatment the entire time. 
If this would have been our first Uber trip it would have been our last!

title: Worse Uber Driver

review:
I always check the license plate of the vehicle that picks me up.  Unfortunately this pick up car’s plate number did not appear on your website.  Since the car make and color matched the website and driver looked like his picture I accepted the pick up.  But this is a very important safety provision and you should verify that all license plates are properly entered.  Unlike this case, I am often traveling alone and would have been reluctant to accept the ride if that had been the case.  

Thank you
title: Issue with license plate on Munmar’s car!

review:
I keep getting drivers that call me and ask where I’m going. Shortly after they’ll say something along the line of “okay! I’m on my way!” Shortly after the call they cancel the ride. I know for a fact that they can’t do this and I even had some back and forth with a few drivers but they always end up canceling. 
These incidents have cost me to be late to work multiple times. It bugs me I don’t have an easy way to report this. It REALLY bugs me that Uber thinks crediting me 5 bucks to a Uber card I can’t even use (because you have to actually have enough money to cover the entire ride to use the card) is sufficient enough for my inconveniences.

Can you please update the trip details where you had to face any issues t.uber.com/contact so that we can have a look into this right away?

title: I feel like a joke to these people

review: Uber prices are horrible. You would think your paying for an affordable ride to your location until you remove the short walk. It’s ridiculous especially why it’s somewhere not worth paying that much. Uber needs to go back to its affordable prices. Also, pool drivers don’t get you to your location fast enough because they’re too busy trying to pick up as much people as they can. Another HUGE problem is when a driver cancel on me and it charges my account. I’m always on time for the Uber arrival so when I’m looking for you and contacting you and you’re nowhere near to be found, it’s an issue! Cancel trips needs new policies and better communication. Thank you.

developerResponse.body: Hi Sniceyy, the trip fare and dynamic pricing are subjective to demand and supply in the area at the time. It constantly changes with the rise/fall in either factor. We are working towards the dynamic fare policies to make it as fair for both our riders and partners. Also, now, when requesting a Pool, you'll even have the option of Express Pool, where you'll have to take a short walk to and from your ride for a lower price. If you would prefer not to walk, toggle back to regular Pool to pay a little more for a door-to-door ride. For further queries, reach out to us via t.uber.com/contact and we'll connect.

title: PRICES

review:
I was quite annoyed with the whole OHare experience.  When I opened the app, a time an hour and a quarter later appeared on the screen with a price $25 more than I expected showed.  Since it appeared we would wait, I ordered the Uber to find that the driver was on his way but we were still waiting for luggage.  

When the driver arrived he was upset that we weren’t there and the police would make him move.  As it turned out he waited maybe 5-10 minutes for us.  When I arrived at the car, I received no acknowledgement nor any assistance with any of the luggage for 3 passengers.  Our 1 hour trip was fine.  The car smelled of tobacco smoke but was clean.  

Finally, I am still trying to figure out how to use $50 in Uber cash towards this fare but can’t figure it out on the app.

I have always had good experiences with Uber but am very dissatisfied with your app, it’s ease of use and the less than reasonable interaction initially with this driver.

Dennis Stevens
title: OHare Pickup

review:
I am no speaking for all Uber drivers because I’m sure most are great. I had an experience this morning that I placed an order for pickup from a location, I was directed to go almost to blocks away for driver and when I got there he cancelled my ride and I got charged. 
First of all I do not believe I should have to be picked up in a different location from the address I gave for pick up and secondly the driver didn’t wait for me to get there. I also just received a credit for a refund but not in my credit card, I might not use Uber again. I’m not asking for a refund for the ride I actually got. I want a refund for the cancellation fee.

I work in downtown Brooklyn Metrotech most of the buildings don’t have address numbers posted on them.  So I go to the hotel which is a common place and easy to find. Only this time it made me walk back to my building to get the cab.  When dropping me of I could see my house the driver was four houses away and made a turn down a further block.  I use uber daily and really up to now really liked it. This change is utterly stupid

Don’t understand, three Uber experts could not get it to work. Finally an amazing generous gentleman hailed Uber on his iPhone sitting right next to me and gave me a free ride. title: Important update PLEASE!

review:
I am extremely upset. The other day while using Uber the app was acting glitchy. It ended up canceling a ride right in the middle of it. It was about a minute in. 
So my driver did not get paid in full even though he completed the entire trip from my house to job. I was unable to figure out on the app how to pay him for the remainder of the ride or give him a tip. When I contacted Uber asking them for help letting them know that he gave me the ride and deserved full payment plus a tip they refused to help me tip him!  
This was their response:
Hi Jacky,

Sorry to hear about the trouble here and happy to help.

We understand that you took this trip and want to tip your driver. As per the policy tipping is not available on trips which have cancelled status.

We appreciate you letting us know about this. This type of feedback helps us improve the Uber experience.  

This is after I explained to them that it was accidentally canceled and that he completed the transportation. I am literally not asking for anything but to let me pay this person that provided me a service. I am incredulous that they are letting this happen. Shame on Uber.
title: Very upset.

review: I truly enjoy using Uber and have only great things to say about the program, the drivers and the quietness (not having to listen to annoying taxi dispatcher yelling at their drivers). BUT PLEASE work on your app when asking to rate the driver and add a tip if desired. When I click on it I expect to see a place to rate the driver and add a tip, but instead it has me wandering all over your app. Yes I am older and this may be simple for my grandkids, but I don’t spend my day playing on these app’s. Just simplify this please.
title: Great service but confusing app

review:
We live in the US. We went over to Rome the past week. Schedule for the Uber - he did not show up or show up but we did not see him - he canceled the trip and we were charged 10 €. Notified Uber via app and was credited 10€ to use on account. We live in the US and don’t know when we would be back there to use it - probably won’t bc I noticed that taxi in Europe cost less than Uber and is much more efficient and they are everywhere. Taxi in Europe, they have a flat rate to take to the airport and Uber is almost double the price to take to airport so do some home work first before use them out of the country. I don’t know why Uber did not just credit back into my Credit card.
Can’t find a number to call for this. A bit frustrated.

review: I use app cabs twice a day 5 times a week but the service from drivers and customer support has so bad the last 6 months I finally ditched this app. Having drivers cancel your ride after waiting 5 to 15 minutes for them to arrive because they are having navigation issues. Having drivers call or text you to find out your destination and then tell you they won’t drive to certain places. Having drivers accept your ride and then not proceed to pick you up so you have to cancel and then you get charged a fee. Having drivers say they picked you up and complete your ride without being picked up. Then have customer service tell you they can’t credit you for said issues. review: The application is awesome! I love it! However there are some things hat need to be worked out. This application needs to take in consideration of riders safety when setting up express walking pickup - drop off requests. title: Update causes me to get tossed between drivers.

review:
1. On a hand full of occasions the Uber App does not let me request a ride because I have “insufficient funds” - it’ll say that I need to finish paying for a previous ride, even though I have more than enough money in Uber cash, and my credit cards linked to the account are active. 3. Lastly, customer support is slow and they close your ticket without solving your problem!

developerResponse.body: Hi Jay, we're sorry to hear about the experience with the receipts and support team. It would be great if you could provide us with some specific details regarding the same at t.uber.com/contact and we'll take it up from there.

title: Terrible Customer Support

review:
The problem is simple, in many cases the time to pick me up estimated by the app (let's say 4 minutes) is not even close to what it really takes for the driver to arrive. That calculation is made by an Uber algorithm and I think it is malicious, because if I am unhappy (let's say that I've waited for 5 minutes and the app says 3-4 minutes left to pick me up) and I want to cancel and not be charged, the app warn me that that goes against the driver (who will not receive pay).
Your business model is abusive to drivers and users, because an error in your algorithm estimation causes dissatisfaction in users and the cost is paid by either the user (if they do not dispute the charge) or the driver (if the user disputes the charge).

developerResponse.body: Hi, we understand your concern here. The ETA times are estimates and not guaranteed. A variety of external factors like heavy traffic or road construction can impact travel time. To know more about ETA, please visit http://ubr.to/2hCbWFd . If there's anything else we can look into, let us know by sending a note to t.uber.com/contact and we'll connect.

title: Why you don’t assume your own errors?

review: Overall the app is great, except for the layout of the screen to view your trip and receipt. For business expense purposes, it would be nice to be able to view the date/time, pickup and drop off addresses, as well as the receipt/total. As it is currently configured, the section above the Help and Receipt tabs takes up too much real estate, making it impossible to capture a single screenshot with all of the pertinent information. I would suggest making the Need help with this trip? section smaller or move it below the receipt.
title: App Feedback - Enhancement Request

review: I’ve been an Uber customer for years now and I’ve noticed a decline in service. Drivers are rude, they text while driving, rear view mirrors be broken, on personal phone calls, speeding when they shouldn’t. I’ve just been looking the other way and not reporting any of it on Uber     Until now, I’m dealing with two claims that were unfairly dealt with. Uber was mainly concern about their “cleaning fee” and ignoring the fact that the drivers were overall unprofessional and dangerous. Usually, I do not write reviews, but I am extremely unsatisfied and can not justify paying for this service any longer. I’m writing this review to raise awareness to other customers that might be experiencing the same thing and just never said anything.

title: Uber isn’t as good as it use to

review: They seriously have great customer service. If you ever have an issue after a ride or uber eating you should definitely call and politely explain your problem because they also comply and fix it. I am always refunded right away even when I've emailed or sent messages through the app i get a response the same or the next day. Yes uber maybe expensive at times but in this department they definitely make up for it. Uber customer support is really on the customers side!!!
title: Great Customer Service

review: I use Uber to get to and from work every day. There are many great drivers I’d love to be able to use every time but we don’t always get each other, even when I’m right next to them when I request the ride and they’re online their portion to accept rides. This means it does not link you to the closest driver. Please make a way we can request drivers. Give them two minutes to accept (Incase they’re busy or about to drop someone off) and if they don’t accept within that timeframe, then send the request out to all nearby drivers.
title: Requesting drivers

review: I've reached out MULTIPLE times regarding these weird people not delivering my food and lying saying they did. Uber responds when they feel like it which is crazy because you didnt hesitate to take my money for a purchase but you take a week to respond. Secondly the drivers are horrible. No need to go into details on that im sure im not the only one who has witnessed this. Why am i being charged for a malfunctioning scooter i dont care if it was .23cents or .5cents give me my money back i was unable to use it and i dont get paid to give my money to uber for nothing. If i pay for a service i expect to get my moneys worth or close to it. Also when customers reach out you all should respond promptly as you do when its urgent.

developerResponse.body: Hi, we are sorry to hear that you've been charged unfairly. We'd like to sort this out for you. Hence, would really appreciate it if you could send out a description of this with details at t.uber.com/contact and we'll look into it.

title: Poor Customer service & Drivers

review:
When the price is presented, I always feel the price is the same amount that I would pay my friend to take me to the same place. Finally, something fair in the world that’s for everyone!

Never felt uncomfortable. I got to my destination with the same urgency as if I was driving myself. No pressure to talk, or if I’m a “chatty Kathy”, the driver always seems welcome to conversation. And I’ve used Uber on 3 continents. 

This is one global traveler who swears by this product, and that’s why I give this app 5 stars.
title: There’s at least one thing in life that’s fair

review: Uber charged me for Ride Share, which I did not approve of or agree to. I have no documented proof. Their customer service team ignores my request for a refund by closing my case over and over again without answering me. No one will get back to me. They will not take fault for their technical error. A rep told me auto-renewal for this feature is still turned on even though I turned it off weeks ago. My suggestion—check your charges and remove your card off of their app. I’ve been in customer service for 12 years and uber is delivering absolutely horrible customer service. I tweeted them regarding this issue and they told me to refer to my correspondence with Help. Help is who keeps closing my case without answer.
title: Charges That Were Not Agreed To

review: I don’t know what I would do without Uber. They are always on time and you never have to wait more than 6 minutes or less for your ride to get to your distancing. Most of the cars they send for their customers are very nice and clean. They greet you by name when you get in the car and they socialize with their riders. The temperatures in their cars are set occurring to the weather. Not to mention the fares are very reasonable most of the time. I’m a satisfied loyal customer. Thanks Uber your appreciated in Philadelphia. Keep up the GOOD WORK!
title: I love Uber

review:
50% of ride requests the graphics show driver spinning somewhere. I’ll be at my location. Text driver to ensure he has right pickup address. I get an OK response. No show. Calls me asking where am I he’s here. I’m standing at the address staring at empty curb (no Uber in sight). I tell him I’m at the address I gave him and he acknowledged. He cancels. I get $5 charge. Seriously? Use Help. Get $5 Uber Credit instead of the $5 charge cancellation against my credit card. My guess: many uber drivers scamming the system to get paid for fake rides. No checks and balances. 
Uber app is terrible. 
Not sure how they can justify their “value as a software company “ when their app and support are atrocious. 
I’m shutting down my Uber account. Will use CURB and Lyft going forward.
title: Driver no shows but charge fees

review: Uber is a convenient service - on-demand rides wherever you need to go. The app is intuitive. You set up your account, including payment options and start riding. It has efficiency features where you can split the cost with other riders, you can set up Uber rides for others (like getting a car to pick up mom to come over), you can share your ride details via text and you can also easily rate your drivers and even tip. It really is convenient and easy to use!
title: Convenient and easy to use

review: Truly horrible. This app used to be so reliable. I don’t know what happened. Every single time I order a ride it will say 2 minutes and the map shows the car down the street from me. Then suddenly the car is in a completely different place very far away on the map. But it still says 2 minutes. I timed it last time. It took 10 minutes for the car to get to me and the entire time the app said my ride was 2 minutes away. I guess they do this so that you don’t go use another ride app because the car is so far away. This app has left me stranded too many times. It’s made me late too many times. I cannot rely on it. It’s garbage. Lyft is much more reliable and doesn’t screw its customers over. Officially done with uber
title: Garbage

review: This is the first time I’ve used Uber in about 3 months. Last time, the App. was difficult to use in the sense that the options you had weren’t clear, and very slow to load. This time, the interface is much easier to use quickly, and it loads and updates very quickly. The options for where you want to be picked up and where you want to go are more accurate and easier to use, especially when in an urban area, and everything is so close.

I was headed to uptown (Chicago) and my route for any reason was headed towards north and lake so there’s NO point of traveling all the city while I was heading close to downtown. Now because of that I lost my job AND actually this is not the first time I got a poor route chosen by Uber. I lost my flight last year and this is just the cherry on the top. I am Super frustrated and irritated with this service, I almost never complained about anything but this went too far this time. I sent this message to support and all that I got was my trip fare was correct. Are you kidding me? I’m uninstalling and switching to Lyft right away!

review:
I have always loved using Uber but as soon as an issue arose and I needed help, they have proven to be the absolute worst customer service experience I have ever had.

Via the Uber desktop website I bought gift cards for a friend’s birthday and though I was in the USA at the time, my Uber account (and his) are both based in Australia.

At no point in the purchasing process was it made clear that I was buying region specific gift cards.

Suffice to say when he received them on his birthday the vouchers were locked to the location of purchase.

I contacted Uber expecting an easy fix and have since had a mix of automated responses and general stonewalling, suggesting cards can’t be exchanged or refunded. So my friend who has no intention of travelling to the USA has $100+ worth of vouchers that he can’t use.

I’m not at all satisfied with this experience especially given there was never clear instructions about gift cards being region specific.

Sad to say after all these years I will never use Uber or Uber eats again.

They treat their customers like trash because they know they can get away with it.
title: ZERO customer service

review:
It is extremely frustrating to request an Uber and be told that you will arrive by “x” time. Every single Uber I take ends up arriving at the earliest 5 minutes past the estimate. It causes frustration towards the driver because Uber always sets an unrealistic arrival time.
Also, the fact that passengers get charged if a driver cancels is ridiculous. It’s a way for drivers to scam passengers. I’ve waited for an Uber for over 10 minutes just to have the driver cancel and then I got charged! If a passenger cancels, then I understand the fee, but if a driver cancels, then passengers should get something like 10% off the next ride.
Uber used to be great but I feel like this year they have dropped the ball so many times.

title: Give Riders Nontoll Options Via App
review:
The tag line under Uber in the App Store when I looked it up to write this review is ironically: “Know the cost before riding.”
Considering I was charged an additional $15 on a $30 trip for tolls, I would disagree they fulfilled on the above. (A 50% increase does not fall within an acceptable “price estimation” accuracy tolerance.)

While I am now aware that Uber currently expects a rider to verbally redirect a driver to not use tolls, I don’t think Uber should assume that the rider knows the area enough to make these calls during the trip. 
I propose that the option be given beforehand when selecting a route with price and eta estimates. (And if rerouting is needed during the ride, Uber can even send a notification to the riders app to accept or decline alternate routes.)
I would also appreciate giving the rider a personal default option preference on the app.

P.S. I tried to find a way to give this feedback via the Uber App, but there was no feedback option under Help that I could find.

In the rare scenario (~1 out of 10) when the car arrives, make sure to look out for a driver because the app may crash unexpectedly while leaving you with a $5 cancellation fee and making you late to wherever you’re going. In order to save time, it might be better to order a car on your way to a bus stop.

There are taxi company apps that have this ability.

review:
These days, let’s be honest, you don’t come across too many nice people. David is genuine. David cares. David allowed my husband to stop and get a pizza after a wedding. At this moment right now, my drunk husband won’t stop talking about this pizza and it wouldn’t be possible if David wasn’t so patient and thoughtful. (Come on—you know how wedding food is!)

review:
tl;dr — whenever I use uber, I end up late and feeling like I have enabled pure corporate evil. Not good. 

I use uber — it’s convenient and relatively affordable. That said, I can’t trust this company at all. Their timing and pricing are completely unreliable. If you’re ever trying to get to a destination by a certain time, pad on a generous 50% to the estimate. I don’t care if the variable is driver competence, traffic, or (most likely) picking up every yuppie in the city en route to the airport — if a service tells me I will arrive in X minutes, don’t tell me it’ll be 1.3X AFTER I PAY YOU. 

Furthermore their ethics with their drivers are profoundly dubious.

review: My first time experience with using Uber was excellent. I was leaving a brewery and needed picked up because I wasn’t capable of driving that evening after the drinks. Downloaded the app, filled out my info, entered my current location and where to go, it provides low to high costs for you. My distance was between 20-25 miles and it cost about $40. Reasonable considering my situation and the downtown city I was not familiar with. The driver was very friendly and engaged in great conversation. Thank you so much! Great work Devs!
title: Excellent App!

review: This morning I was told my driver was 3 min away. 8 min later, a new driver was dispatched for unknown reasons, 2nd driver was also 3 min away. 6 min later I saw an Uber car matching the description the app showed, drive by, look at me (with a medium sized suitcase) and drove on. A third Uber driver was dispatched, now it’s been 15 min since I was originally  told the driver would be there in 3 min. The 3rd driver showed up, 5 min later. I was 15 min from the airport and it took 3 drivers?!  Odd app, Odd experience! I was never given a reason why 3 drivers had to be dispatched to get 1 to show up and take me to LAX.

I make every effort to be conscious of this in my daily life i hope all of you can consider it too. :)

title: We had an unfit driver.....
review:
On Sunday, May 19, 2019, we called Uber for a ride from 2nd Ave & 66th Street in
NYC to Fort Lee, NJ.

The car arrived as promised and we were on our way.

Our driver, Ibrahim, wore eyeglasses which appeared filthy and, indeed, he took them off every few minutes in order to see where he was going. He drove very slowly, cars were honking their horns, and it soon became clear to us that the man should not be sitting behind the wheel. It was very scary, to say the least.

In addition, it was extremely difficult to understand him, he was unable to utter a simple sentence.

When we got to the Fort Lee exit he missed it, as well as the next one. When we told him he had missed the exits he blamed the GPS. We ended getting to Fort Lee in a round about way. 

We told him, after trying to explain to him where to turn into our street, that he should not be driving, that it is obvious that he is a danger to himself and to his passengers.

It is because of this very scary ride that we gave him 1 star only.

Our experience with Uber drivers had been very good, we hope Ibrahim is not a sign of what is to come.

Donna

review:
I believe these reviews should be about the App, not Uber. I find the app to mostly work well. I noticed that it put in 5 stars for a ride that I had not immediately rated myself, and that I couldn’t change that anymore. Not a great solution in my opinion. At least let me change the rating.

I've had great experiences and met wonderful people (drivers). Overall a fantastic company! I continue to use Uber everywhere I go.

title: Charged 7 months after a trip occurred.
review:
If I could give no stars, I really would.
Ok so I took a trip in March, from my understanding when the trip isn't paid for at that moment, you can't order an uber till the trip has been paid for. I have been able to request uber this whole time. So I get an email in September, about 7 months after this trip occurred, saying I'm being charged for this trip. The so called support team is saying I was never charged for that trip. It is is unprofessional and disgusting that I'm being charged about 7 months after the ride occurred. I don't get how it is possible that I wasn't charged them, but I'm being charged 7 months after the ride took place.
Disgusting, and unprofessional.

title: Unfair charges
review: I am a 5 star rider who has been using Uber every day to get to and from work for a year and a half now. I have unlocked all levels in their rewards program which includes price protection on a set route. At some point in July I stopped receiving this reward even though the app shows I still have it. I’m now having to pay so much more to commute to work and I can barely afford it anymore. This is an absolute rip off and customer service has been no help after numerous attempts at fixing this. The pandemic has caused me to lose work hours and now Uber is charging more for this route than they did before I had the price protection in place. I cannot afford to be an Uber customer anymore.

title: Uber is one sided doesn’t care about the driver
review:
Uber doesn’t listen to the drivers at all. Regardless of your in good standing with your passengers! It takes one or two drivers to make false accusations against you and Uber only listens to false accusations and not the truth! 
I was accused falsely by 2  passengers because I wouldn’t accompany the drivers to their hotel rooms!  So the passengers made false accusations against me! But yet when I told the Uber what actually happened they could careless about me and deactivated my account! 
I would rather keep my dignity rather than work for a company who doesn’t care what happens to me! 
I also reported another driver for sexual harassment. Uber’s response to me he isn’t on platform just don’t get in his car.

The app loads so slow, and I thought it was just my phone but I’ve changed phones recently so I thought it was just my old phone but nope still slow and Uber drivers should not be calling me 5 seconds after they arrive, can't even lock my door w/o them blowing me up 😂. review: Our trip with Mamet was our first Uber ride ever and it was a wonderful experience. Uber used to be very helpful, now the service seems useless.

review: I needed a short ride to the store. My Uber app said the driver was 3 minutes away. 5 minutes later my driver calls me and asks if I’m at a Marriott. I told her I was not and that I was waiting outside the coffee bean where I had ordered the Uber. She told me okay but that she was going to go to the Marriott anyways to use the restroom. I would have cancelled and ordered another driver who was actually ready to Uber but a notification alerted me that I would be charged $5 to cancel. The ride itself cost less than $5 so regrettably I didn’t cancel. I was eventually picked up almost 30 minutes later. Terrible service. If a driver starts off 3 minutes away, you should be allowed to cancel for free after waiting 20 minutes.

title: Unavailable due to bad map
review:
Yesterday for the second time there were no rides available for an hour. When rides did finally become available, Uber hiked the trip rates.
Stranded, I agreed to the increased rate, and the GPS on my app repeatedly put in an erroneous pickup address. When I tried to put in the correct address, I got the “something is wrong, wait a few minutes and try again” message. So I ordered the car to the incorrect address, planning to update the pickup address when a car was found. Trying to do that, the map kept reverting to the incorrect address.  Finally I talked with the driver who barely spoke English and did not know major intersections when I tried to tell him how to find me.
Today I was charged for the cancelled call.
My complaints:
1. The Uber GPS incorrectly pinned an address
2. The incorrect address could not be amended by the rider
3. The driver did not speak English and I do not speak Korean
4. The driver was inadequately trained about the area he was trying to serve
5. As I have clear instructions to the driver, he made no effort to leave the incorrect address

review:

He got me to the airport very quickly and he was an excellent driver. I could not have had a better first experience with Uber, thanks to Francisco!
Anne Rejack
Latham Ny

review: I use uber a lot for work, the service is great. A big complaint I have is the lack of guidelines for the drivers in some specifics. It doesn’t feel right, and I shouldn’t have to be in situations I’m trying to avoid, but you can’t pick your uber.

title: Horrible support
review: I had two different instances where I had to pay some stupid cancellation fee. First time it said my driver had an ETA of 12 minutes but he stayed on one spot for 15 and then started driving away from me, and I had to pay the $5 cancellation fee???? Second time it said eta 12 minutes before I confirmed then told me he was completing a trip and changed to 25, that didn’t work for me but I still had to pay the $5. Tried to call Uber and they don’t even allow support over the phone so I emailed them and they replied saying they don’t accept emails so I went to the help on the app and it only let me dispute the one charge, and will only refund using Uber credit. I personally won’t be using Uber again

title: Functional, but worse than I was expecting
review:
I ordered an Uber this morning.  The driver picked me up on time, but as soon as I got in the car the ride was cancelled.  I didn’t cancel it, the driver didn’t cancel it, and we tried twice to get the same ride.  Each time, the app picked a different driver even though the original driver was at my house.  I had to actually get out an wait for a new driver, wasting my own time and that of the original driver.

Almost equally maddening, there is no way for me to enter this issue in the uber app!!  All of the issues one can enter are canned sentences, there is no option to for ‘My issue is not covered here’ along with a text box.

review: This is prolly the 8th time I get a rude driver. When I order from uber, either the person never arrives to my location, leaves me stranded, or refuses to acknowledge they don't know how to follow directions. Tonight I took lyft (once again) instead because the drivers are MORE PROFESSIONAL AND FRIENDLIER !!! uber is way down in the dumps and they tend to hire jerks. title: $5 for canceling?
review:
Recently they changed the policy I guess. They were going to charge me 5 bucks for cancelling the trip after 2 mins- before it was 5 mins. So there's no flexibility for the customers because they can do nothing if it takes too long for the driver to arrive. Not sure what they were thinking about when making this decision in this customer-centric era. 

I'm not sure if it's better than Lyft, because Lyft will reimburse you if the driver took the wrong way and spent extra 15mins on the route.

Very disappointed.  But nothing I can do, they are a big company and has only 1 competitor I guess.

title: Cancellation Fee?
review: This is the second time recently while on a schedule to get to the airport I’ve had  at least three cancellations from drivers. I then seeked another ride and cancelled the over delayed pickup I requested. I do not think it’s right for me to pay a cancellation fee when the drivers cancel on me and make my on time arrival at the airport very awkward and inconvenient. I would like a refund for both times or I may just cancel my app with Uber and use the competition. I do have a choice!

title: The worst support ever!
review:
I’m a really good customer of Uber. But their customer support and arrogance is the worst! They continuously make changes to their app, and change or take out features without informing their customers. 
Family profiles is completely gone right now. I have someone that is using my Uber that I want to remove and I can’t now. Their support documentation still has family profiles, no mention of not supporting it at all. Or what to do in my situation? How do you make a major change like that, and not update your support documentation?! And nothing on the web either. I also updated my version thinking that might be the problem. No luck! I’m pretty sure I’m moving to Lyft after this.

title: Used to be good...
review: I have been an uber user for over 4 years...daily! They were amazing in the beginning and prices couldn’t be beat. Now...it can never even find my destination when leaving my house. I have to wait for the driver to pull over and put my destination address in their own maps app and get back on the road to wherever I’m going. I try to give drivers directions instead but they don’t listen (understandably), and want to wait to get directions from app or web. And then I’m late to wherever I’m going. Every. Single. Time. This never used to happen. What’s going on?

With the information given as to who will pick you up, you cannot go wrong (they give you make and model of the car, along with the license plate number and the driver’s name).  The drivers have been super efficient and friendly and the cost makes it the way to travel without the hassle of driving yourself.
title: What a fantastic app and service

We got charged $4 wait time since all parties were not present when the car arrived 30 minutes before the estimated arrival time. Found out the hard way that the estimated arrival time was at the end destination, not the pick up point.
Additionally, driver should not have used toll roads without permission, especially since non toll roads were readily available.

Given the parking restrictions at the destination, uber was still the better option.
title: FYI

review:

This greatly effects ratings on both parties.

A WEEK LATER AND THE APP REFUSES TO WORK. THE DRIVERS ACCEPT TO PICK UP, YET THEY STAY IN PLACE. DRIVERS GO THE WRONG WAY AND REFUSE TO PICK UP PHONE CALLS. The wait time charge needs to account for the difference between when the app says it will arrive, and when they actually arrive.
title: Ok but gps problems

review:
1. Can’t communicate directly with actual UBER personnel: email only = thumbs down.
2. Font size and pictures on the rider app are way too small, make them bigger and easier to see and read.
3. Not enough rating descriptors for drivers.
4. Drivers need to be aware that not all riders are fully sighted. Some like myself are legally blind and therefore driver may need to interact differently with me.
5. Improve safety by allowing riders to customize  the type of driver they want to ride with. For example: only females with 4.7 or higher rating, etc.
title: Good but can be improved

review: Drivers need to be a lot more careful and smart about how they identify riders. The last driver asked the woman entering his vehicle if she was “Barbara” and she said she was. She wasn’t. He should’ve asked her what her name is, not told her what name he was looking for. It’s an easy mistake to make, but can be costly in many ways. Sure, we got a refund, but also ended up with nearly a half-hour delay. I drive for Uber for a couple years, never had a willfully wrong rider, but I did ask for their names and avoided a few mistakes as a result of just being more savvy about identifying riders.
title: Stolen ride

review:
No longer will be using Uber. 

My friends and I have been noticing the difference in pricing between our requests. I never cared too much about he small differences (mine cheaper than theirs and vice versa) until yesterday. I had 2x the price for the same exact route at the same time. I know uber will claim that it’s because of surge pricing that the requests are different, but I’m the one who requested first and we tried the request several times, closing out of the app each, time to see if it would change and I had double the pricing every time. 

If this is happening with people I actually know, can only imagine how many times this has happened to me with strangers..

title: Double pricing for same exact route/time

review:
Aggressive use of location services.  There is no reason why this app needs access to location services even when it is not in use.  1 star until that is addressed.

 Update: It's about time Uber did the right thing and enabled location tracking only while using the app!  However, they only did the right thing 5 minutes before iOS 11 would have forced their hand and, consequently, it is hard to see this as anything more than a PR stunt. Why is it that this company only does the right thing when their backs are against the wall?

Customer service told me they can’t do anything with the score, and one single score won’t have a huge influence:) The rating system is stupid, customer service is not helpful. Already downloaded Lyft:D hope I can say goodbye to this stupid app.

review: The new requirement of taking a photo of yourself wearing a mask - makes no sense at all. First off, you’re already made to check a box confirming you’re wearing a mask prior to a ride being ordered. Why does this step exist if you’re going to have to take a photo? Then the required photo of you wearing a mask - anyone could throw a mask on and immediately take it off. Wearing a mask in a photo proves nothing. The moment of truth is if you’re wearing a mask when your car actually arrives. This feels like nothing more than a ploy by Uber to use Covid as an excuse to log photos of clients into their database - information they have no need for or right to.
title: Uber Taking Advantage of Covid
UBER ride
review: I think UBER for the most part is great I work up for work my car wouldn’t start the driver was here in 9 minutes he did not say good morning or speak to my 3 well mannered children . He was nice his car was clean he only spoke to ask which way when we got to my school and after I tipped him he said thank you have s good day . I don’t sweat the small things I still tipped him well but someone else may not I will need to call again tomorrow much cheaper than renting a car .

title: Snow day
review: It snowed a ton and my car wouldn’t make it to work with all the hills. I’m a nurse and didn’t want to call in due to short staffing. I agreed to pay the $55 (surge amount). My driver showed up in a Prius and naturally got stuck and took additional time to get me to work. By the time I arrived Uber charged me an additional $70. I contacted them and was given a $30 ride credit. Wow thank you. Absolutely despise this company. Feel like my money was stolen considering I never agreed to that amount. Ended up paying over $120 for a 10 min ride to work due to snow, and my driver taking an alternative route...because they showed up in a PRIUS and couldn’t make it up the snowy hills. Does not make sense why that falls on the rider to have to pay more.

title: Good
review: Very convenient but the only issue I’ve been having lately is that when I schedule a ride it will say 8 min away but then I’ll look at my phone 2 or 3 min later and it will say Uber is here(or almost here) without even notifying me so I have to run downstairs so they don’t over charge me. Other problem is I’m not getting people that don’t speak English. And it’s hard for me to communicate with them. So when it comes time to pick me up from my job or my apt they either get here and I can’t explain them exactly where I’m at and I get charged for the ride, which is not fair at all.

title: driver compliment
review:
The Uber app is functional for normal use, but it has two main issues currently..

1. There is no way to add a driver compliment after the initial rating.  I gave a driver a 5-star review and was in a hurry so I didn’t write a compliment.  I later tried to leave a compliment and there is no way.  If I choose to change the rating, I can only choose 1-5 stars, but after leaving 5-stars, I didn’t get any option to leave a compliment.

2. There is no way to contact a human for support.  There are only various forms for specific issues (e.g. item lost, or car accident), but no way to reach a human.

title: Please fix
review: This is my 2nd day in a row I had to throw my money and use Lyft instead, When I requested a ride the driver went farther and farther away from me and didn’t want to cancel I had to cancel on my end and they get the full ride for free!! The fee $6.30 it was only 2 miles so he got 6$ without actually having to take me there just because I canceled from my end when they refused to cancel themselves please make the app itself cancel the ride when the driver goes farther away from passenger and never picks them up and I would for the app to automatically look for another Uber when driver never me up and just goes further away from me

title: Increase bidding price
review: I recently tried to book a ride from the airport late at night. When I first booked the ride it was $17. Then while it was finding me a ride it then told me the new price was $22. I was stunned but I needed a ride so I accepted. Again while it was processing it went up again this time to $24. I realized that other people on my flight were also trying to get Uber’s and realized that Uber is not increasing the price even after you accept the ride to take the highest bidders. This is ridiculous. It reasons like this I ended up downloading Lyft and use it more often. Do yourself a favor and download Lyft. You sometime have to wait longer but they are always cheaper and I never have problems.

title: Bettee contact for Uber
review: My suggestion is that you guys come up with a better way for your loyal customers to reach you guys it’s ridiculous I think there should be direct customer service number or email for you guys also I would like to strongly add  if you could please put a option to change your phone number I can’t even use the app because whoever had my phone number before me had an account it would make it easier for people who have disabilities such as myself as well thank you for your cooperation I hope that you take this into consideration 🤗

review: I have used this app for a VERY long time. But it is way too lenient towards the drivers and not enough towards the paying customers. We flagged him down, we loaded the luggage and took right off. Where was the wait time? Is there any explanation when it was????? There would have been a 5 star rating instead of a 4 star.

review: This app is a money grabber. A 5-mile ride can be anywhere between $15 and $20 and if you pay for a ride and the driver cancels then YOU get charged a cancellation fee. Try looking for a support/customer service number online? All you’ll find is unhelpful links saying that you can contact support in the app(which is a lie) and the only number you’ll find is the number used to report Uber-related emergencies. I seriously have no idea why Uber would switch from a simple, convenient option to a far more cumbersome one. At least link it to my account so I don’t need to add my billing info every single time.

review:

I went online to report a tech issue, and there was no cause coding for this type of failure.  I requested a refund as I was unable to contact the driver. Uber needs other causes of missed rides...

title: Better than Lyft
review: I like Uber a lot and don’t have a car so I use it frequently, but I also have the Lyft app and decide whether I want to ride with Lyft or Uber based on price. Lyft tends to be more expensive because Uber has 40% off deals more often, and now has the Express feature that makes my rides much more affordable. The only reason I rate 4 stars is that the prices are still really high, but as long as Uber keeps doing deals like 40% off for 10 days, etc., I will continue to use it more often that Lyft and other competitors.

title: Good app, needs better settings / help
review:
I don’t use Uber often but it’s indispensable when needed.  Near the end of a recent trip I knew I wanted to leave a tip. Great ride, pleasant / professional driver, very clean vehicle, etc. But nowhere in the settings or help was there any info about tips. So I gave the driver a cash tip instead. 

Imagine my surprise / disappointment afterwards when the app prompted me to rate the trip & offer to leave a tip. I did leave the highest rating for the driver. But take away 1 star for the app. Please improve help screens and/or add a settings section for tips.

title: Resent update
review: I’ve been using Uber for a few years now and have never had an issue getting a ride. The app was updated 3 days ago and I haven’t been able to get rides since, it always say no cars available. I’ve uninstalled and reinstalled the app, made sure it was updated, I even restarted my phone thinking it was my phone and it still will not let me schedule a ride. Please fix. I use this app almost everyday to get to and from work.

title: Drivers are great, company is awful
review: The Uber Customer Support policy is not good. Lyft treats their customers much better in my experience. I’ve had both apps glitch and send my driver to the wrong location. I live in a city and so the streets are complicated. The app doesn’t always guess correctly where I am. When there was a problem with Lyft, they reimbursed my money to my bank account. Uber charged me a five dollar cancelation fee, then refused to reverse it when I let them know about the problem. After pushing harder they credited me a five dollar ride voucher, but that wasn’t enough to stop me from deleting the app. I feel that they just don’t really care about their customer’s experience when something goes wrong.

title: Was the best thing ever.
review: At first uber was a dream come true for my household. All last year uber would show up on time every time, now I can't get Uber to find my location to save my life😔 I ended up having to walk all the way home yesterday because of how careless the driver was yesterday. He didn't even try to locate me😡 I am in the same spot I was in last school semester, and I never had any issues. I don't understand the confusion now. Apart from being bad service it goes against the Americans with Disabilities Act. They should consider having their Uber Eats drivers swapping places with their regular drivers, the service is so much better! 
Would recommend everyone I know to switch to Lyft or a reliable local cab service immediately, no more using Uber unless there are immediate changes to stop this from happening to disabled people in future.

As a person who uses Uber to get to work, I depend on reliable arrival times, and although I leave room for mistakes, some mistakes can be consequential. It would be great to cancel the driver that made several mistakes and is costing you time, and to take your chances on a new driver, but to do so with Uber may cost you. Uber charges you a significant amount for canceling your driver, so beware of cancelation charges with Uber.

I was not ready to be picked up until 5:35am so I contacted the driver and told the driver that because my ride was scheduled at 5:35am, that I would not be at the pickup location until 5:35am. 
I arrived at the pickup location at 5:36am and was notified that the driver had canceled the trip and that I had to then schedule a whole new trip. 
I then had to wait 12 more minuets to get my next ride, when the driver was the one that showed up earlier than my desired pick up time that I had scheduled the night before. 
If this happens again I will continue to write one star reviews.

review: I use Uber daily to get to and from work. The two reoccurring problems I am having are: 1. When I request a time my Uber ends up getting to me too early causing me to pay a waiting fee or canceling because I’m just not ready being that they’re early. 2. I work on a military base and some how my location is off or my Uber gets confused and cancels. I have tried calling them ahead of time to inform them however some people don’t understand and cancels or they don’t answer their phone while driving.

review:
Hi! Thank you for the outstanding service I have received 98% of the time!
 I am highly allergic to smoke ad is my daughter! Yesterday a car picked up my daughter and I at the same location as this ride and it was saturated with cigarette smell! I immediately got sick with a severe headache and nauseous! My daughter felt the same repercussions.  Please please give us a tool to say no smoke filled cars are allowed!! Your no smoking in the car while driving rule does not cover all of us that suffer because the car already reeks of the smoke! Thank you to all of your amazing drivers!

title: Why the extra fee??

review:

Here’s my story...
I scheduled my 6:45am Uber last night in advance to get me to work, and today I woke up to a notification at 6:20am that said “Your Uber has been canceled due to insufficient funds”

That would be understandable... if I had insufficient funds.
But first off, Uber didn’t tell me that I had insufficient funds last night when I booked the Uber, and anyway, I had more than enough funds - they accepted my debit card (with currently over $300 in my account) as valid, and an acceptable and verified form of payment! 

So, in a panic at 6:25am, and potentially late for work, I booked a quick Lyft ride (using the “Lyft” app) and guess what...

They accepted my debit card (the same debit card) and I paid for my ride, a driver picked me up inside of 10 minutes, and I got to work on time!

So thanks Uber for almost screwing me over there, but don’t worry, Lyft had my back. I highly recommend Lyft, not Uber, because if Uber was my only choice to get to work, I wouldn’t have made it to work today.

Caused two cancellations by drivers a couple of days ago and one long wait by another driver. And a cancellation fee charge on top of that. Followed up by bad customer service after that. If another alternative service develops, I’ll be sure to jump.

title: If you've had a bad experience with Uber...
review: If you knew what drivers got paid and the minimum security and qualifications (essentially nothing) needed to become a driver...you should not complain about the driver directly.  Direct the issue to Uber for wanting to hire as many drivers as possible regardless of their competence.  And, there is no inspection of a drivers car in most major cities.  They even started allowing UberX cars to be as old as 2002.  That's 15 years old.  How many of you own 15 yr old cars, and if you do, is it a nice clean well maintained low mileage car that any stranger paying money would like to ride in?  Uber is a horrible company that has no morals and cares about nothing but making money.

title: cancelling orders and cars
review: uber does Not care about customers, or their drivers; they only care about squeezing out as much cash as they can. there is no reason that i shouldnt be able to cancel my order when it has literally been one singular minute since i submitted. obvious grab for cash & blatant disregard for customers. deleting the app & exclusively using lyft & doordash from now on. im now out 40$,,, evidently if an order is accidentally submitted you have about 15 seconds before the cancel option disappears. otherwise, uber just keeps your money! even when the delivery wont be here for over an hour! if you decide to download this app, enjoy having your time and money wasted regularly :)

I ended up downloading Lyft who is way cheaper and more reliable. I hate what Uber has become.

title: Easy recommendation
review:

review:

Frederick arrived on time but did not drive to the drive-up entrance to the hotel.  It was pre-dawn and I had to walk out to look at the car parked on the street to determine if it was even an Uber. 

Once inside we spent approximately 10 minutes driving around various city blocks. My uneasiness mounted. 
I asked if Frederick knew how to get to the airport and he said that he did but we continued driving in an erratic sequence of streets not following the GPS verbal instructions.  As we worked our way up to the Bluff Art District I asked him to return me to the hotel bcz I felt increasingly uneasy. 

He did take me right back and I paid him $20 for his time coming to get me. However, I do not feel I should also be charged even a small fee by Uber for a trip that did not succeed in getting me even in the direction of the airport. 

Please respond to this review. 
Thank you. 
Nancy Dean

His counterpart ...our second driver ...was just as good and suggested a solution to our parking problem!! Love these folks ... every company should be so lucky to have these gracious representatives executing such superb service for them with the public !
title: Wow!

review: I have been taking Uber for almost 4 years and I love using it but I wish they would fix their gps system! Sometimes when the drivers use the google maps I get there fast but when they use the regular Uber map it always takes forever! It’s like they choose the longest way possible. I have recommended some drivers to use google maps but some think they can’t use it. So Uber please fix your maps or tell the drivers to use google maps.
title: Great app but needs to improve the GPS!!

review: Poor girl Samantha Josephson was ruthlessly MURDERED late at night after using this app! Yes, she should’ve checked the license plate, but also you guys should remember safety first and REQUIRE all drivers to have a light up ‘uber’ sign inside of their vehicle! Especially when Uber’s are called late at night where you can not see who’s vehicle is the driver, you guys should most definitely provide that! For goodness sakes, stop asking us to sign a stupid petition about sales taxes or whatever. She had a whole life ahead of her and I don’t want to blame this app but I feel like most drivers I’ve been in DONT have that sign! Please do something about this it’s so scary.
title: Murder! The apps scary!

review:
Charles dropped us off at Napa Premium Outlets. Forty-five minutes later at one of the stores I heard “Joseph?” I turned around and there was Charles holding my small carry bag. I had left it in the car and forgotten about it. Charles had to have looked in 10 stores before finding me. It only had my wallet, credit cards, license, glasses! I can’t imagine how our vacation would have been without a courteous and conscientious Uber drive like Charles. 
Thank you again Charles!!
title: Over and Above!

review:
Rates are higher this yr. also, when requesting a driver. My cell told me arrival would be about 40 min later. Not true. I walked out to pickup area of airport & he was there much earlier in a different car then indicated from your driver confirmation (THAT NEEDS CORRECTED!!) Arrival time was great  BUT why was I charged .09 for waiting. $ not an issue, but that can cause many not to use Uber. 
Also, if I can request a route without tolls, so my rate would be less. How is that done? I am charged top $ before I confirm a driver. 

Patrick is a great driver and very professional!!
title: Rates

review:
I scheduled a ride to the airport 3 days in advance. No one showed to pick me up. I got no call or text, I was just left waiting. I tried calling Uber and they do not have a phone number, you have to email them within the app. I was forced to drive myself and pay for tolls and  parking at the airport which cost me a lot of money. Uber didn’t care at all. 
Also, do not try to use a gift card. They won’t use the gift card, they will just charge your account. 

I am not impressed with their customer service at all. It takes forever for them to respond, they do NOT have a phone number and I got stranded by them and hardly received an apology.

title: Don’t schedule a ride and expect to be picked up

review:
Uber provides a terrific overall service. Of course it has some issues here and there, but for the most part it’s pretty great. 

The app itself I believe is very user friendly and provides great options for the riders. One thing I would love to see is when the rates are unusually high, some sort of timeframe as to when they will go back to normal prices. That would be an awesome additional feature to the already awesome application.
title: Overall Great Service

review:
Me and my wife were caught in a dark place at midnight. We were riding a metro train that was supposed to go the full length of the route after special events at the AA center in Dallas. We found out when it was to late that the route was going half way. We got off in a dark parking lot in the middle of another city.

I started downloading the Uber while on the train, within 10 minutes We had a ride back to our destination.
title: Uber app is super easy to use

review:
The App is great and so is the service.  It would be good if we could use our computer to create/import contacts addresses.  I am using Uber more and more for work travel and having a list of locations would great and easier to select than switching back and forth between my contacts page and the Uber app. 

Is there a way for a small community to organize a Uber force to handle weekend events or to advertise into an Uber pool.

title: Frustrated

review:
Uber drivers are now abusing the chat system to ask where you’re going, and if they’re not happy with your answer they cancel on you. Worst of all, because the ride was cancelled you can’t submit any complaint about the driver who did that. I’ve tried and received the same cookie cutter response many times. 

This is on top of how wait times are usually much longer than the app states when you’re planning on getting a ride. I’ve often waited for a very long time in the freezing cold because I was told the driver is 2 minutes away, only to end up waiting sometimes even 15 minutes before the driver actually arrived. 

In summary there are many unprofessional drivers in Uber’s system and as a customer your options are very limited when it comes to alerting Uber about this, and for that reason I don’t see how anything is going to change. 

I recommend using other services. I feel the wait times are more accurate and drivers are generally more professional.

review:
Seriously it’s almost 2018, and the GPS system Uber has, is the worst. I can NEVER get picked up at my house I have to walk all the way out of my complex and stand out in the cold every morning at 5am because I cannot COUNT how many times I’ve been 20+ mins late for work because the driver couldn’t find it, wouldn’t answer their phone or text messages. I’ve never received a refund for any of my late/trashy rides, not to mention it takes 4+ hours for their customer service to answer anything. 
Just tired of hating Uber because it’s better than the bus but seriously, like you guys need to fix this app.

title: Abominable customer service
review: I can’t verify if all the negative rumors about the stunts that Uber pulls off behind the scenes are true. But what I can judge is this: when I request a trip Uber always displays very optimistic pick up times. The moment a driver is assigned, pick-up double or triple. Then there is their customer service. The app is designed in a way to discourage riders from contacting customer service. If I have an issue it’s usual not trivial and does not fit any of their preselected issues. I pick the one that matches best and then always get dumb canned responses that have zero relevance for the issue I raised. To the point that it’s easier to get my money back via bank chargeback than via their customer service.

title: No respect for your time or money
review: I’ve used Uber for several years and although the drivers tend to be friendly, this company has no respect for its customers. It lies about rates and takes advantage of people in a pinch. Even when you reserve ahead of time - and the app assures you that the price is locked in - they’ll still up charge you by a substantial amount of money with no warning. In my case, for a 30 minute drive, the price goes from the promised $45 to over $250. They are greedy and don’t care about taking care of their customers - only ripping them off for the greatest amount possible. Pick any other ride-share company than this one. You’ll be better off.

title: Can take forever to find a ride - Not for emergencies
review:
Uber drivers should NOT be allowed to set their own price—as they double what is the regular price for just a few blocks. There has to be a set money cap for distance.
I was going down a few blocks to my workplace, $10—said the estimation. Then as i’m awaiting a driver for them to pick, the drivers want to range the price up to $35.
I live in Koreatown, Los Angeles—hitching an Uber to PACOYMA is $30 —somehow going down a few blocks by USC should strike a value of $30?
Yeah, you got me messed up.
Some of these Uber drivers are straight up scammers..do not use this app in emergencies, as they will find away to push the price up $20 just for being grubby and incase of emergency you wont have the security of someone wanting to accept your price, you will simply be out an extra $20 because you needed to get to work, or maybe you were in what could be a suspicious situation.
Lyft. Use lyft. It can be cheaper, and they actually find you a ride in a timely manner.

review: I went to cash out and made 91 but was only able to take out 62 and they gave me the excuse of 48 hrs now 32 is basically gas nothing more or less. So I’m calling today because they will auto pay within that falling pay cycle and that didn’t happen. I have been put down n hold three times for up to 10 minutes for a 30 dollars . This is absolutely the first time this happened but when we as drivers aka employees get a complaint false or not we get immediate response. Corruptorations of America we the people need to stand up now. Uber is not the only criminals but they are definitely criminals 4.99 rating lol pat on the back while they waste money to turn the world

title: Awesome app- would love ‘smoke-free’ ride option
review: With the exception of a few gps confusion issues, this app and service have been extremely convenient and fairly priced.  The safety features are fantastic.  One thing I would love to see, which would improve the experience greatly, is a smoke free ride option.  The smell of cigarettes and ‘other’ smoking products make me sick to my stomach on a good day, much more so sitting in the back of a car on winding and/or bumpy roads.  Add a 90+ degree day, and it’s awful.  Please consider adding this feature, Uber.

title: Jump Scooters
review: I am having such a difficult time with the Jump Scooters and bikes in San Francisco that I’ve lost  a good amount of faith in the app as a whole. I’ve talked to people via customer support, and they’ve been helpful about giving me information concerning refunding some of my trips, but I don’t feel as though I should have to wait 3-5 business days for a refund for every trip I take, don’t take (I still have pending bank charges for the “reservations” or initial 20 minutes that haven’t gone through), or attempt to take. It’s been a very stressful experience and I’m even hesitant to even use the app for ride sharing now.

review:
I’ve been using Uber for about 6 months now. There are definitely some metrics that Singapore needs to improve. 

Firstly, if I want to really be realistic about how on-time the uber cars arrive, I want to speak from my heart, that says never, but it’s more like 15%. If you have an important meeting, you best add 10-15min extra. And  put the phone down, because watching that little car move away from you, or around in circles, will drive you crazy. 
 
Secondly, the knowledge of the drivers’ city destinations are quite low. Don’t expect more than 50% to know where MBFC is, which is quite a prominent series of towers in the financial centre. 

And if you’re not from here, which I’m not, they will often ask me “here?” Unfortunately, I don’t know either, but I ask them to follow the “finish” flag on the map. 

So all in all, the app is still the same as in other cities - decent interface, easy to use, and have uber eats. But download Grab Taxi instead.

I’ve had drivers be scammy picked up someone else and charged me and refused to pick up my phone calls. A lot of drivers get lost and that makes me late for work. The Uber GPS loses signal in some parts of LA and that makes me late. The list goes on. All this time I’ve tolerated the unreliability, but now it’s super expensive. I’m done with Uber. title: Horrible experiences
review:
If you live in a city where there is a large amount of immigrants beware! There is a scam that these foreign drivers have perfected. You order the Uber then one of two things happen. 

1. They call you pretending to not understand English or your location. They pass you a couple of times even though you are flailing your arms about saying “yes, I see you, right here stop!” Now if that basic English cannot be understood, they should not be allowed to drive. 

2. You have the other drivers that circle around your area, don’t answer your calls then cancel the ride causing a cancellation fee. 

I lived off a major road where the entrance to my complex was big and extremely hard to miss. Also, I’m no bum. I am a respectable business woman. The time I was passed twice I was on my way to the airport wearing a business suit and $1000 coat. The unfair cancellation fees were never credited back to my account but the real frustration is having to go through all of the difficulties and stress just for what should be a simple process.
