If you accidentally fail to do so, which is easy to do, there is no way to have them easily credit you afterwards for the Uber cash you have.

Customer service seems to have no escalation system, which means, in effect, that if you are unhappy with the “canned” message your customer service agent gives you, there is effectively no way to appeal to a higher-level employee.

Clearly, ridesharing has changed the world and Uber is responsible! Congrats! For the visually impaired, getting around is a constant struggle. This app is not accessible for the visually impaired. Voiceover is the response that I get from Uber. Well, voice over is terrible and does not allow the user any privacy or dexterity when using the app.
Further, the Uber GPS is often not accurate. Accuracy is essential for visually impaired users. A car could be 75 feet away from us and we wouldn’t know it. Uber needs to take a serious look  (no pun intended) at accessibility.

review: The app is pretty reliable and easy to use for the most part. The only major issue is the apps estimate of the drivers current position, which is often inaccurate. At times the app has estimated the driver is several minutes away when in fact they are just pulling up, and at others it has estimated the driver is “2 minutes” away for several minutes. It would be helpful to have a more precise idea of where my driver is after I order an Uber.

When rating a trip or a food order, there is not even an option to describe any issues caused by a faulty app. They assume if you have an issue, it’s due to the driver or the restaurant or both; as if their own programming is flawless. title: New uber users!!!

review:
Uber has allowed hackers to gain access to your data by not taking basic steps to protect your information (they left personal data unencrypted and accessible to hackers). 

When the inevitable hack happened, Uber PAID THE HACKERS and then tried to cover up the hack by not notifying the authorities or their users, even though they are legally required to do so.

Uber was My main source of transportation for years! Not anymore. Lately Uber has been horrible. It takes me at least 15 min to get an Uber and then I’m charged almost double the price I used to pay. I have loved Uber for years but I am no longer a customer because of their inability to help me efficiently and effectively.

It’s always fun (NOT) to have a conversation with the drivers telling them I don’t live at the location on Uber’s map.  What’s even worse, if I sit in my house and enter my home address, it thinks I live somewhere else and wants to charge me $14 to take me to a location I don’t live.  This leads me to believe I’m paying $10 or more per trip just to get home.  

I would report this issue to Uber, but they don’t have a help category for this issue.  I also can’t find a general assistant email address for general inquiries. 

Therefore, I believe there are three resolutions to this problem.  1.  Write a bad review and someone might respond. 2.  Quit using Uber.  Or 3.  Buy some stock which would provide me with a bunch of contacts and then make someone’s life in Investor Relations hell until it’s fixed.

Bangladesh 
Tunisia 
China
Bulgaria 
Mexico
To name just a few...

Each person told us a little about themselves and we shared a little of our story. We all had a great time in the process. 
Engage the drivers and be interested, listen to understand and you’ll be amazed at how interesting the ride and the world can be. Thank you Uber and NYC for taking such good care of my wife and i and for making my baby girls experience so memorable. 

The Bueno’s

review:

review:

Uber ratings needs an overhaul.  They just announced that drivers must report why a rider isn’t a “5” Star... Went from a 3.9 to 3.82 after a trip.  Why?  Because I didn’t rate my driver a 5 because of their safety.  Regardless, it’s flawed.  I did nothing wrong on my end and yet retaliation for my rating means they get the opportunity to change my rating once they realized I rated them poorly.  Meanwhile, no process to dispute our own rating or see why the driver said we were less than a 5.  If I don’t leave a mess, smell, show up on time, and am pleasant, there’s no reason to rate otherwise, period. 

Uber shouldn’t allow drivers to go back and change ratings.  Not fair.  Rate the passenger and move on to next fare.

And when you finally do get a reply via email, it’s a cut and pasted generic reply to what you already knew and didn’t need to see repeated.  Like dealing with idiotic robots.

But then he went far beyond what was expected when he tried to help as my purse fell off my shoulder with my gate keys inside and I was locked outside the gate. My roommate miraculously showed up at the gate and was able to hand me my purse, but Reynaldo you were my hero that day!

review:
Non existent customer support

I tried using the app the next day and SURPRISE bugs on bugs on bugs for Uber eats and then I was met with an ACCOUNT DISABLED. I figured that I’d call Uber but NOPE there is no number. title: The driver canceled the ride and is charging me.
review: I ordered a ride the driver said I am in my way, then five minutes later called me she can not make it and canceled. So I took a taxi. When I was in the taxi the Uber driver called me and said I am in my way to pick you up and answered no needed because I already took a taxi. Two minutes later another Uber driver texted me I am in my way to pick you up and I responded the same then he charged me $9 dollars. What is this. They canceled and I have to pay for it? This is not fair and have happened to me more than three time and to my friends. Is Uber becoming and scam for thief drivers????. I need my $9 dollars back to my credit card.

title: emails
review: I’d give the app 4.5 stars if I could. The issue I have with Uber is that it sends me an email when the ride ends, asks me if I want to tip the driver, and then sends a second email if I tip with a new fare receipt. This is annoying more than anything. Otherwise I’ve never had any issues with the service and have had friendly drivers 90% of the time over the three years or so that I’ve used Uber. Fix the multiple receipt emails for one ride and I’ll rate 5 stars 👍

title: Lack of options is very annoying
review: I called an Uber pool for a friend and I, only to see that it would take 20 minutes to get picked up IN THE CENTER OF DOWNTOWN BOSTON. Out of a bit of frustration, I canceled the ride and ordered a new one because I was able to see that there were many cars that would be able to pick me up earlier. The new driver not only took just as long, but drove two blocks past me, forcing me to sprint to the car to avoid a cancellation fee. The driver then waited 10 minutes to tell me that I forgot to add a 2nd rider to the new ride and charged me the full price even after I willingly canceled the ride because I ordered the wrong type of car.

title: 4 Grateful Senior Citizens
review: Not knowing exactly how BART works, we found ourselves stranded at the Warm Springs Station (riding on the final train of the night) with our car parked at the Fremont station. Annette, our driver, picked us up at the curb within 4 minutes of our Uber request and expeditiously drove us to our car! She was charming and all of this happened at 1:30 in the morning, after three unanswered calls to Yellow Cab!! We’re calling Uber first next time!!

title: Too much waiting and walking
review: This evening I had to walk a few blocks to a pickup place and as soon as I ran across the street, the Uber driver left.  The car arrived to the pickup spot before I did. Perhaps if we know upfront how long the wait is and how far the walk will be ahead of time the customer can make a more informed choice. I don’t like this new way with stops like a city bus.  I was totally disappointed with the service.

review:

title: Cancelled trip?
review:
I requested a ride, but the street outside the hotel front door was under construction, so I walked to the intersection at the end of the building. After waiting 15 minutes at the corner after sending a message to the driver with my location, the driver cancelled me.  Not only was my ride cancelled while I was standing outside in windchill O deg weather waiting, but I was late for a dinner meeting and had to request another UBER driver.  To top it all off, I was charged $5 for a cancellation fee, when I didn’t cancel - the driver did!

I usually rate Uber drivers 5 stars and tip, but this non-trip was a 1 star, and I would expect a refund of the $5 cancellation, since I never cancelled!
